story:
Pet Healthy Hemp, Inc. Supports Pet Health for our Favorite Four-Legged Friends,

Especially During a Pandemic

Americans are now adopting and caring for more pets than ever

 

DALLAS (December 21, 2020)- Pet Healthy Hemp, Inc. is partnering with Pet Healthy Brands,  a leader in health-centric pet products, who together are continuing to innovate pet treats by providing the benefits of CBD hemp to pets during a time that more and more pet parents are spending time at home and with their pets as well as adopting additional companions. During 2020, about 33% more Americans have considered getting a pet now that social distancing is part of the social structure. Across generations, that rate is highest for millennials, who came in at 50%, versus Gen X, at 33%, and baby boomers, 25%, according to a survey from TD Ameritrade.

 

“We know that cats and dogs can absolutely lessen the feelings of loneliness and provide a sense of ease and companionship for so many people. Our goal has been, and continues to be, to provide pet parents the products that they feel good about giving to their beloved pets, and products that make the pets feel good as well,” says Walter Stock, CEO of Pet Healthy Hemp, Inc., based in Dallas, Texas.

 

According to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), along with the enjoyment they provide, pets offer a variety of health benefits, including: decreased blood pressure, lowered cholesterol levels, decreased levels of triglycerides, reduced feelings of loneliness, and increased opportunities for exercise. Most households in the United States have at least one pet.

Nutrition plays a very large part in the overall quality and wellbeing of pets across ages, breeds, conditions, and lifestyles.

“Recently, we have begun working with the infusion of CBD Hemp in Pet Healthy Brands signature products, and with the launch of Hemp Sprinkles, we can see the benefits of providing CBD hemp to pets in an easy way, “said Stock.  “With safety and quality taking a front seat, we are elevating something delicious and nutritious into something that will help pets who are benefited by the calming effects of hemp.  We have infused 1000mg per oz. of CBD oil into our new product with 28 servings in each 1.4 oz. bottle, making for flexible use with pets of all sizes.”

 

Product to be available: www.pethealthyhemp.com  

 

 

About Pet Healthy Brands

Pet Healthy Brands is a Dallas, Texas, based manufacturer of all-natural dog and cat treats. Our family of consumables includes healthy, flavorful goodies for both cats and dogs. We make the world's lightest cat litter, which also incorporates a wellness indicator and odor control. We are dedicated to producing the highest quality, most beneficial, gluten-free, nutritious, tasty products for our furry friends. We strive to deliver only the highest quality, natural and safe pet products.

story:
Short Summary

Da-a- Luz Oasis is a holistic midwifery school in southern Spain. Mel Scott, founder of Finley's Footprints, has joined us for the last 3 years, facilitating our baby loss module. It has become clear that there is a need for more support and choice after the death of a baby. We would like to fill this gap by offering an affordable and safe healing retreat for individuals and couples in the picturesque foothills of the Sierra Nevada, Spain.

To make this happen we need your help to build accommodation. Each camping pod will cost 700 Euros.

By donating to this campaign you will enable a unique form of support. This will bring peace and hope to grieving parents in a holistic and gentle manner.

What We Need & What You Get

We need 700 Euros to buy and build a fully equipped camping pod to be used for the retreats.

In return for your donation of;

7 Euros - A pebble painted, in your baby's name, which will be placed in our sacred garden.

12 Euros- A plant, which will be dedicated to your baby, planted along with a pebble in the sacred garden.

70 Euros- 2 Copper leaves, made by a local artist, engraved with your baby's name. One to be included in bespoke artwork within each pod and the 2nd leaf will be sent to you.

700 Euros- Name your pod, enjoy a relaxing  week holidaying in your pod. While here you can meet the artists involved in the project, paint and place a pebble and plant in the sacred garden.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can come and volunteer with us, help to complete the new eco build or landscape the surrounding gardens. You can donate building tools or materials, Food to feed our workers or share your wisdom.

Currently, there are over 69 people reported dead, including 2 rescue workers, nearly 1.7 million people affected by the Fuego Volcano near the city of Antigua that struck June 3rd.

My name is Antonio Almeda and im a social worker and im currently working to help as much as i can but there's a lot of people affected by the volcano and we really need your help to by food, medicine, water,etc.

Funds are needed to buy:

- Unprocessed foods, cooking items (oil, sugar, salt, etc)
- Water
- Face masks/gas masks
- Toilet paper
- Sanitary napkins
- Diapers
- Cotton balls
- Rubbing alcohol
- (Warm) clothes and shoes for men/women/children
- Blankets
- Personal hygeine products (soap, toothbrushes, toothpaste, towels, etc)

we really really need your help, also you can take a read on CNN news:

https://edition.cnn.com/2018/06/04/americas/gua...

https://edition.cnn.com/2018/06/04/world/guatem...

All the food and medicine will be delivered to shelters and hospitals to help all the poeple affected by the volcano.

I will be posting videos on my youtube channel about the food, medicine and everything so you can keep track of your donations.

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCjX8LDpwv70-Id...

story:
Short Summary

As college students who suffer from bouts of stress and anxiety, it is extremely important for us to share our knowledge and tools with others like us. Stress is a leading factor for many health risks, but education is vital for certain career paths. Why have to choose between your health and your education?

Thus, Self Care 101 was born. We are a group of 9 students at SIUE in a Communications course that focuses on having confidence in your creativity as well as your endeavors to improve the world around you through organizational communication.

By being a contributor to our subscription-esque, self-care package, you will be helping college students relax enough to focus on their studies and on their minds, so that they can create and build a better tomorrow for all of us.

Our box will include, but is not necessarily limited to, the following contents:

  • Bubble Wrap for popping stress on the go
  • A Bath Bomb/Bath Salts for a moment of relaxation
  • A Live Succulent for a zen environment
  • Peppermint Gum/Mints for focus
  • A Microwavable Rice Heating Pack for easing muscles
  • Organizational Sticker Sets for managing your planner or calendar
  • A Lavender Candle for calming your space
  • A Stress Ball for managing work place struggles
  • A Guide to Managing Stress and Anxiety for alternative methods to get you through your day

What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking $1300 dollars in funding for Self-Care 101. This will pay for approx. 50 boxes to have in our inventory to sell to consumers. The funds will also go into packaging and perks to thank you all for donating. This also includes a deficit for card declines and extra unknown fees. 

Some of our perks for being a contributor include a relaxing playlist, our cool decal, free smoothie coupons, stress balls, a "Stay Focused" package, and a chance to be the first to own our unique product!

If we do not reach our goal within a month, all contributors get their money back!

The Impact

If you donate, you could be the first to receive this one-of-a-kind product. You could be helping many, many college students find new ways of bettering their health, lowering their stress, and providing alternatives resources to aid them in their self-care quest as well.

By donating even a $1, YOU could be responsible for helping the next student relax enough to excel in medical field and maybe cure cancer! Or an English major write the next Great American Novel! Or an Engineering student build the next robot to make our lives easier! 

And it may just all start with a little lesson from Self-Care 101. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some of you may not be able to contribute, and that is okay! You can still help our cause!

Please like and share our IndieGoGo Page on social media.

Also, follow us on Facebook for more updates on our journey.

@selfcare101team

story:
On July 19th, 2018 a tornado devastated Marshalltown, Iowa. This tornado damaged businesses and homes throughout the community. Unfortunately, we were not spared. The roof of our production facility was partially destroyed and through a series of events (too long to list), we are now left in a spot where we have to relocate our local foods production facility to a new location. We are Iowa Choice Harvest. 

We are passionate about providing a larger scale source for local foods all year round, supporting farmers through providing a market place for crops that they would not usually raise, and bolstering Iowa's local food system.  ICH is the only processing facility of its' kind in the entire state of Iowa AND the only food plant offering custom services to small food companies to help them become successful.  Our products are second to none, because we care about taste and nutrition rather than yield.  But Iowa Choice Harvest isn't just about products - we're about helping our communities become more sustainable, our bodies healthier and more resilient, and our earth cleaner for generations to come. 

Our history - in 2006, thirteen farmers began planning a new company that would help expand opportunities for Iowa farmers to market their fruits and vegetables. These farmers had a strong belief in crafting a local food system that would provide a fair value to the farmer while producing a quality product for Iowans. After much planning and hard work, we launched our new company in August of 2013.

We're asking you to be part of the movement - vote with your dollars, here or at the stores, to keep local foods within reach, to help farmers diversify, to create a sustainable future for our state, for our world.  The easiest way to make your voice heard is by making a donation and/or sharing this campaign on social media. Thank you for taking the time to read our story, please consider joining us in the fight for local foods!

story:
Grace City is a  congregation located in Northeast Philadelphia with a consistent vision of the renewing power of the Gospel. 

Jesus says in the gospel of Matthew that his people collectively are like a city.

“You are the light of the world. A city on a hill cannot be hidden.” Matthew 5:16

The reason this city cannot be hidden is because it’s on a hill and it’s full of light. You can’t hide light. It’s just there. It shines. Revealing. Protecting. Warming. Like the telephone pole lights that line our city blocks—God’s people are a city that illuminates the world.

Jesus also says that this city of light must let its light shine by doing good works that glorify the Father in heaven.

That’s the vision of Grace City Church. We want to be what Jesus calls us to be—a city within this city, that’s for the city, shining the light of God’s mercy, love, and grace in such a way that God’s fame spreads and the people of this city encounter the renewing power of Jesus Christ.

Whether you are a committed follower of Jesus, have questions about Jesus, or you’re skeptical about Jesus—we invite you to join us at Grace City and see what God is doing to spread his fame and renew the lives of ordinary people like you & me. Grace City Church of Wissinoming is dedicated to providing a bright future for all of our fellow man. God has blessed us so that we may bless others. 

 

With your donation, we can send our team of 10 to Puerto Rico to begin our work in helping with the Hurricane Maria relief effort. We're kicking off our long term commitment to help the Humacoa community with an assessment trip this March to survey, research and assist in any construction.

story:
Camp Millbrook's future Centre will be a destination for those seeking information on medicinal plants, a place for visitors to discover their ancestral connection to Jamaica and a wellness destination for retreats. The Centre will be located in the heart of Jamaica's history of emancipation from slavery.

Primary focus of this campaign is to establish an infrastructure to house a Centre that will include space for research teams, visitor information on the history of the area and a wellness destination for retreat participants. Ultimately the research conducted here will lead to the crafting of nutraceuticals for commercial distribution as well as ancestral mapping for those seeking information about the links to Jamaica. Employment opportunities will assist an entire community who currently live a marginal lifestyle and many young people leave their homes in search of work in the cities. The Centre will employ not only tour guides and facilitators but also the local farmers.

Richard Wright, the driving force of this project, began his dream at the age of 9. He was born in the Tangle River area and dreamt of how to create a sustainable economy for local farmers and how to heal people mind, body and spirit. He went to St Lawrence University in New York, worked in the mental health field and then became an entrepreneur owning a private health care service company. His return to Jamaica 12 years ago began the journey of manifesting his dreams to reality. Richard's education and entrepreneurial skills blend to move this dream ahead. A project of this scale requires more than one determined man ...it requires a community.... it requires YOU! Richard has been networking and interested parties are ready to commit, only after the Centre is built though.

Investors will be rewarded not only in their contribution to a community economic strategy but if you donate $500 or more you can stay at Millbrook's resort at a discount of...book 5 days and pay for only 3 and enjoy an extended tour of Camp Millbrook's. http://milbrooksresortmontegobay.com/ Donations of $100 would include naming your favourite animal on the property. Each contributor of $10 or more will have their name on a plaque at the Centre honouring your support.

This campaign is phase 2 of a long term vision. Phase 1 included the purchase of an area of 300 acres that include clearing a meadow area, building a basic bunk house, toilet and parking area. Trails have been cleared to safely move through the mountainous jungle where study of unique geological formations can be viewed and access to the caves are the jewels at the end of the trail. A site has been cleared for the Centre that would house the research building and a rudimentary road has been built. This campaign will fund an environmentally conscious building and a better access road. The building will be a moderate size of approximately 100 x 200 feet, will access the local water source and utilize alternate energy for electricity.

If the target is not fully reached, the first priority of this funding campaign will be improving the road access. In kind and volunteering for construction or marketing support can be discussed with Richard as to the perks dependent on contribution. All monies are for infrastructure improvement on the land.

The site is currently generating limited income as a destination for private tours that showcase Jamaican history. The land is where the Maroons fought battles and found shelter from the English. The trails that have been built to the caves add to the multi purpose long term income potential for historic, geologic and botanical enthusiasts and researchers to take tours and conduct studies.

Phases 3 and 4 will include phase 3 where local farmers will be employed to plant and harvest the medici nal plants for commercial sale to the nutraceutical manufacturers. Phase 4 will include the expansion of technology in the Research section of the Centre and it will showcase the history of the area including a DNA extractor for visitors to trace ancestral links to Jamaica including Afro-Caribbean, the Irish who were amongst the early slaves, the English and other gene pools of Jamaica's past. Phase 5 will be the final goal of treatments for international clients to access the research evidence based treatments. Millbrook's Resort will be connected to Camp Millbrook for those seeking healing through the botanical nutraceuticals and the customized retreats. Retreats will include significant time at the Camp where one's mind, body and spirit can align with ease in an environment such as Camp Millbrook.

story:
Wild Harvest – School of Self Reliance

Wild Harvest’s mission is to empower you to provide for yourself and your family using the resources around you. Future-proof your family by learning traditional skills  reconnect with the natural world and your creative potential and join one of our courses or retreats.

Courses in Traditional Skills and Rural Crafts

Learn traditional skills such as basket weaving, leather work, rag-rugging and more. Unlock your creativity and work with your hands to create beautiful, useful household items. De-stress, meet new people and learn a new skill.

Self-Sufficiency Training Courses

 

About the founder

Raised on the North-East coast by her Grandfather, Di Hammill was taught the value of simplicity, make and mend and traditional remedies. Despite an unconventional upbringing Di went on to study at post-graduate level and has completed numerous courses in psychology, philosophy, adult education, Steiner and mainstream childcare, crafts and bio-dynamic farming. In 2006, under the instruction of Patrick Whitefield she completed the full Permaculture Design Certificate and also holds the Adult Ed. Lecturers Cert. and Youth and Community Worker Qualifications. Being fully insured and C.R.B checked she has, through her business Wild Harvest undertaken walks and workshops for various organisations including the Forestry Commission, The Country Living Magazine, the National Parks, Adult Education Services, various Food Festivals, The Edible Garden Show’s Good Life Live and the WI Centenary Show at Alexandra Palace. She has raised her own children TV-free and off-grid in a remote North Yorks dale, collecting firewood, foraging and bathing in the river, even lining the children’s wellies with roadkill rabbit fur, she has lived the ultimate self-sufficient life. Di has been the subject of a handful of press articles about her lifestyle and is passionate about raising awareness of the need to re-skill and become more self-reliant. She is working towards her black belt in Tae Kwon Do, winning gold in the 2015 Ladies Lightweight section, can partially service her own car and loves learning! Reviews of her teaching talk of her as calm and patient yet enthusiastic and knowledgable. Wild Harvest recently beat York Racecourse to Highly Commended in the Visit York Visitor Experience of the Year Awards.  We dont own the farm we run now and are at risk of losing it due to development, we have a permanent base we can use in 4 acres of woodland but need help to set up, in exchange come and join us!

How your donation will be used

We offer courses/stays there in exchange for a small donation you will get  attendance at our UK course venue on a course to the value of your donation, For a larger donation you'll be able to attend our retreat in France.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Here is what I am trying to do:

I have long been a lover of nature. I’m an avid hiker, trail runner, and lover of our natural world. Currently, I am wrapping up training to become a volunteer hike leader for the San Diego Natural History Museum.

I am a dietitian by trade, and my interest is in nutrition for well-being and healing, along with the psychology of nutrition and behavior change.

I believe that there is a strong connection between nutrition and our connection with nature, and I want to provide a service that combines the two.

My goal is to become a certified forest therapy guide through the Association of Nature and Forest Therapy. 

Sure, I could likely develop my own forest therapy program without official training, but in our society of licensing, certifications, and proof of authenticity, I feel that it would be best for me to attend what I have found to be one of the only training programs for this specialty, should the industry grow and one day require me to have the certification.

As this certification is expensive, and requires travel, I am hoping to raise the money to cover tuition and travel expenses for Forest Therapy Guide certification, along with tuition for the required Wilderness First Aid certification. The Forest Therapy Guide certification will consist of a week-long on site intensive training (location determined when I am accepted), followed by 6 months of practicum completed from home, with a mentor and small cohort.

I want to provide an opportunity to connect deeply with nature, from the hour long walk in an open space within the city, to an overnight or weekend retreat in the local mountains. I want to share everything I learn to promote that experience of peace, healing, connection and self-love, among other things. 

I think this training will blend well with my expertise in nutrition. I want to make the world a better place. I want to change lives. I think that nutrition and nature is the answer. 

 

Here are the amazing benefits of spending time in nature:

Research shows that time in the forest lowers salivary levels of cortisol, lowers sympathetic nervous system activity, while increasing parasympathetic activity, lowers blood pressure, lowers heart rate and increases Natural Killer Cells. One study showed a 50% increase in Natural Killer Cells after 3 days in the forest. This increase lasted a month. Natural Killer Cells play a role in fighting cancer and strengthening our immunity.

What does this all mean?

It means that the natural environment can help to manage hypertension, stress, depression, and greatly enhance our immune system.

Phytoncides are compounds emitted by trees, and plants in the forest (and also by some vegetables, fruits, spices, such as the sulfide and allicin in garlic), and have long been used in Eastern medicine. This is one thing that we have teased out of nature that positively affects our health. But there are other things about the natural world that are beneficial to our health, maybe some that aren’t tangible. Take, for instance, one study that links the sight of green forest to shorter hospital stays.

Just as there is a common understanding that the nutrients we receive from food are far superior than what we receive from a pill, nature will never successfully be bottled. There is a symbiotic relationship between us and nature, understandably; we evolved together.

Beyond all the scientific studies, I feel it is just common sense that we understand the importance of our connection to nature.

As cities grow and technology develops, we become more and more disconnected with nature. I am not against this growth and development, as this is also a natural occurrence. But we are not robots. We need life to give us life. That life comes from the food we eat, and the natural world. 

 

Here is what you will receive if you support me:

I have set up several "perks" for donations between $25 - $500. I am eternally grateful for everyone's support. Please see the "perks" section for options. 

If you are unable to donate, but believe in me and my cause, please share this campaign on your social media, and with all of your networks. I greatly appreciate it!

Short Summary

This is a fundraiser for PENTAGON KINO's birthday on the 27th of January 2020 and an opportunity for Universe to celebrate Kino's birthday while also opening our hearts and helping out children in need. It's a well-know fact how much Kino loves children and how much he has contributed himself to charities and projects, which is how the particular campaign was chosen on.

The money will be donated through the Korean G Foundation  (지 파운데이션), a trusted website that CUBE has made donations through before as well. The specific campaign money is collected for, is for support for undernourished children (결식아동 후원). The one-time donation for all collected money will be made through their official website (https://donation.gfound.org/)

story:
If you've spent much time in the 7th Ward, you've probably met Miss Aubry. She's a friendly, loving, high-spirited person, who gives an incredible amount of love to her community. During the difficulties of COVID, Miss Aubry has had many challenges keeping stable housing and a job. 

We're raising money for her to pay off debts owed to the New Orleans court, and to secure her housing and basic needs for the next three months so that she's able to focus on her health and securing a stable job. We are trying to raise this money within two weeks so she can pay off the court as quickly as possible. 

Miss Aubry is also on the hunt for a job in cleaning or dishwashing- feel free to reach out if you have any leads for her on jobs! 

Her neighbors and friends are so grateful for any support we can provide for her in this hard time! Please share far and wide! We can also accept funds via Venmo: @Rachel-Nelson-96

story:
Hello There!

My name is Aaron Eisman and I am the author of "The Evolution of Sports Social Media." I was born and raised in Los Angeles, where I currently reside. I grew up loving sports and watching various sports on TV with my Dad and Brother. I am a huge Dodgers, Broncos and Clippers fan, as well as a lover of golf. Not to mention, I've traveled to over 20 countries, including lived in Barcelona for 5 months. I am a major foodie and love baking as well.

Sports Social Media Experience

After graduating from Indiana University with a Journalism degree, I accepted my first position as a social media editor at Turner Sports. I was part of their first social media team working on accounts like NBA on TNT, NBA TV, March Madness and PGAcom. In late 2015, I moved up to New York City to work for Bleacher Report as a social media programmer. There I got involved with the daily posting to all our main channels, as well as coordinating various departments on social media execution.

After my experience ended at B/R, I wanted to move back to LA and accepted a position with the NFL. For the 2018-2019 season, I ran NFL Network's social media channels. It gave me the opportunity to work for one of the top professional leagues in the world. After the season ended in June 2019, I decided to start my own consulting agency, Eisman Digital. I help athletes, sports agencies, startups, technology companies and various other organizations grow their social media channels and following. Feel free to contact me via Aaron@EismanDigital.com for more details! Also, go to www.EismanDigital.com for my full services.

Over the last year, I interview over 100 people in the sports industry to find out the best stories, secrets and need-to-know information on sports social media. I even give my inside tips on how to grow a following, the strategy you need to be most successful and more! I interviewed people like JaVale McGee, Hunter Pence, Leigh Steinberg (the real Jerry Maguire), Dave Meltzer among others. If you love sports marketing, social media or just sports, than this is the book for you!

Why I'm Raising Money

I'm raising money for my book because I incurred over $5,000 of expenses to create the perfect book on sports social media. I spent money in the publishing process including editing, interior formatting, marketing and more. Even the video I created above, wasn't cheap. I am raising money to recoup the fees I incurred to created my first book.

Also, a portion of the money I raise over this campaign will go to the Concern Foundation, a charity dedicated to Cancer Research. My Aunt and Uncle have been associated with the Concern Foundation for a long time.  I am putting money towards this charity because my dad was diagnosed with Esophageal Cancer in June. He had to undergo chemotherapy and radiation in July as well as a major surgery to repair his esophagus on September 1st. Currently, he is recovering at the house and making major strides each day.

Please not only give money to my campaign because of recouping the major costs I incurred, but also help me give back to a charity that means a lot to me and my family. 

Your support is greatly appreciated!!

What We Need & What You'll Get

Your support in pre-ordering this book means the world to me, as I’ve paid upfront money to many partners (including Palmetto Publishing) that have helped me create and publish my book.

This pre-order campaign will help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

Editors – I’ve worked with a Developmental Editor, who helped enhance the overall style of my writing from the very beginning, chapter-by-chapter; a Copyeditor who read the book line-by-line to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication; and a Proofreader who took one final pass before sending the manuscript off to the printing press!

The Cover Design – I’ve worked with a cover designer to create my dream book cover! 

The Layout Design – For the interior of my book to fit the correct dimensions of a hardcover, paperback, and ebook.

The Launch & Promotion Efforts – I’m working with an incredible PR agency, a digital creator for Instagram/Twitter videos, and more to help get the word out about my book leading up to my publication date this November.

Perks

I am raising $6,000 in this campaign for two reasons: Help me with the costs I incurred over the last year and help me raise money for the Concern Foundation. The funding will really help me out personally as well as change lives due to the cancer research that is being done by the Concern Foundation to better the world. 

Some of the unique perks include:

  • A softcover, hardcover or ebook version!
  • A personally signed book with a special note
  • A 30-minute social media consulting session
  • A one-hour consulting session or speaker session at your class, conference, etc.
  • Every perk comes with an Esophageal Cancer (Periwinkle) bracelet too!
  • More limited services and gifts!

If I don't reach the goal, my funds will still go towards the book and even potentially helping me with the costs of writing my second book! Also, the Concern Foundation would really appreciate any money we can raise for their charity. I still plan to give back as much as I can to help this noble cause.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share my Indiegogo campaign link with your followers! Using the Indiegogo share tools to make things easier.

Please tag me so you can help amplify my efforts!

Tag me on social media when you share this campaign! 
Instagram - @Asiegaleisman / @EismanDigital
Facebook - Aaron Siegal-Eisman [personal FB] / Eisman Digital [FB page] 
Twitter - @ASiegalEisman / @EismanDigital

LinkedIn: Aaron Eisman

Thanks so much in advance for your donation to my Indiegogo campaign! I really appreciate it!


Cheers, Aaron Eisman

story:
Hello, I'm Patrick and I'm back with my second children's book 'A Witch & A Wizard' and would really appreciate your support in raising funds to bring it to life...

‘A Witch and a Wizard’ is the fantastical tale of a young boy called Tom, whose inquisitive nature gets the better of him, when one night he peeps through his Dad’s telescope and spies the couple next door dancing and chanting around a magnificent fire. So beautiful are the sounds he hears, he is spellbound by their magic. Believing the couple to be a modern day witch and wizard he sets off on a journey of discovery to investigate further...

Beautifully imagined by Serbian illustrator Natasa Jovanic, 'A Witch & A Wizard will fill the hearts of young readers with excitement and delight...

This beautiful 48 page hardcover book will be printed on uncoated papered and includes 20 full page hand drawn, full colour illustrations. The book will be available in both English and Spanish.

IMPORTANT:

To get your copy of ' A Witch & A Wizard' be sure to select the perk "Get the Book!" on the menu to your right!

Having successfully crowdfunded my first children's book 'The Two Loves of the Buttercup' back in 2017. I had imagined the second one to have come about sooner, but such is life... a return home to Ireland, becoming a daddy for the first time to a baby boy called DraÍocht (Irish for Magic) and the setting up of my own coaching practice have all taken priority. Not to mention a global pandemic!

So against all the odds here it is and I couldn't be happier with it!

So enjoy a little verse... Tom's introduction to the mysterious Sapphire (the cat) for the first time.

'Sapphire dear, this is young Tom.

He's come to pay us a visit but won't stop too long.

Sapphire grins in her inimitable style.

Meow, meow, young Tom, what an inquisitive child.

It's a story about what happens when you learn to follow your heart and step into the unknown...

What We Need & What You Get

Self-published hardback books must be printed in bulk to make them the most economical. With the funding I raise from this campaign, I will prepare and place a bulk order of 1000 books, as well as other goodies I will be giving away through this campaign. Here is the general cost breakdown:

Illustrations (€3,500)

Design/Layout (€300)

Printing of 1000 books (€4000)

Publishing Costs / ISBNs / Barcode (€150)

Other, to-be-determined costs include the production of the giveaway postcards and e-books, shipping, Indiegogo listing fee, and marketing of the book. 

The Impact

Meeting my funding goal will jumpstart the self-publication process and allow contributors to get their hands on a signed copy of the book before it's made available to the general public. Funds raised beyond €8000 will go straight towards printing fees for additional hard copies of the book. 

Risks & Challenges

This is my second time to publish a book, I've got an amazing network of experienced and talented people behind me. Natasa has completed the illustrations, the layout has been finalised and the printer has the files.  Everything is set, and ready to go... 

My major priority is shipping a high quality book to my backers, so barring any unfortunate printing disasters we anticipate the book will be in your hands in mid November, just in time for Christmas...

Other Ways You Can Help

I hope you are as excited about 'A Witch & A Wizard' as I am, and are eager to support it. Of course, you may be excited but unable to contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help!

Crowd-Funding is driven by word of mouth. If you find this project worthy, please help us get the word out by sharing this campaign page.

Indiegogo makes this even easier via its share tools! Check them out!
story_txt:
Hello, I'm Patrick and I'm back with my second children's book 'A Witch & A Wizard' and would really appreciate your support in raising funds to bring it to life...
‘A Witch and a Wizard’ is the fantastical tale of a young boy called Tom, whose inquisitive nature gets the better of him, when one night he peeps through his Dad’s telescope and spies the couple next door dancing and chanting around a magnificent fire. So beautiful are the sounds he hears, he is spellbound by their magic. Believing the couple to be a modern day witch and wizard he sets off on a journey of discovery to investigate further...
Beautifully imagined by Serbian illustrator Natasa Jovanic, 'A Witch & A Wizard will fill the hearts of young readers with excitement and delight...
This beautiful 48 page hardcover book will be printed on uncoated papered and includes 20 full page hand drawn, full colour illustrations. The book will be available in both English and Spanish.
IMPORTANT:
To get your copy of ' A Witch & A Wizard' be sure to select the perk "Get the Book!" on the menu to your right!

Having successfully crowdfunded my first children's book 'The Two Loves of the Buttercup' back in 2017. I had imagined the second one to have come about sooner, but such is life... a return home to Ireland, becoming a daddy for the first time to a baby boy called DraÍocht (Irish for Magic) and the setting up of my own coaching practice have all taken priority. Not to mention a global pandemic!
So against all the odds here it is and I couldn't be happier with it!
So enjoy a little verse... Tom's introduction to the mysterious Sapphire (the cat) for the first time.
'Sapphire dear, this is young Tom.
He's come to pay us a visit but won't stop too long.
Sapphire grins in her inimitable style.
Meow, meow, young Tom, what an inquisitive child.

It's a story about what happens when you learn to follow your heart and step into the unknown...
What We Need & What You Get

Self-published hardback books must be printed in bulk to make them the most economical. With the funding I raise from this campaign, I will prepare and place a bulk order of 1000 books, as well as other goodies I will be giving away through this campaign. Here is the general cost breakdown:
Illustrations (€3,500)
Design/Layout (€300)
Printing of 1000 books (€4000)
Publishing Costs / ISBNs / Barcode (€150)
Other, to-be-determined costs include the production of the giveaway postcards and e-books, shipping, Indiegogo listing fee, and marketing of the book. 

The Impact
Meeting my funding goal will jumpstart the self-publication process and allow contributors to get their hands on a signed copy of the book before it's made available to the general public. Funds raised beyond €8000 will go straight towards printing fees for additional hard copies of the book. 

Risks & Challenges
This is my second time to publish a book, I've got an amazing network of experienced and talented people behind me. Natasa has completed the illustrations, the layout has been finalised and the printer has the files.  Everything is set, and ready to go... 
My major priority is shipping a high quality book to my backers, so barring any unfortunate printing disasters we anticipate the book will be in your hands in mid November, just in time for Christmas...

story:
The year is 2121. The apocalypse has been and gone. Amidst the ruins of the old world, what is left of the human race fights for survival against gigantic, hyper-evolved Kaiju. Humanity's most effective weapons against the monsters are the colossal Mechs developed by the Guardian Programme.

RONIN 47 is a brand new interactive science fiction novel, inspired by the Legend of the Forty-Seven Ronin from Japan. In this adventure gamebook - a multi-path book, very much in the style of Choose Your Own Adventure or Fighting Fantasy Gamebooks - you direct the course of the story, deciding which routes to take, which perils to risk, and which of the monstrous creatures and rogue mechs you will meet along the way to fight. RONIN 47 will be the seventh title in the ongoing ACE Gamebooks series.

One hundred years into the future, following an attempt to genetically re-engineer coral to make it more resistant to climate change (using something called the K Compound), Earth has been overrun by what are effectively, if accidentally, man-made Kaiju. Society has collapsed and groups of people exist in isolated bubbles around the world.

One of these pockets of humanity is Ako Base, a heavily-fortified and well-defended island community in the Philippine Sea. Squads of mechs operate out of the facility, tasked with keeping the tide of ever-evolving Kaiju at bay.

In RONIN 47, YOU take on the role of Commander Oishi, a Samurai-class mech pilot and leader of Phoenix Squad. When Deputy Director Kira turns traitor, killing Director Asano and stealing the new prototype Shogun-class mech, only YOU are left to pursue the villain and bring him to justice, battling all manner of mechs and mutated monsters along the way.

Mech designs by Neil Googe.

Throughout the course of the adventure, YOU decide which path to take, which risks to brave, and even which of the strange creatures you will meet along the way to engage in battle.

Success is by no means certain and you may well fail to complete the adventure at your first attempt. However, with experience, skill, and maybe even a little luck, each new attempt should bring you closer to your ultimate goal.

But whether you succeed in your quest, or not, will be down to the choices YOU make.

Mech and Kaiju Size Comparison Chart.

In addition to the book itself, you will need two six-sided dice, or a conventional pack of 52 playing cards, a pencil, an eraser, and a copy of the RONIN 47 Adventure Sheet (spare copies of which will be available for download from www.acegamebooks.com).

RONIN 47 is available to backers of this Kickstarter in three different formats - eBook (which will include hyperlinks), paperback, and a special, limited edition, signed, collector’s hardback.

Mock-up of the cover for the limited edition collector's hardback of RONIN 47. (Not final artwork.)

The gamebook contains an introduction, all the rules you need to play, the adventure itself, a host of illustrations, and an Adventure Sheet for recording your stats as you work your way through the story.

Rewards on offer to backers include signed hardbacks, custom dice and playing cards, and exclusive art prints, as well as a unique slipcase edition that includes both a paperback and a signed hardback copy of the book.

The collector's hardback will include artist's sketches and designer's notes presented in a special bonus chapter at the back of the book, and colour artwork - if we hit Stretch Goal #5!

And everyone who pledges to receive a physical reward (in other words, from the SAMURAI level reward and above) will also receive a collectible ACE Gamebooks pin badge.

My name is Jonathan Green and I am an experienced author, editor and game designer, with more than 70 published books to my name. However, I am probably best known for my Fighting Fantasy adventure gamebooks, as well as YOU ARE THE HERO - A History of Fighting Fantasy Gamebooks, and my Pax Britannia steampunk novels. RONIN 47 will be my 23rd published adventure gamebook.

Adventure gamebooks written by Jonathan Green.

RONIN 47 has already funded on Kickstarter and is more than half written, but I need your help to make it the very best book it can be, with full colour artwork by some of the best comic book artists in the business.

The adventure already includes fifteen full-page illustrations and other filler images by Neil Googe. Neil is an incredibly talented artist, best known for his work in comics, although he also works in commercial illustration and concept development.

His work for the UK anthology comic 2000AD - and its sister title The Judge Dredd Megazine - which includes Judge Dredd, Survival Geeks, and Hondo-City Justice. In the US, he has worked for DC Comics, drawing the likes of Wonder Woman, The Flash, Harley Quinn, Injustice, and Wildcats. As one of the co-founders of the British independent comic publisher COM.X, he is also the creator of Bazooka Jules.

Some examples of Neil Googe's comics bookwork.

I am delighted that he has agreed to illustrate RONIN 47, and, as you can see, he has already made an excellent start on the illustrations for the adventure.

However, I really want to be able to offer backers a book full of Neil's glorious illustrations with colours by Len O'Grady.

The Daikaiju 'Ryujin', as drawn by Neil Googe and coloured by Len O'Grady.

A host of international comics talent has kindly agreed to provide pin-up art pieces for the collector's hardback, in the form of further Stretch Goals, including Simon Fraser (Nikolai Dante, Judge Dredd, Hershey, Kingsman), Chris Weston (Indigo Prime, Judge Dredd, The Invisibles, Lucifer, The Authority, Batman), Roberta Ingranata (Witchblade, Robyn Hood, Van Helsing vs Frankenstein, Penny Dreadful, Grimm Fairy Tales), Richard Elson (Pacific Rim, Kingdom, Feral & Foe, Atavar, Sonic the Comic), Anna Morozova (Anderson: Psi-Division, Viva Forever, Tharg's Future Shocks, Tales From the Black Museum), Alex Ronald (Doctor Who, Marvel Comics, Judge Dredd), and Corin Howell (Shadow Service, Transformers, Star Wars, Back to the Future, Star Trek, The X Files, Wonder Woman, Ghostbusters International).

Examples of work by Simon Fraser, Chris Weston, Roberta Ingranata, Richard Elson, Anna Morozova, Alex Ronald, and Corin Howell.

Please check out the rewards on offer and pledge your support today. And even if you're not able to support the project yourself, I would really appreciate it if you could help get the word out and make some noise about RONIN 47. Remember, you can use the Indiegogo share tools to help!

 

Risks & Challenges

I am an experienced author with more than 70 published books to my name, including 22 gamebooks. As a result you can be sure that I will see this project through to the end. I also have a formal contract with award-winning UK publisher Snowbooks Ltd to publish this book, pending the outcome of this Kickstarter.

And of course the book has already funded on Kickstarter, so you will definitely receive your mech-vs-kaiju ACE Gamebook after the campaign funds.

story:
Hello Indiegogo Community,

Who couldn't use a dash of fresh inspiration to spark our minds and our days? We have just the thing, and it's coming by the boxful! 

About Our Decks

Indie publisher Turtle Point Press continues our popular oracle deck series with two new decks featuring the words of the great visionary poets Lucille Clifton and William Butler Yeats. Each deck features 78 cards with short quotes lovingly selected by Pulitzer Prize-winning poets Tracy K. Smith and Paul Muldoon. The flipside of the cards have unique color designs that reflect the poets' spiritual interests: for Clifton, a vintage Ouija board, and for Yeats, a Celtic pattern from a tarot deck that Yeats himself designed.

  • These oracle decks will:
    • Offer words to guide, inspire, memorize, provoke, and answer life questions
    • Bring the wisdom of beloved Black poet Lucille Clifton and dazzling Irish poet William Butler Yeats to people far and wide
    • Pair the interests of poetry lovers and spiritual seekers in a format that appeals to both 
  • Contributors like you will:
    • Help support the creation, production, and shipping costs of these decks 
    • Help sustain an award-winning small press that's been influencing the literary landscape for more than 30 years.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We Need: Our goal is to raise $15,000 to help cover our costs
  • You Get: The chance to collect some or all of our oracle decks--perfect as gifts for others or  for yourself--and to support an inspiring project
  • Deck Details: Includes 78 custom designed cards printed with inspiring quotes, how-to instructions, origins of the deck, and display stand, in a beautiful cigar-style box 

Risks & Challenges

Rising paper costs, supply chain troubles, and stresses of these times have made this an unusually tough time to produce and ship materials like our decks. Without your contributions, we can't see this project through without significant financial strain.

Turtle Point Press has been finding ways to keep doing what we do and to maintain our high standards despite obstacles for many years. We've recently turned to fundraising and direct sales to boost our bottom line, but this is our first crowdfunding venture. We're counting on it to pull us through this challenging year.

So pick up our oracle decks, the most inspiring gift of the season, and let's make this a success all around! 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, you can still make a difference. Please support our efforts by:

  • Sharing our campaign online and through Indiegogo's tools
  • Connecting with us on Instagram and Facebook @turtlepointpress and @TurtlePPress on Twitter

Thank you!

story:
**We hit our first stretch goal! All campaign backers will receive a free gilded Devil's Death bookmark!**

Hello Friends! Thanks for checking out my campaign! I'm Shiva - a writer, artist, Priestess and Ordained Minister of The Satanic Temple. In 2020, just as COVID hit, I released my first book - The Devil's Tome: A Book of Modern Satanic Ritual. I was overwhelmed and encouraged by the support it received and the explosion of interest around ritual practice. It resonated with so many people during this time of uncertainty and chaos. Many of the questions I received from readers were around rituals for death and grief. During this time, loss was all around me, and I saw a need to create a resource for our community. Thus, I  began my journey to understand how we, as Satanists, can embrace death and grief.

Photo by Courtney Brooke

As non-theistic Satanists, I think we’re uniquely positioned to acknowledge and confront the topic of death. Many of us even have been captivated by it - we understand the frailty of our time on earth and commit to live full lives. We see death as an inevitable and ever present aspect of lives and don’t have illusions of an afterlife to comfort us. So what can we do to help us cope with the passing of loved ones? How do we comfort others? What practical steps can we take to prepare ourselves for the end of life? How do we maintain our body's inviolability and navigate the medical and funeral industry? How do we incorporate ritual into our Satanic death work?

The Devil's Death: Your Satanic Companion for Grief and Dying explores all of these questions and more. This one-of-a-kind resource was created to help Satanists navigate death and grief.

Like The Devil's Tome and my later creation The Devil's Deck, I am creating a limited first-edition fully illustrated printing that will serve as an art piece as much as a resource. The books will be fully illustrated by Alexander Corey (illustrator of The Devil's Deck and The Devil's tome) and myself. This printing will come in two forms, each limited to 111 signed and numbered copies:

 

This limited edition book is heirloom quality. It has a black leather cover and gold foil stamping on the cover and spine. It contains a custom bookplate on the inside that will be signed and numbered. It is limited to 111 copies.

This limited edition paperback has a black on black cover. The cover design and spine are foiled black on top of the matte black cover. It contains a custom bookplate on the inside that will be signed and numbered. It is limited to 111 copies.

The Devil's Death: Your Satanic Companion for Grief and Dying will help you prepare for the end of life and assist you when you experience the loss. This book that can be used by those approaching the end of life, those who want to plan for it, those grieving from a death, and caretakers.

The Devil's Death: Your Satanic Companion for Grief and Dying will cover a wide-range of topics including:

  • How to approach death and find comfort through a non-theistic Satanic lens
  • Creating your own concept of 'A Good Death'
  • Creating your own end of life plan
  • Rituals for death and grief, including how to create your own funeral ceremony
  • Plant and herbal allies for death and grief
  • How to care for yourself through grief
  • How to deal with the death of abusers
  • Understanding your end of life options
  • Preparing Advance Directives
  • Protecting your bodily autonomy and advocating for your end of life rights
  • Practical tips and tools for navigating the medical and funeral industries
  • How to share your end of life wishes with your healthcare team, friends, and family
  • How to support others at the end of life
  • How to support loved ones through grief

 

The Devil's Death: Your Satanic Companion for Grief and Dying is a revolutionary book that shares not only practical guidance and best practices, but personal experience. It brings together a number of creators to birth a unique resource that will benefit Satanists as well as the broader secular community. 

In addition to serving as a Priestess in my community, I draw on my career in the healthcare industry which included patient advocacy, clinical-translational research, evidence-based programming, and creating programs to improve the quality of patient care. To further my knowledge and explore end of life tools and resources and be able to share best practices with the community, I became a certified death doula. Together, these experiences provide a practical foundation for the book. I wanted to create a book that would speak to our experience as Satanists, leave out the platitudes, and be honest about the often messy and controversial aspects of grief and death care. In addition to sharing my wisdom gained as a ritual practitioner, death doula, and healthcare worker, I will also share my personal stories about death and grief including how I have dealt with the deaths of my abusers. 

Understanding the need for this book, I partnered up with Betty Lee, a PhD biologist, clinical-translational researcher, Satanist, and advocate for personal autonomy in healthcare. Facing a serious and incurable medical condition, Betty set out to plan for her own secular funeral but found insufficient resources. Together, we have embarked on a journey of self-discovery as we have crafted this book and explored the concepts of death and dying from a secular, Satanic perspective. I asked longtime collaborator Alexander Corey to bring his incredible artistic vision to the book, and community herbalist Heather Mourer of Hedgewitch Holistics to contribute a section on plant, potion, and herbal allies for death and grief.

 

The Altar Cloth

The Good Death altar cloth can be a lovely addition to your practice. The altar cloth is 21x21 inches and will be printed with metallic gold ink. It's decorated with my sigil representing the power that comes from an acceptance of death and rebirth and the beauty that can be found within it. It can be used for your mourning altar, or incorporated as you like into your practice. The altar cloth comes with The Altar Packages, The Good Death Packages, The Underworld Package, and The Lucifer Package.

 

Foundations of Folk Medicine-Making Digital Zine

Heather Mourer contributes a section on herbal allies for death and dying in The Devil's Death, and this zine is a great companion. This zine can help you on your journey to stock your herbal medicine cabinet by providing instruction in folk methods for herbal teas, tinctures, infused oils, salves and more. In addition to step-by-step instructions on several herbal preparations, the zine also provides recipes for some of her favorite formulas. Once the book ships, you'll receive a digital download to the zine. Foundations of Folk Medicine-Making will come with The Altar Packages, The Good Death Packages, The Underworld Package, and The Lucifer Package.

 

The Signed Print

I've put together packages that feature my Good Death illustration. Each 8x10 print edition is limited to an edition of 13 and are signed and numbered by the me. The prints are available in The Good Death Packages, The Underworld Package, and The Lucifer Package.

 

Custom Ritual Products

As part of The Underworld Package I'll include a collection of custom ritual tools made just for you. I'll work with you to create candles, incense, oil, and/or bath products that are catered to your needs, purpose, and preference.

 

The Deluxe Ritual Kit

The Lucifer Package includes a custom ritual that I'll create for you and accompanying custom ritual products. 

Order Add On - The Devil's Tome

You can add on a gilded paperback version of my first book, The Devil's Tome: A Book of Modern Satanic Ritual, signed by me to any order for $30 (that's a discount from retail price!). The book just won The Satanic Temple's Anatole France Award for Contemporary Satanic Literature

 

If you like this project but can't contribute, you can help a ton by sharing my Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, TikTok and Instagram + anywhere else as well as with your friends, family (they need to learn more about Satanism, right?), and network. Please use #thedevilsdeath and tag me (@shiva_honey @serpentinaeofficial)

You can easily share my Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Hello Friends! Thanks for checking out my campaign! I'm Shiva - a writer, artist, Priestess and Ordained Minister of The Satanic Temple. In 2020, just as COVID hit, I released my first book - The Devil's Tome: A Book of Modern Satanic Ritual. I was overwhelmed and encouraged by the support it received and the explosion of interest around ritual practice. It resonated with so many people during this time of uncertainty and chaos. Many of the questions I received from readers were around rituals for death and grief. During this time, loss was all around me, and I saw a need to create a resource for our community. Thus, I  began my journey to understand how we, as Satanists, can embrace death and grief.

Photo by Courtney Brooke
As non-theistic Satanists, I think we’re uniquely positioned to acknowledge and confront the topic of death. Many of us even have been captivated by it - we understand the frailty of our time on earth and commit to live full lives. We see death as an inevitable and ever present aspect of lives and don’t have illusions of an afterlife to comfort us. So what can we do to help us cope with the passing of loved ones? How do we comfort others? What practical steps can we take to prepare ourselves for the end of life? How do we maintain our body's inviolability and navigate the medical and funeral industry? How do we incorporate ritual into our Satanic death work?
The Devil's Death: Your Satanic Companion for Grief and Dying explores all of these questions and more. This one-of-a-kind resource was created to help Satanists navigate death and grief.


Like The Devil's Tome and my later creation The Devil's Deck, I am creating a limited first-edition fully illustrated printing that will serve as an art piece as much as a resource. The books will be fully illustrated by Alexander Corey (illustrator of The Devil's Deck and The Devil's tome) and myself. This printing will come in two forms, each limited to 111 signed and numbered copies:

 This limited edition book is heirloom quality. It has a black leather cover and gold foil stamping on the cover and spine. It contains a custom bookplate on the inside that will be signed and numbered. It is limited to 111 copies.

This limited edition paperback has a black on black cover. The cover design and spine are foiled black on top of the matte black cover. It contains a custom bookplate on the inside that will be signed and numbered. It is limited to 111 copies.

The Devil's Death: Your Satanic Companion for Grief and Dying will help you prepare for the end of life and assist you when you experience the loss. This book that can be used by those approaching the end of life, those who want to plan for it, those grieving from a death, and caretakers.
The Devil's Death: Your Satanic Companion for Grief and Dying will cover a wide-range of topics including:

How to approach death and find comfort through a non-theistic Satanic lens
Creating your own concept of 'A Good Death'
Creating your own end of life plan
Rituals for death and grief, including how to create your own funeral ceremony
Plant and herbal allies for death and grief
How to care for yourself through grief
How to deal with the death of abusers
Understanding your end of life options
Preparing Advance Directives
Protecting your bodily autonomy and advocating for your end of life rights
Practical tips and tools for navigating the medical and funeral industries
How to share your end of life wishes with your healthcare team, friends, and family
How to support others at the end of life
How to support loved ones through grief

 

The Devil's Death: Your Satanic Companion for Grief and Dying is a revolutionary book that shares not only practical guidance and best practices, but personal experience. It brings together a number of creators to birth a unique resource that will benefit Satanists as well as the broader secular community. 
In addition to serving as a Priestess in my community, I draw on my career in the healthcare industry which included patient advocacy, clinical-translational research, evidence-based programming, and creating programs to improve the quality of patient care. To further my knowledge and explore end of life tools and resources and be able to share best practices with the community, I became a certified death doula. Together, these experiences provide a practical foundation for the book. I wanted to create a book that would speak to our experience as Satanists, leave out the platitudes, and be honest about the often messy and controversial aspects of grief and death care. In addition to sharing my wisdom gained as a ritual practitioner, death doula, and healthcare worker, I will also share my personal stories about death and grief including how I have dealt with the deaths of my abusers. 
Understanding the need for this book, I partnered up with Betty Lee, a PhD biologist, clinical-translational researcher, Satanist, and advocate for personal autonomy in healthcare. Facing a serious and incurable medical condition, Betty set out to plan for her own secular funeral but found insufficient resources. Together, we have embarked on a journey of self-discovery as we have crafted this book and explored the concepts of death and dying from a secular, Satanic perspective. I asked longtime collaborator Alexander Corey to bring his incredible artistic vision to the book, and community herbalist Heather Mourer of Hedgewitch Holistics to contribute a section on plant, potion, and herbal allies for death and grief.



 
The Altar Cloth

The Good Death altar cloth can be a lovely addition to your practice. The altar cloth is 21x21 inches and will be printed with metallic gold ink. It's decorated with my sigil representing the power that comes from an acceptance of death and rebirth and the beauty that can be found within it. It can be used for your mourning altar, or incorporated as you like into your practice. The altar cloth comes with The Altar Packages, The Good Death Packages, The Underworld Package, and The Lucifer Package.
 
Foundations of Folk Medicine-Making Digital Zine

Heather Mourer contributes a section on herbal allies for death and dying in The Devil's Death, and this zine is a great companion. This zine can help you on your journey to stock your herbal medicine cabinet by providing instruction in folk methods for herbal teas, tinctures, infused oils, salves and more. In addition to step-by-step instructions on several herbal preparations, the zine also provides recipes for some of her favorite formulas. Once the book ships, you'll receive a digital download to the zine. Foundations of Folk Medicine-Making will come with The Altar Packages, The Good Death Packages, The Underworld Package, and The Lucifer Package.
 
The Signed Print

I've put together packages that feature my Good Death illustration. Each 8x10 print edition is limited to an edition of 13 and are signed and numbered by the me. The prints are available in The Good Death Packages, The Underworld Package, and The Lucifer Package.
 
Custom Ritual Products

As part of The Underworld Package I'll include a collection of custom ritual tools made just for you. I'll work with you to create candles, incense, oil, and/or bath products that are catered to your needs, purpose, and preference.
 
The Deluxe Ritual Kit

The Lucifer Package includes a custom ritual that I'll create for you and accompanying custom ritual products. 
Order Add On - The Devil's Tome

You can add on a gilded paperback version of my first book, The Devil's Tome: A Book of Modern Satanic Ritual, signed by me to any order for $30 (that's a discount from retail price!). The book just won The Satanic Temple's Anatole France Award for Contemporary Satanic Literature


 

If you like this project but can't contribute, you can help a ton by sharing my Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, TikTok and Instagram + anywhere else as well as with your friends, family (they need to learn more about Satanism, right?), and network. Please use #thedevilsdeath and tag me (@shiva_honey @serpentinaeofficial)
You can easily share my Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Indiegogo functionality notes:

  • To view the perk description, click the box once. To buy, click twice.
  • Unlike with Kickstarter, you can't upgrade perks. If you'd like to select multiple perks, just check out multiple times and select a different perk each time.
  • If you're planning a large group order, contact me and we can discuss bulk discounts and combined shipping.
  • In order to keep up with the tumultuous price shifts of the current shipping market, I won't be collecting shipping fees until the books are printed and ready to mail.

UPDATE 22 OCT 21: I've raised the cost the facsimile and the prestige translation, and added new perks accordingly. The cost of the conventional books remains the same.
 

tl;dr

We're crowdfunding a new translation of Meyer 1570 by a professional German translator, and it will be free to use for the whole community when it's done. We're selling ebooks and physical copies to cover the costs, and also producing a full facsimile of the painted Meyer. Book options include:

  • Just the translation (hardcover, softcover, or ebook)
  • Transcription and translation side-by-side (hardcover or softcover)
  • Separate book of illustrations in color and B&W (hardcover or softcover)
  • Detailed facsimile
  • Prestige edition (translation laid out like the original book and constructed like the facsimile)
 

Background

My name is Michael Chidester. I started HEMA in 2001, and since 2010 I've been leading a project called Wiktenauer. Wiktenauer grew out of a desire to set the text of our fencing manuals free from the page and put it into the hands of fencers. In 2019, I started a venture called HEMA Bookshelf with a different objective: to put the page, and the whole book, into your hands as well. To date, we've produced three gorgeous facsimiles of 15th century manuscripts.


Fiore and Talhoffer facsimiles (Photo cred: David Rawlings)

This project is the first joint venture between these two projects: we're going to produce a a complete, professional translation of Joachim Meyer's famous printed treatise of 1570.

Meyer is by far the longest of the early German treatises, and is the most popular 16th century source in HEMA. But getting an English version has been harder than it sounds. The first Meyer translation project was launched by Mark Rector in early 2000, but he only got as far as a partial transcription. Mike Rasmusson picked up the torch in 2002 and put a partial translation of the sword section on Schielhau.org, but he never continued either. (This is the translation currently on Wiktenauer.) This inspired Jeffrey Forgeng to try his hand, and he authored a complete translation in 2003, ultimately publishing it in 2006. This book was hugely popular, but within five years the entire print run sold out and it became impossible to get. When a second edition finally came out in 2015, it likewise sold out within a few years.

But even if Dr. Forgeng's translation were easy to get forever, what we really need in order to grow the community is a translation that's free for everyone to read and practice from, and also to edit and remix and post on Facebook and quote in YouTube videos, all without the worrying about copyright.

So that's what we're going to make.


Title page from the University of Leipzig copy

What We Need & What You Get

I've hired Dr. Rebecca Garber to author the new translation. She has previously worked with HEMA Bookshelf on the Talhoffer Companion Volume, and a longer biography is below. She's already halfway through the book, currently working through the rapier section, and we've been running her translations past various Meyer scholars and instructors for feedback once she finishes them.

In addition to Dr. Garber's translation, I've spent the first half of the year slowly transcribing the entire book, and you can now find this transcription on Wiktenauer.

Meyer's book is incredibly long, so creating this translation will cost $12,000. On top of that, we need to pay for editing, layout, printing costs, advertising, and so forth. That's why we're coming to you.

To cover this bill, we will be selling the new transcription and translation in a variety of formats. These books will also include a lengthy introduction and historical background contributed by Chris Vanslambrouck, captain of the Meyer Freifechter Guild, and Roger Norling, Editor-in-Chief of HROARR.

The Reading Edition (translation only)

This will be a smaller format sized to carry around and be comfortable to hold in one hand (royal quarto, 6.14 x 9.21 in). It will contain the translation along with black and white illustrations. This comes in ePub, softcover, and hardcover.

The Study Edition/Dual-Language Edition (transcription and translation)

This will be a larger format, either A4 or 8.5 x 11 in. It will consist of a two-column setup with the transcription and translation side-by-size. It will not include illustrations (or if it does, only small black and white ones at the back), but will be designed as part of a 2-volume set with the illustration book.

The Visual Reference (illustrations only)

This will include all 69 of Tobias Stimmer's original prints at their original size, and also the full set of painted prints from the University of Leipzig’s copy at 150% of their original size. Alongside these illustrations will be tables indicating all of the references to each one in the text, including the page numbers in Meyer’s book, the Reading and Study Editions, and Dr. Jeffrey Forgeng’s 2006 translation, as well as the name of the play or description of the action. (This will be substantially similar to The Illustrated Meyer, so you can buy the Study Edition separately if you already own that.)

A New Facsimile

HEMA Bookshelf has promised and delivered quality replicas of historical manuscripts at affordable prices. To support this project, we're going to produce our first facsimile of a printed book: Joachim Meyer's Gründtliche Beschreibung der... Kunst des Fechtens. There are 28 known copies of this book, and the one we're reproducing is the gorgeous Leipzig University copy, including its original hand-painted, full-color illustrations and 16th century binding.

In addition to using the high-resolution scans of this copy as a basis, I will be visiting the Metropolitan Museum of Art on New York to consult their copy of the 1570 and study its construction in order to create the best replica possible. (Details of other copies found during the ongoing Meyer Location Project may also sneak in.)

This facsimile will be our longest yet (460 pages), with every detail as close to the original as possible. That includes blind-tooled leather covers reproducing the design of Leipzig copy, including Lucretia and Justitia, and the pages reproduced in every detail on cotton rag pape in the correct quire structure. The result will have the look and feel of an actual historical artifact.

The Prestige Edition (translation only)

If facsimiles aren't your thing, we're trying something brand new with this project. Since Meyer is ultimately a printed book, we're going to take Dr. Garber's translation, lay it out page-by-page the same way Thiebolt Berger did in 1570, and then print it and bind it using the same materials and methods as the facsimile. We'll also include the painted Leipzig illustrations, of course. The result will be the most gorgeous HEMA translation you'll ever own.


The rear cover to the University of Leipzig copy.

The Impact

This project has two objectives. One is obviously to publish new books and to add something beautiful to the world that didn't exist before. That's the reason HEMA Bookshelf exists in the first place.

The other is to create a translation and then give it away. It will be posted on Wiktenauer in its entirety under a Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike license. This means you'll be able to use it however you want to, forever (as long as you credit Dr. Garber and Wiktenauer, and as long as you make no claims of copyright over it). You'll be able to distribute it to your students (or your teachers), and you'll even be able to publish your own version of it if you want to.

At Wiktenauer, our guiding philosophy is that the treatises belong to all of us. They're part of our cultural heritage as humans and the foundation of everything we do in HEMA. We respect the copyrights of others but ultimately, Wiktenauer's main mission is to give the treatises away for free. This project will help us further that goal.

If people we don't know and have never met are able to study Meyer because they stumbled onto this translation, then Wiktenauer will have succeeded at its mission.


Text and illustration from the University of Leipzig copy.

Risks & Challenges

The risks of this project are minimal. HEMA Bookshelf has published three facsimiles and four conventional books at this point and we know the ropes. We're not trying anything particularly different with these, so the main risk is the ever-looming threat of covid-related shutdowns, which have caused months of delays in past projects.

The challenge we face is raising enough money to pay for the translation and editing. In order to keep prices down, our margins on the books and facsimiles are never as large as most publishers expect, but if we sell about as many as in past projects we should be okay.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute to this project, please spread the word anyway. We received about 400 orders each for the Talhoffer and Fiore facsimiles, and about 275 for Lecküchner, so let's see if there are at least that many Meyer enthusiasts out there!

Please share this campaign with your clubs, with your friends, and on social media!

About the Translator

Rebecca L. R. Garber received her PhD in German Languages and Literatures from the University of Michigan in 1999, with a specialization in Medieval Studies. She taught for 3 years at Wayne State University and then at a private high school before turning to translation as a full-time occupation. After joining a stage combat troupe in Michigan in 2006, she began translating combat manuals with CHEMAS (the Cambridge HEMA Study group), where her expertise in Medieval German and Latin was more useful than in most aspects of modern life. Her previous published HEMA translations include “Florius de Arte Luctandi” (with Kendra Brown) in The Flower of Battle of Master Fiore Furlano de’I Liberi, and the Copenhagen Talhoffer manuscript in Alte Armatur und Ringkunst, the companion volume to HEMA Bookshelf's facsimile. These translations can also be found on Wiktenauer. She has also worked on MS I.33, Codex Wallerstein, Paulus Hector Mair, and Jörg Wilhalm for private use.
