story:
Humans are Weird: We Took a Vote

 

"If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything."

— Mark Twain

The best science fiction is 95% real life. If you keep your characters real, if  you keep their reactions and relationships close to what you have personaly observed in the world around you, you will have to depend on your pure imagination. In short, write what you know. Humans are weird, and we all know it, we have all seen it. How will this little fact affect how our alien friends see us? 

Betty Adams lives in a particularly damp and remote corner of the Pacific Northwest and, like a hobbit, enjoys visitors so long as she knows them in advance and knows when they are coming. She was born sometime last century and will likely die sometime this century. She works winters on a small organic research farm when not writing and spends most of her time herding eccentric genius scientists (she is absolutely certain cats would be easier) with the help of her Great Pyrenees mix. Summers she spends nomadically wandering the Pacific Northwest in search of material for her stories and a regular paycheck for a biology major (she is reasonably certain those are on the Endangered Species List). She has several works published in the National Park Internal Database which may or may not be classified documents.

In the words of that immortal  bard, Samuel J. Snodgrass, "Make 'em laugh!" I wanted to spread some joy in the world and after years of trying this, that, and the other I discovered I had a talent for pointing out the absurdity inherent in the everyday life of humanity. 

So let's capture that sense of wonder.

Quilx'tch wonders why the human is fishing in a river, with no fish in it...

Commander Fifty-seven Clicks wonders why in the name of the mother swarm would a human continue to work with a displaced rib?

A Shatar Botanist has to wonder what the human wants one of her banana trees for if he doesn't plan on eating the bananas, and what does this have to do with his matrial art? 

Second Sister wonders why she ever left her Father's hive....

 

Have YOU ever wondered what happens when Monty Python meets Star Trek? 

Satisify that curiosity! 

Your contribution will bring that laughter to fruition. I will publish a paperback version and an electronic version of ~ 38,000 words of the fully edited  and compiled works and ~ 12,000 previous unseen words. My goal is to write full time and if we meet the stretch goals I will be able to do that. 

Imagine a cozy cabin in the woods. Just the author, a big old dog, a cup of tea sending a tendril of steam into the air, and the steady tic-tic-tacing of the keyboard churning out more stories for you to read. You cannot find me. You cannot trace me. But you will get the fruit of my labors on a regular basis! 

You will laugh! 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

We need to pay the printers. That is going to cost around $1400

We need to pay shipping and fulfillment which will cost another $1000

We are going to fund the art, editing, and various costs of the next book in the series which will be another $1000 before printing begins.  

The author would also like to buy some things so that is the final $100

You get laughter! Joy! That special feeling you get when you find that package you have been waiting for sitting on your front step! The first perk is our chuckle-inducing E-book.  The second perk is a paperback. You will evenutally get the author read audiobook If we get to the stretch goals we will look at things like posters, stickers, postcards, all with the fantastic original art commissioned just for this project. 

If we don't reach our entire goal  we will take stock of the situation. If there is enough to print the books we will get them printed and sent off. If not, we will send out the E-books and will get contributor feedback on if you want refunds or postcard art consolation printings. 

The Impact

Right now I am that author working a day job and squeezing in writing between gigs. Funding this will enable me to achieve my goal of a little cabin out in the woods with a full time career making people laugh through my written words. Funding this will enable me to turn tea into joy as well as putting food on the table of several printers, editors, artists, and ….what do you call fulfillment service types? 

For as long as humanity has had records we have recorded two things. Humans desperately need a laugh, and humans are the things most worth laughing at. I offer up this plate of wholesome laughter, hopping to make your day a little easier. This is my bison sketched on the wall of my cave, my etchings on the Rosetta Stone. Let them laugh. 

I have successfully funded and published a full length novel in 2015 "Dying Embers" BE WARNED. That is a very different book if you are curious about it. There is laughter in it, but it is entwined with a broken heart. 

There is so much pain in the world. I can't get rid of the pain, but I can make 'em laugh! and I want to do my small part to make a better world. 

Risks & Challenges

There will always be risks and challenges when publishing a book. We might not get funded. A storm might flood the distribution center literally or figuratively. This I can promise you: I will do everything within my power to make sure that this book lands on your doorstep as soon as possible. 

I have done it before and I will do it again. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

Get the word out and make some noise about the campaign. Share the campaign on social media. Tell your Aunt Gertrude about it. Do an interpretive dance about the wrong broom in school! (or don't depending on school tolerance for nonsense). 

Use the Indiegogo share tools to make your life easier (in relation to this book, Indiegogo makes no promises about the rest of your life)!

Now go buy that book!
story_txt:
Humans are Weird: We Took a Vote
 
"If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything."
— Mark Twain
The best science fiction is 95% real life. If you keep your characters real, if  you keep their reactions and relationships close to what you have personaly observed in the world around you, you will have to depend on your pure imagination. In short, write what you know. Humans are weird, and we all know it, we have all seen it. How will this little fact affect how our alien friends see us? 
Betty Adams lives in a particularly damp and remote corner of the Pacific Northwest and, like a hobbit, enjoys visitors so long as she knows them in advance and knows when they are coming. She was born sometime last century and will likely die sometime this century. She works winters on a small organic research farm when not writing and spends most of her time herding eccentric genius scientists (she is absolutely certain cats would be easier) with the help of her Great Pyrenees mix. Summers she spends nomadically wandering the Pacific Northwest in search of material for her stories and a regular paycheck for a biology major (she is reasonably certain those are on the Endangered Species List). She has several works published in the National Park Internal Database which may or may not be classified documents.
In the words of that immortal  bard, Samuel J. Snodgrass, "Make 'em laugh!" I wanted to spread some joy in the world and after years of trying this, that, and the other I discovered I had a talent for pointing out the absurdity inherent in the everyday life of humanity. 
So let's capture that sense of wonder.
Quilx'tch wonders why the human is fishing in a river, with no fish in it...
Commander Fifty-seven Clicks wonders why in the name of the mother swarm would a human continue to work with a displaced rib?
A Shatar Botanist has to wonder what the human wants one of her banana trees for if he doesn't plan on eating the bananas, and what does this have to do with his matrial art? 
Second Sister wonders why she ever left her Father's hive....
 
Have YOU ever wondered what happens when Monty Python meets Star Trek? 
Satisify that curiosity! 
Your contribution will bring that laughter to fruition. I will publish a paperback version and an electronic version of ~ 38,000 words of the fully edited  and compiled works and ~ 12,000 previous unseen words. My goal is to write full time and if we meet the stretch goals I will be able to do that. 
Imagine a cozy cabin in the woods. Just the author, a big old dog, a cup of tea sending a tendril of steam into the air, and the steady tic-tic-tacing of the keyboard churning out more stories for you to read. You cannot find me. You cannot trace me. But you will get the fruit of my labors on a regular basis! 
You will laugh! 
 
What We Need & What You Get
Break it down for folks in more detail:
We need to pay the printers. That is going to cost around $1400
We need to pay shipping and fulfillment which will cost another $1000
We are going to fund the art, editing, and various costs of the next book in the series which will be another $1000 before printing begins.  
The author would also like to buy some things so that is the final $100
You get laughter! Joy! That special feeling you get when you find that package you have been waiting for sitting on your front step! The first perk is our chuckle-inducing E-book.  The second perk is a paperback. You will evenutally get the author read audiobook If we get to the stretch goals we will look at things like posters, stickers, postcards, all with the fantastic original art commissioned just for this project. 
If we don't reach our entire goal  we will take stock of the situation. If there is enough to print the books we will get them printed and sent off. If not, we will send out the E-books and will get contributor feedback on if you want refunds or postcard art consolation printings. 
The Impact
Right now I am that author working a day job and squeezing in writing between gigs. Funding this will enable me to achieve my goal of a little cabin out in the woods with a full time career making people laugh through my written words. Funding this will enable me to turn tea into joy as well as putting food on the table of several printers, editors, artists, and ….what do you call fulfillment service types?

story:
What is A Journey for Happiness: The Man Who Cycled to Bhutan about?

Christopher had always been fascinated with happiness. So much so that he had got his PhD and gone on to become a world-leading expert on the topic. However, his university job researching happiness wasn’t making him happy at all. With all his academic successes he couldn’t find time to apply all the wonderful insights on happiness to his own life. He was certain there had to be a different way, not just for himself, but for all of us. And so he quit his job, saddled up, and began cycling to Bhutan; a curious little country nestled in the Himalayas that is famed for its society centred around happiness.

A Journey for Happiness is based around the extraordinary real-life 18-month 20,000km journey that the author made around the world on his bicycle to Bhutan. It interweaves personal stories with pioneering happiness research, to explore what it means to live a happy life. The journey brought unbridled joy and pleasure, as well as ferocious challenge and heartache. By the end, there came a deep contented sense of happiness. The sort of happiness that doesn’t come and go without warning and ought to be available to anyone. Through an epic cycle journey, with a few extra stories thrown in, this book explores what it will take for us all to be a little happier in this world of ours.

***The journey has been featured on the BBC’s People Fixing the World, reported in The Times and The Independent, discussed on TALK Radio and TNT’s Roundtable, and aired on Bhutanese, Mexican, and Thai TV.

We are still accepting pre-orders with delivery aimed for March 2022

Thank you to everyone that has supported A Journey for Happiness so far. We exceeded our funding goal and raised enough to get A Journey for Happiness edited, printed, and distributed.  Though the crowdfund is no longer LIVE it is still possible to pre-order a copy.

At this stage, the more copies that are ordered, the more copies we will be able to print and distribute at a later date. We want to get this book into as many hands as possible. You will see that all perks ultimately have a book, or a few, involved. This means that beyond the happiness boost that you’ll get from reading the book itself, you have the opportunity for even more happiness. There is the very limited hardback version (only a few copies left now).  There is the paperback version with various add-ons. Plus, there are still opportunities to meet the author both online and in real life,  journey for a day with the author, have your name acknowledged in the book, or have the author give a public talk. You could even get Christopher to write an article for you about happiness. And let's not forget, there is also the possibility of becoming a friend of A Journey for Happiness, or even become A Big Sponsor.

All perks include shipping costs. There are add-ons available at the checkout (mugs, postcards, hardback upgrades) and can be used to make all manner of perky combinations. For example, a mug and a cycle with the author, or a set of postcards and a hardback...the choice is yours.

We’d also really love it if you could share this crowdfund widely with your personal and professional networks, so please go ahead and share with friends and family, and your work colleagues. After all, who doesn’t long for a little more happiness?

Having problems contributing?

If anyone has had problems contributing to the crowdfund then please get in touch. Some have told me that their contributions have not gone through after repeated attempts. Others thought they'd contributed, when in fact they weren't on the list of contributors. If you are worried yours hasn't gone through, feel free to get in contact to check.

If you've contributed you should receive updates about the books progress over the coming months. If you haven't received any updates then either check your bank statement (INDIEGOGO*HAPPY BOOK is the reference) or get in touch direct to confirm the order.

Risks & Challenges

Since we have now hit our target the only big challenge now is delivering the book on time. March 2022 is the expected delivery date. We want to get the book in your hands before International Day of Happiness on 20th March 2022.  There should be plenty of time from the end of this campaign to enable the editing, printing, and delivery to be carried out and completed by then. As of 15th October the copy-editor has the manuscript.

Note, that some of the other perks, such as talks, meets, walks, have longer delivery dates because they will be arranged with you for sometime in the spring or summer of 2022. Nevertheless, we aim to get the book part of those perks over to you in March 2022. 

Shipping costs have been budgeted into each perk. There are no additional shipping fees to pay.

Follow Christopher Boyce on:

Twitter: https://twitter.com/drhappyboyce

Wordpress: https://journeyforhappiness.co.uk/

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/AdventureInHappinessCy...

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/journeyforhappinessuk/

Thank you. Christopher and The Team.

***You can find out more about the journey on the author's Journey for Happiness website.

story:
The paranormal, plausible.

Is the process of aging truly natural, or some sick affliction cause by unseen otherworldly parasites?  Is our reality infested by entities beyond the ken of science?  And if you had a chance to see the truth...  What would happen next?

 

Imagined in the Shadows...

Best known for his scientific development of sub-aquatic hamster habitats, few know that Alex Beyman has been constructing a trove of dark fantasy.  After long years of honing his skills, Vivid Publishing is ecstatic to present the first anthology of this hard-working indie author's work in print.  For more from Alex Beyman, delve into his substack.

Soon you will realize that these tales originate in a mind like no other- and in addition to the book, you can acquire relics that might just prove pivotal.

The Book.

The stories may seem unconnected to the casual reader- but you will discover an uncanny and consistent world of surreal horror building around you as you continue reading through 280 profoundly unnerving pages.

A stretch goal upgrades all books from softcover to hardcover. (See below)

The Note.

No mere bookmark, this includes an urgent note from professor Heironimus Travigan himself.

The Abraxas Stone.

Oh, blithe reader, you do not yet comprehend the unending horrors that await you on your travels if you lack a proper abraxas stone.  These specimens will arrive in the form of solid 3D metal 1" diameter pins, inscribed with the proper runes to safeguard your journey.

The Lens.

The Orgonometric Optical Detector is your only hope of seeing them before it is too late.  Peer through this rose-tinted lens to dispel paranoia and perceive the world as it truly is.  (No matter how mortifying that prospect may be.)

Naturally, such a crucial piece of pataphysical equipment will come in a protective luxury case.

 

The Orgonovore.

A representation of your Orgonovore may serve to confuse and dispel the real thing.  (We hope.)  This 3D printed model is a highly limited exclusive item for this campaign, and-

- the little monstrosity doubles as a stylus / pen holder for your desk.

GET HIM!

 

Or rather, try. These rare and arcane items are in strictly limited supply.

Help make Alex Beyman's first book launch a success by spreading the word- and improve the quality of your own rewards in the process.

  • $1,000: GOAL.  Campaign goal.  Thank you!
  • $2,000: Vampiric Digital Bonus.  All tiers will have the bonus e-book/PDF of ‘Vampire Holidays’ added to their rewards.
  • $2,500: HARDCOVERS.  ALL ‘Institute’ books will be upgraded from paperback to high-quality casebound hardcovers.
  • $3,000 Dust jackets! ALL ‘Institute’ books in this campaign will have dust jackets added to them.
  • $5,000 Printing Special FX.  ‘Institute’ books will have embossing and spot UV effects added to the dust jackets.  (Spot UV is when a glossy coat is painted in select areas across a matte cover finish.)
  • $7,000: YOU get a book!  And YOU get a book...  All ‘Tier 3’ and higher backers will have a physical ‘Vampire Holidays’ book added to their rewards.
  • $9,000: Audio Book All backers will receive an audiobook version of "Reports from the Institute" for spooky listening!
  • $20,000: Supernormal GLOW.  The Orgonovore figurines will be glow-in-the-dark.

 

Vampire Holidays

Get your blood pumping and unlock a free copy of this urban-fantasy romance from Vivid Publishing, by another under-recognized author:

Heaven and Hell have something in common; both need reliable accounting. Gray Associates, CPAs offers neutral financial services with guaranteed security & discretion. Until romance unbalances the books...

Shipping

We feel you- shipping is costly!  Domestic estimates are based on USPS retail and the projected weight of the hardcovers, with packaging and handling accounted for.  Although postage rates from all carriers continue to rise, we'll always keep our radar tuned for ways to keep those costs minimized.

Risks & Challenges

Vivid Publishing has been printing and delivering graphic novels since 2006, with a string of crowdfunding experience and success behind us.  We've had everything go wrong- up to and including devastating fire- and we have surmounted all challenges to deliver no matter what. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can be in a position to contribute, and that's okay.  You can still provide a massive boost by spreading the word about Alex's book launch- family, friends, and people who deserve to be scared out of their wits are all great prospects.  Thank you in advance!

story:
Get to know me! What's this about?

Hello!  I'm Claire, and I'm a music lover and avid concert goer, among other things. My MasterCard bill alone through the years would prove this to you, but I even legally changed my last name to my favorite rock star. That, however, is another story....

Right now, I'm inviting your support to get my novel "When I Remember You" edited and prepared for publication. I've spent many, MANY, late nights at my kitchen table (and sometimes soaking in a warm bubble bath) crafting the story, the characters, their actions, what it all means, why it should matter to anyone, finding the right mix to make it entertaining yet dramatic and fun yet meaningful and sexy, 'cause people like to know something sexy might happen, and - oh, there's a handsome rock star involved and... need I say more? 

I wanted to write a story to demonstrate how an interest in an artist and the shared experience of live music creates close friendships. This is something on which I consider myself an expert. I also wanted to give a glimpse into the underworld of what it's like to be passionate about an artist going beyond simply buying their latest album and seeing them when they come to your city. Plus,I enjoy writing and wanted to put a bunch of words together and provide some entertainment. AND, big selling point here: you can expect there will be perfect use of all grammar including the proper forms of I and me, subject verb agreement, the reflexive tense, appropriate punctuation of compound sentences, and nothing improperly capitalized. (An occasional fragment may be used for dramatic effect. Kind of exciting in itself.)

Most of all though, I wanted to write a story for all of my fan friends to honor the mutual understanding and dedication we have in this unique hobby of being loyal supporters of musicians we love.

Will you help me make it a reality? 

Editing, cover art, and other costs... oh my

I may be a master grammar person (person?) thanks to my mom and dad (Jack and Madalyn!), but this is  my first novel, (first one I've put out there). If I'm going to ask people to buy it, it has to be in top form. Plus, I want it to be spectacular for you. If you're giving your time to my prose, then it should be deserving of your attention.

Editors charge by the word, and right now my manuscript stands at about 82,000 of them -  82,000 intriguing, page-turning bits of literary goodness to entertain you. To get those words and pages whipped into shape, I've already spent $2000 to hire a seasoned editor committed to getting my book ready to go. 

That amount does not take into account the publishing prep costs, cover artwork design, shipping, and all the envelopes to send the autographed ones on their way, etc, etc. The estimated up front need is an additional $3,000.  

It's a big undertaking! But I so want to do this, and I'd foot the whole bill to put it out there myself  if I could due to my love of the project; but your help, whatever you can do, would make it so much better.

Here are some ways you can participate in supporting my book, and I appreciate anything you can do, whether at one of these levels or not.

Claire's Dream Levels

XOXO $5

A cool bookmark  (and it will be cool indeed)

My unwavering love for you  

REMEMBERING YOU $20

Your name listed in the book's acknowledgements

and a cool bookmark and my unwavering love for you

SHIMMER GUITAR  $40

An autographed copy of the book

Your name listed in the book's acknowledgements

and a cool bookmark and my unwavering love for you

BACKSTAGE PASS $100

The first chapter sent to you via email in advance of the book's release

An autographed copy of the book

Your name listed in the book's acknowledgements

and  a cool bookmark and my unwavering love for you

***Any amounts beyond these will include all of the support levels.**

And any amount is appreciated. 

Other ways to Help

Whether or not you can contribute financially, you'll have my sincere appreciation if you can help me get the word out when the book becomes available.

Via social media, you can spread the word on your platforms. My author Instagram page is springywrites, my Twitter is @ClaireSpringy, and my Facebook is Claire Springfield if you want to share from my pages or tag me.

Note: for making noise on the campaign, it's best to use the Indigogo share tools.

Also if you know anyone I can connect with who writes reviews or happens to own or work in an independent bookstore, you can reach out to me through claire.springfield@icloud.com.

The Challenge for a New Novelist

I promise you I will be doing all I can to make the distribution of my book successful.  It's always a risk to believe others will be interested in your creative work, but I know there are people who will both identify with the story's setting and enjoy reading about where I take the characters. ...and I can't wait for you to meet them.

I have a B.A. in public relations and communications, and I was formerly in charge of promotions for a PBS station, so I will use that experience to help propel my book into the realm of potential readers far and wide. I also have a dedicated social media manager who will be assisting with reaching out regularly and hoping to invite national attention. My publishing company will work to get visibility for the book as well. 

I'm so excited to share all of this!

Right now, I'm inviting your support to get my novel "When I Remember You" edited and prepared for publication. I've spent many, MANY, late nights at my kitchen table (and sometimes soaking in a warm bubble bath) crafting the story, the characters, their actions, what it all means, why it should matter to anyone, finding the right mix to make it entertaining yet dramatic and fun yet meaningful and sexy, 'cause people like to know something sexy might happen, and - oh, there's a handsome rock star involved and... need I say more? 
I wanted to write a story to demonstrate how an interest in an artist and the shared experience of live music creates close friendships. This is something on which I consider myself an expert. I also wanted to give a glimpse into the underworld of what it's like to be passionate about an artist going beyond simply buying their latest album and seeing them when they come to your city. Plus,I enjoy writing and wanted to put a bunch of words together and provide some entertainment. AND, big selling point here: you can expect there will be perfect use of all grammar including the proper forms of I and me, subject verb agreement, the reflexive tense, appropriate punctuation of compound sentences, and nothing improperly capitalized. (An occasional fragment may be used for dramatic effect. Kind of exciting in itself.)
Most of all though, I wanted to write a story for all of my fan friends to honor the mutual understanding and dedication we have in this unique hobby of being loyal supporters of musicians we love.
Will you help me make it a reality? 

Editing, cover art, and other costs... oh my
I may be a master grammar person (person?) thanks to my mom and dad (Jack and Madalyn!), but this is  my first novel, (first one I've put out there). If I'm going to ask people to buy it, it has to be in top form. Plus, I want it to be spectacular for you. If you're giving your time to my prose, then it should be deserving of your attention.
Editors charge by the word, and right now my manuscript stands at about 82,000 of them -  82,000 intriguing, page-turning bits of literary goodness to entertain you. To get those words and pages whipped into shape, I've already spent $2000 to hire a seasoned editor committed to getting my book ready to go. 
That amount does not take into account the publishing prep costs, cover artwork design, shipping, and all the envelopes to send the autographed ones on their way, etc, etc. The estimated up front need is an additional $3,000.  
It's a big undertaking! But I so want to do this, and I'd foot the whole bill to put it out there myself  if I could due to my love of the project; but your help, whatever you can do, would make it so much better.
Here are some ways you can participate in supporting my book, and I appreciate anything you can do, whether at one of these levels or not.
Claire's Dream Levels
XOXO $5
A cool bookmark  (and it will be cool indeed)
My unwavering love for you  
REMEMBERING YOU $20
Your name listed in the book's acknowledgements
and a cool bookmark and my unwavering love for you
SHIMMER GUITAR  $40
An autographed copy of the book
Your name listed in the book's acknowledgements
and a cool bookmark and my unwavering love for you
BACKSTAGE PASS $100
The first chapter sent to you via email in advance of the book's release
An autographed copy of the book
Your name listed in the book's acknowledgements
and  a cool bookmark and my unwavering love for you
***Any amounts beyond these will include all of the support levels.**
And any amount is appreciated. 
Other ways to Help
Whether or not you can contribute financially, you'll have my sincere appreciation if you can help me get the word out when the book becomes available.
Via social media, you can spread the word on your platforms. My author Instagram page is springywrites, my Twitter is @ClaireSpringy, and my Facebook is Claire Springfield if you want to share from my pages or tag me.
Note: for making noise on the campaign, it's best to use the Indigogo share tools.
Also if you know anyone I can connect with who writes reviews or happens to own or work in an independent bookstore, you can reach out to me through claire.springfield@icloud.com.

The Challenge for a New Novelist
I promise you I will be doing all I can to make the distribution of my book successful.  It's always a risk to believe others will be interested in your creative work, but I know there are people who will both identify with the story's setting and enjoy reading about where I take the characters. ...and I can't wait for you to meet them.
I have a B.A. in public relations and communications, and I was formerly in charge of promotions for a PBS station, so I will use that experience to help propel my book into the realm of potential readers far and wide. I also have a dedicated social media manager who will be assisting with reaching out regularly and hoping to invite national attention. My publishing company will work to get visibility for the book as well. 
I'm so excited to share all of this!

story:
Humans are Weird: I Have the Data 

“A good science fiction story should be able to predict not the automobile but the traffic jam.”
— Sci-Fi Master Fredrik Pohl

 Simply put, truth in advertising. Humans are weird, and we all know it. How will this little fact affect how our alien friends see us? 

  • Betty Adams lives in a particularly damp and remote corner of the Pacific Northwest and, like a hobbit, enjoys visitors so long as she knows them in advance and knows when they are coming. She was born sometime last century and will likely die sometime this century. She works winters on a small organic research farm when not writing and spends most of her time herding eccentric genius scientists (she is absolutely certain cats would be easier) with the help of her Great Pyrenees mix. Summers she spends nomadically wandering the Pacific Northwest in search of material for her stories and a regular paycheck for a biology major (she is reasonably certain those are on the Endangered Species List). She has several works published in the National Park Internal Database which may or may not be classified documents.

  • In the words of that immortal  bard, Samuel J. Snodgrass, "Make 'em laugh!" I wanted to spread some joy in the world and after years of trying this, that, and the other I discovered I had a talent for pointing out the absurdity inherent in the everyday life of humanity. 
  • If you are looking for epic space battles, if you are looking for generals winning victory through genius tactics, if you are looking for berserker warriors carrying empires aloft on their swords,  look elsewhere my friends.  Here you will find laughter.
  • Here a quartermaster must discover why the humans insists that the mass produced broom, identical down to the molecule to every other broom on the base, is the "wrong" broom, and why and how they expect him to fix it. 
  • Here aliens learn the meaning of "enough C4"
  • Here a medic meets the challenge of understanding why a human thinks it can survive on chocolate cake. 
  • Here Monty Python meets Star Trek. 
  • Here I make 'em laugh! 
  • Your contribution will bring that laughter to fruition. I will publish a paperback version and an electronic version of 38,000 words of the fully edited  and compiled works and 12,000 previous unseen words. My goal is to write full time and if we meet the stretch goals I will be able to do that. 
  • Imagine a cozy cabin in the woods. Just the author, a big old dog, a cup of tea sending a tendril of steam into the air, and the steady tic-tic-tacing of the keyboard churning out more stories for you to read. You cannot find me. You cannot trace me. But you will get the fruit of my labors on a regular basis! 
  • You will laugh! 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • We need to pay the printers. That is going to cost around $1000
    • We need to pay shipping and fulfillment which will cost another $1500
    • We are going to fund the art, editing, and various costs of the next book in the series which will be another $1500 before printing begins.  
    • The author would also like to eat occasionally thus the final $1000.
  • You get laughter! Joy! That special feeling you get when you find that package you have been waiting for sitting on your front step! The first perk is our chuckle-inducing E-book.  The second perk is a paperback. If we get to the stretch goals we will look at things like posters, stickers, postcards, all with the fantastic original art commissioned just for this project. 
  • If we don't reach our entire goal  we will take stock of the situation. If there is enough to print the books we will get them printed and sent off. If not, we will send out the E-books and will get contributor feedback on if you want refunds or postcard art consolation printings. 

The Impact

Right now I am that author working a day job and squeezing in writing between gigs. Funding this will enable me to achieve my goal of a little cabin out in the woods with a full time career making people laugh through my written words. Funding this will enable me to turn tea into joy as well as putting food on the table of several printers, editors, artists, and ….what do you call fulfillment service types? 

  • For as long as humanity has had records we have recorded two things. Humans desperately need a laugh, and humans are the things most worth laughing at. I offer up this plate of wholesome laughter, hopping to make your day a little easier. This is my bison sketched on the wall of my cave, my etchings on the Rosetta Stone. Let them laugh. 
  • I have successfully funded and published a full length novel in 2015 "Dying Embers" BE WARNED. That is a very different book if you are curious about it. There is laughter in it, but it is entwined with a broken heart. 
  • There is so much pain in the world. I can't get rid of the pain, but I can make 'em laugh! and I want to do my small part to make a better world. 

Risks & Challenges

There will always be risks and challenges when publishing a book. We might not get funded. A storm might flood the distribution center literally or figuratively. This I can promise you: I will do everything within my power to make sure that this book lands on your doorstep as soon as possible. 

  • I have done it before and I will do it again. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about the campaign. Share the campaign on social media. Tell your Aunt Gertrude about it. Do an interpretive dance about the wrong broom in school! (or don't depending on school tolerance for nonsense). 
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to make your life easier (in relation to this book, Indiegogo makes no promises about the rest of your life)!

Now go buy that book!

story:
What started as a handbook for reenactors became a start-to-finish chronicle of the Soviet Intervention in Afghanistan. The central focus of the book is a massive collection of high-quality photographs that visually illustrates the progression of the conflict and tracks the development and application of Soviet uniforms and equipment from 1979 to 1989.

Hundreds of painstakingly recreated impressions depict Soviet soldiers of the 345th Regiment and their supporting units at every phase of the war. Authentic practices and variations are exhibited and described in unprecedented detail. Accompanying texts simultaneously narrate the minutiae of soldiers’ lives in relation to the broader history of the 40th Army.

Uniforms and History of the Soviet Airborne: The 345th Regiment in Afghanistan is an invaluable reference to anyone with an interest in the Soviet Army or the Soviet Intervention in Afghanistan.

 

Work began before we decided to write a book. Our team organized several photoshoots to display the uniforms and equipment we used to model the Soviet Army.

We initially intended to compile a catalog that depicted military servicemen in each branch of the Limited Contingent of Soviet Forces in Afghanistan. Eventually, we realized the immeasurable scale of such a project and decided to focus our efforts on the representation of one Airborne Regiment.

We started to create an illustrated guide for living history enthusiasts, but the project became something greater. This book accompanies the story of a war and the experiences of an entire unit with hundreds of painstakingly recreated visual displays. Historians, reenactors, equipment enthusiasts, and uniform collectors alike will surely consider it a valuable resource.

 

A picture is worth a thousand words. Our manuscript is tastefully presented in a contemporary style and generously illustrated with full-color images on photo-quality paper.

Two teams collaborated internationally for over a year to create hundreds of exact depictions of soldiers. Dozens of veterans were interviewed and tens of thousands of documentary photographs were analyzed to ensure the validity of the material presented. Quality was our highest priority.

 

No other reference like this exists for the Soviet Intervention in Afghanistan. Soviet-Afghan conflict is underrepresented and sparsely documented in Western literature. Russian-language works primarily consist of first-person memoirs. Researchers that want to study materials and minutiae to develop a broader understanding of the weapons, uniforms, and daily life of Soviet soldiers would otherwise have to search for scattered information from various sources.

This book presents everything in a sensible and digestible format. Our carefully curated collections display most of the equipment used in the war in the way that it was actually used and implemented.

 

We are aiming to take delivery of both Standard and Signed Editions of the book no later than October 1, 2021, which will allow us to put books in the hands of our backers in time for the 2021 holiday period.

 

Our team consist of highly skilled and higly motivated individuals, who have layed hundreds of hours of dedicated work towards this project.

 

Risks and challenges

Although this is the first book of our own production, members of our team all have relevant experience to successfully complete the project. The book manuscript is now complete and all the photographs taken. Final editing is proceeding as scheduled. An established printer with decades of the experience is waiting for the final file.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are really into Soviet-Afghan topic, you are welcome to join our private group on Facebook

https://www.facebook.com/groups/328142748311735

story:
We are presently experiencing a Global Mental Health Pandemic. 

Sara Schley is an organizational consultant for social and environmental justice, a mom, step- mom, wife, spiritual teacher, outdoor leader, Shadow Work healer, business entrepreneur, published author, and more. She also lives with Bipolar II with a brain on the Bipolar Spectrum. 

Here's an excerpt from her upcoming book Brainstorm: From Broken to Blessed on the Bipolar Spectrum. 

I AM NOT WRITING THIS BOOK TO TELL MY STORY, I AM WRITING IT TO SAVE LIVES.

I could barely get out of bed, my limbs were so heavy. I was compulsively picking at my fingers until they were bloody, burning, and painful. I was showing up for my life without really being there, dragging myself through every day. The idea of getting in the car to drive for 90 minutes to Boston in order to see a therapist—I had seen so many over the years—was overwhelming. I longed to sleep and never wake up, but I was too scared of what eternal hell might lay on the other side of suicide.

I have a Bipolar II brain, a brutal teacher which has informed everything I do and who I’ve become in my six decades around the sun. I have mostly kept the truth of this in the closet, fearing the stigma. After close to 40 years wrestling with the shame, I am coming out. 

Healthy now and proud of my unique and beautiful brain, I am here to tell my story to help save lives, reduce suffering, end the stigma for millions of people like me who may be on the Bipolar Spectrum and not know it. They can be successfully treated and live full and beautiful lives.

Dr Holly Swartz, recognized world-leader on Bipolar II writes this about Sara’s upcoming memoir: 

“You have written a masterful autobiography about your lived experiences with Bipolar Disorder II, poignantly capturing the lack of understanding about Bipolar Spectrum disorders. . .  It will be hugely helpful to have a first-person narrative account of what it is like to live with BD II available to increase awareness and decrease stigma. Your story no doubt will inspire others who struggle with BD II. I fervently hope that your book gets published so it can be made available to a wide audience.”

Dr. Holly Swartz

Professor of Psychiatry at the University of Pittsburgh and Editor-in-Chief of the American Journal of Psychotherapy

story:
Short Summary

My name is Nathan Day. I am an Author Academy Award* and Imadjinn Award**-winning horror, urban fantasy and noir author published by Seventh Star Press and Hydra Publications. I am spear-heading Through the Tempest Black, a cosmic horror anthology, as editor in order to bring together award-winning authors (such as Bram Stoker award-winner Michael Knost and Imadjinn Award-winner Robb Hoff), established indie and small press authors and currently unpublished and unknown authors who I feel are deserving of their chance to be heard. Why? Because we all start from the bottom and work hard to elevate our talents and passions. All that I have currently achieved is because I was given a chance by publishers and juries of best-selling authors who saw promise in my work. Simply put, I want to pay that forward.

Through your generous contributions you are giving life to a literary project that will help grow readership for outstanding authors that work diligently to produce quality pieces but may not have reached the heights of best-seller lists (alongside some who have) as well as allowing new voices to be heard, appreciated and encouraged to pursue their dreams of becoming career authors.

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is a modest $3500 which would cover art, printing and formatting costs as well as reward each contributor with a $200 payment for the inclusion of their work. Many small press anthologies only pay contributors $10 and a copy of the book. Funding beyond $3500 will contribute towards the creation of a limited edition (hardback as a goal) which will include my own upcoming cosmic horror novella, Pilgrimage.

Our perks include:

- standard and limited edition copies of Through the Tempest Black, both in print and digital

- exclusive limited edition 3D printed statuettes of the Great Old One, Hastur, and the Bleeding Mirror featured in the novella, Pilgrimage

- a thank you to all donors

- personalized, hand-written "thank yous" signed by myself, editor/author Nathan Day inside your physical copy of Through the Tempest Black

- having a character named after you in Pilgrimage

- signed copies of other works from anthology contributors

If our goal of $3500 is not met by campaign's end, funds will be disbursed evenly among contributing authors after cover art and formatting costs have been met.

Your Impact

The literary market is can be intimidating, especially as it is over-crowded with self-published indie authors and small press publishers. It is very difficult to have your work seen and stand out, especially when you are just starting out. Projects like this can help authors achieve recognition because it pools various established readerships and introduces them to new authors while helping first-time authors achieve an initial readership base.

I feel grateful that I am able to bring these various men and women together this effort and am able to do so because I have worked to earn their trust and respect both as an author and human. It is my desire to leverage this trust into a project we will all be proud of.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are unable to contributor to this campaign financially, you can still potentially make a huge impact on our success by sharing the campaign through word of mouth, on social media platforms and by utilizing Indiegogo share tools.

Thank You!

I thank you from the bottom of my heart for your time and consideration in supporting this passion project. You stand to impact the lives and careers of talented and hard-working voices in ways that far exceed simple monetary compensation. I wish you the same luck and success in your own endeavors.

*Winner - Author Academy Award - Best Fantasy 2018 - Orphan: Surfacing

**Winner - Imadjinn Award - Best Urban Fantasy 2018 - Orphan: Surfacing

If our goal of $3500 is not met by campaign's end, funds will be disbursed evenly among contributing authors after cover art and formatting costs have been met.

Your Impact
The literary market is can be intimidating, especially as it is over-crowded with self-published indie authors and small press publishers. It is very difficult to have your work seen and stand out, especially when you are just starting out. Projects like this can help authors achieve recognition because it pools various established readerships and introduces them to new authors while helping first-time authors achieve an initial readership base.
I feel grateful that I am able to bring these various men and women together this effort and am able to do so because I have worked to earn their trust and respect both as an author and human. It is my desire to leverage this trust into a project we will all be proud of.
Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you are unable to contributor to this campaign financially, you can still potentially make a huge impact on our success by sharing the campaign through word of mouth, on social media platforms and by utilizing Indiegogo share tools.
Thank You!
I thank you from the bottom of my heart for your time and consideration in supporting this passion project. You stand to impact the lives and careers of talented and hard-working voices in ways that far exceed simple monetary compensation. I wish you the same luck and success in your own endeavors.
*Winner - Author Academy Award - Best Fantasy 2018 - Orphan: Surfacing
**Winner - Imadjinn Award - Best Urban Fantasy 2018 - Orphan: Surfacing

story:
Innovation Starts With I is live on Amazon! You can purchase copies here for your friends, family, and colleagues. Thank you for all your support.
_________________

We’re thrilled to share that we have successfully reached our crowdfunding goal. We are incredibly grateful to all of our friends, family, backers, partners and sponsors.

Given the demand, we'll be keeping our campaign live for those who want to pre-order the book. Personally signed copies of the book will only be available through Indiegogo. 


----------------------------------------------------------------


⇢ OVERVIEW

Innovation Starts With I aims to redefine innovation.

As automation increases and our world becomes more feeling-oriented, the need for “uniquely human” skills is rapidly rising. We're entering the fourth industrial revolution—the Augmented Age—and there’s going to be a lot of reshuffling happening. There will be twice the number of jobs, new industries, new skills, but also a lot of jobs will become obsolete. 

By future-proofing yourself, you’ll be better positioned to do work that matters while maximizing your impact in this noisy, fast-evolving world. 

My goal with this book is to help strengthen the human capabilities that matter the most right now, such as self-awareness, curiosity, originality, empathy, resilience, collaboration, intuition, and adaptability. As a reader,  you can expect to walk away with an entrepreneurial mindset, think more like an innovator, and become a better problem-solver. 

Through my personal story and insights from interviewing 100+ leaders, as well as speaking and facilitating workshops to audiences around the world, Innovation Starts With I takes you on a journey of self-discovery while providing practical advice on how to increase your influence and level up your impact.

The book is divided into 3 sections:

Intended Audience

Part self-help and part business, this book is for people who are seeking to increase their influence and maximize their impact while boosting their personal and professional growth.

⇢WHAT MAKES THIS BOOK UNIQUE

This book isn't just an ordinary book. According to the World Economic Forum, we're in the midst of a Reskilling Revolution. Whether you're an entrepreneur or work for an organization, it's becoming increasingly important to have an entrepreneurial mindset—to think like an innovator.

1. Personal Story

I took an unconventional path in my career, which is gradually becoming the norm, given the pace our world is evolving. A lot of people have asked me over the years to share my story. Through giving 200+ speaking engagements on innovative leadership, I realized the most powerful talks were the ones where I shared lessons from my life journey.

 

 

 

 

 

I interviewed 100+ leaders, innovators, and entrepreneurs globally.

 

 

 

 

 


2. Interviews + Workshops

While writing short stories from my personal journey, I often got stuck. I wanted to build a diverse lens and make this book so much bigger than myself. So I interviewed 100+ leaders and entrepreneurs from over 20 countries on the most important 21st-century skills that will set us apart. I also gave talks and facilitated design thinking and leadership workshops for entrepreneurs and changemakers in several countries.

 

 

 

I facilitated workshops around the world, including Africa, Europe, Latin America, and the Middle East.

 

 

 


I analyzed my research from the interviews and workshops, along with my personal experiences, to create tools and frameworks that would help readers strengthen their human skills while positioning themselves for success in the Future of Work, which we've just entered.

In the last couple of decades, when it comes to empathizing with others, a lot of the focus has been on understanding people based on their cultural or ethnic background. As I traveled on my book journey and expanded my insights by collaborating with and interviewing other leaders, entrepreneurs, and experts, I learned that our world is only becoming smaller and more interconnected. This means that the now and the near future is all about being able to develop a deeper understanding of ourselves and the world around us—by being more human. 
 

 

3. Tools and Frameworks

When the concept of "Innovation Starts With I" had been a favorite slide in many of my keynotes for a couple of years, I continued to dive deeper and further incubate the idea. In 2019, it got selected as a TEDx Talk. At that point, I committed to calling my book Innovation Starts With I and built original tools and frameworks around it, which the book and workbook are full of. Here's an example of a visual tool I created for coming up with a great idea:

⇢ HOW IT ALL STARTED

I started writing my book, Innovation Starts With I, back in 2014, to “help unleash the entrepreneur within us”.

Within weeks of getting started, a close friend told me:

“Saleema, you’re not ready to publish a book. No one knows who you are. You’ve accomplished quite a bit… but you still need to live more of your own story.”

Even though it killed my inspiration and confidence, it was great advice. It was also right before I went through a transformative period in my life.

A lot happened during that 5-year hiatus. I also accepted I needed to stop hiding behind the scenes.

In early 2019, I felt it was time to commit to this project and get this book out. So here I am. The book will be released in March of 2021.

⇢ ABOUT ME

I'm a serial entrepreneur that's passionate about creating more entrepreneurs in this world and reducing their failure rate. I speak to organizations on how to develop an innovative mindset and lead more inclusively. I teach Entrepreneurship and Design Thinking at Johns Hopkins University. I'm fluent in 5 languages and have traveled to 70+ countries.

Here's more about me in a nutshell:

⇢ MY "WHY"

With all the changes in the publishing industry, I decided to go the gutsy route of self-publishing my book. There's not a single publisher that can get my message out as well as my team and I can. 

We are running this crowdfunding campaign to raise money from our community in order to self-publish my book. In return, we're sharing exclusive perks, such as the digital workbook that is only available through this campaign for our early adopters. We have also collaborated with other innovators and entrepreneurs to include gifts such as a beautiful print from Canadian visual artist Sara Golish in The Artist Package and the SLIM Laptop/Notebook Organizer from Spanish startup, Beblau. I'll be personally signing all pre-ordered books from this campaign.

⇢ FOR OUR SPONSORS:

The book will be published in English in digital, paperback, and hardcover editions. Your contributions would support developmental editing, copy editing, proofreading, typesetting, illustration, and marketing. We plan on translating the book into French, Portuguese, and Spanish. We’ll also produce an audiobook. We plan on expanding our international book tour to low-income and middle-income countries in Africa, the Middle East, and Latin America. With your support, we’ll be able to amplify our message globally and have a successful book launch.  

⇢ GIFTING BOOKS TO DESERVING FEMALE ENTREPRENEURS

For the last 10 days of the campaign, we added a special perk: GIFT TO 5 FEMALE ENTREPRENEURS. Many of our backers have requested wanting to gift books to underserved female entrepreneurs, so we partnered with some nonprofits and created a list of organizations below. We will either ship the 5 signed paperback books directly to the organization, if they are based in the USA, or I will personally give them to the recipients during my book tour.

Black Girl Ventures provides Black/Brown woman-identifying founders with access to community, capital, and capacity building in order to meet business milestones that lead to economic advancement through entrepreneurship.

Wonder Women Tech highlights, celebrates and educates women and the underrepresented in STEAM industries.

ESchool4Girls equips students with skills that will support them in achieving their greatest potential thereby having the power to change their trajectory in this world.

Street Entrepreneurs ignite the power of economically disadvantaged entrepreneurs by harnessing grit, investing in talent, and providing access to capital.

Womenpreneur Initiative empowers women entrepreneurs in the Middle East and Africa through innovative experiences, entrepreneurial activities, mentorship sessions, leadership programs, technology education, networking events and opportunities.

StartupAfrica supports youth entrepreneurs in Africa with educational programming, mentorship and seeking seed funding.

MET Community promotes and supports sustainable, responsible, and innovative entrepreneurship among women through training, mentorship, and networking in Latin America, Spain, and the US.

Aga Khan Foundation partners with communities in some of the most remote, hard-to-reach parts of Asia and Africa to build better futures together.


⇢ HOW YOU CAN HELP

You can show your support by backing this campaign and pre-ordering my book or contributing what you can. If you share it with your friends, family and network, direct messaging tends to work best using these graphics. You can easily share our pre-sale campaign page using the sharing buttons at the top of this Indiegogo page. Feel free to tag me @SaleemaVellani on all social media platforms. You can follow me on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and LinkedIn and sign up for email updates on my website.

You can share it with anyone who you think would enjoy it. Direct messaging on social media, text messaging, and WhatsApp tend to work best. 

⇢ THE TEAM

Nothing ever gets successfully launched without the support of a team, partners, and community—including you. 

We've come a long way since the early days thanks to our hardworking team and collaborators.

We're almost there. Your support would mean a lot to us in our final stages of making this book real.

⇢ RISKS AND CHALLENGES

The main risk we foresee is time: to complete the book and for shipping and handling, given the holiday season and the state of the global pandemic. We plan to release the book in December 2020 and have built in time for the editing and review process. We are working diligently to meet that timeline.

Thank you for all your support and for being part of this incredibly exciting journey.

story:
Short Summary

Jonathan Jackson (of Tuck Everlasting, Nashville and ENation fame) has written a modern-day classic, a contemporary Paradise Lost. It will be illustrated with original work from a fine artist. If you are a fan of Jonathan and his art, you'll love this work! If you are a classic literature buff, this book is right up your alley! If you like language and its creative, expressive use, you will be captivated by this story. See the excerpt below for a taste!

 

And here's a note from Jonathan himself about how this book came to be:

       C.S. Lewis said, “The heart of Christianity is a myth, which is also a fact. The
old myth of the Dying God, without ceasing to be myth, comes down from
the heaven of legend and imagination to the earth of history.”
This book is ten years in the making. I first began writing it when my oldest
son was six years old. He’s now sixteen and a writer himself. I wanted to
write a heroic epic my children could grow up with and pass on to their
children. Now, the time has come to share it with the world.
       My son’s imagination was captured at an early age by the epic stories of
Beowulf and Hercules. In these stories the longing for a hero emerges
naturally and profoundly. As a father, I longed for this enthusiasm and
exhilaration to eventually transcend mythology and ultimately be directed
towards Christ, the Hero of Heroes.
       This poem explores the epic question: What happened between Christ’s
crucifixion and resurrection? In the ancient Christian Tradition, it is said that
Christ not only suffered and died on the Cross physically, but that He also
descended into Hell (Hades to be more precise) to destroy the power of
death and rescue imprisoned souls, breaking the iron bars of Death and
Hades. 

       In this story, the foreshadowing of pagan myths finds their fulfillment in the
epic of Christ. The Harrowing of Hell is a glimpse into the untold chapter
of the Greatest Story ever told.

       This is a work of historical fiction, I prefer to call it a poem because poetry
brings us into the “sense of things”; it conveys truth through paradox,
mystery, imagination and allegory, where concrete empirical knowledge
runs out.
       Although there is a great deal of imagination and poetry in this work of
historical fiction, the author seeks to render a faithful depiction of Christ as
revealed in the New Testament and the ancient Christian Faith. It is a
painting, more than an icon.
       As an Eastern Orthodox Christian, I have encountered a different
understanding of Hell, man’s free will and the mercy of God, then is often
articulated in Western traditions. It is a vision that is not widely known in
Europe or North America. It can be summed up by this phrase, “Even the
flames of Hell are love.” 

       I am hoping that with your help, we will be able to raise enough money to print the first edition, featuring original illustrations. Any additional funds raised after expenses will be going to the monastery of the Life-Giving Spring in Ireland.
        Millions around the world are journeying through Great Lent on their way
towards the Resurrection of Christ. In these difficult and troubling times, it is
my humble prayer that this book will assist the reader’s meditation on the
mercy of God and the lengths to which He will go to rescue us from
darkness.
       Many heroes have risen to the challenge. Only One has descended.

I can’t thank you enough for your support!
-Jonathan

 

Here is a painting that was a source of inspiration for Jonathan as he wrote:

 

What We Need & What You Get

  

We are raising $17,500 to get The Harrowing of Hell into readers' hands. Supporters can receive an e-book version of the book, a print of an illustration and/or a hardcover edition, plus other goodies! Here are the estimates we've put together to arrive at our total goal:

  • $3,750 to cover the production of original art for the book
  • $1,000 for book design and file preparation
  • $4,000 for audio content
  • $1,000 for e-book preparation
  • $4,750 for printing costs 
  • $1,250 for packaging and shipping costs
  • $800 for Indiegogo fees
  • Add a thousand for contingency purposes, and voila! We're at $17,500.

These numbers are our best estimates, though it is likely the exact breakdown will shift a bit in execution! Anything above our goal will first go to extra fulfillment costs, if any. Remaining funds will be split amongst the author, the publisher and a cause dear to the author's heart: the monastery.

So what are the perks? You can get an e-book of the title, a print of one of the original illustrations, and/or a hardcover edition of the book. Alternatively, you can select a recording of Jonathan reading the book and/or an original soundtrack. You'll also have the chance to get a SIGNED and NUMBERED version of the hardcover. Add-ons include a CD or DVD from Jonathan and his band. And for top backers, there is the opportunity to connect with Jonathan via video conference call to hear about the writing process of the book and how it all came together!

The Impact

This campaign is making the public release of The Harrowing of Hell possible. The manuscript has been a passion project for Jonathan and he is wanting to get it into readers hands this year! 

Stephen Mansfield, an NYT bestselling author, has this to say about the book:

“Descensus Christi ad Inferos. Christ’s descent into hell. The ancient creeds teach it. The Church Fathers wrote of it. Modern scholars debate it. Now, Jonathan Jackson unfolds the transforming reality. He brings a mystic’s depth, an actor’s emersion, and a musician’s lyricism to the page. We learn. We are filled. We are changed. Thank God for Jonathan Jackson’s The Harrowing of Hell.”

Stephen Mansfield, Ph.D.

New York Times Bestselling Author  

 

Risks & Challenges

The manuscript is already written; we are still looking for an artist to provide original illustrations. The CD and DVD add-ons for the campaign are ready and waiting. Our book designer is waiting in the wings to prepare files for the printer. And our printer is on standby to fire up the presses as soon as the files are done!

Other Ways You Can Help

Feel free to support the project at the $5 level ; the morale boost is an added bonus :)

And please help us spread the word! Share this project with friends, family, neighbors, co-workers, your babysitter and bookclub and favorite barista.... you get the picture!

The ancient creeds teach it. The Church Fathers wrote of it. Modern scholars debate it. Now, Jonathan Jackson unfolds the transforming reality. He brings a mystic’s depth, an actor’s emersion, and a musician’s lyricism to the page. We learn. We are filled. We are changed. Thank God for Jonathan Jackson’s The Harrowing of Hell.”Stephen Mansfield, Ph.D.New York Times Bestselling Author   Risks & ChallengesThe manuscript is already written; we are still looking for an artist to provide original illustrations. The CD and DVD add-ons for the campaign are ready and waiting. Our book designer is waiting in the wings to prepare files for the printer. And our printer is on standby to fire up the presses as soon as the files are done!Other Ways You Can HelpFeel free to support the project at the $5 level ; the morale boost is an added bonus :)And please help us spread the word! Share this project with friends, family, neighbors, co-workers, your babysitter and bookclub and favorite barista.... you get the picture! Here is an icon that was a source of inspiration for Jonathan as he wrote:

story:
This‌ ‌catchy,‌ ‌witty‌ ‌compilation‌ ‌of‌ ‌inventions,‌ ‌filled‌ ‌with‌ ‌beautiful‌ ‌illustrations,‌ ‌is‌ ‌a‌ ‌wonderful‌ ‌gift‌ ‌for‌ ‌collectors,‌ ‌enthusiasts,‌ ‌and‌ ‌curious‌ ‌minds.‌

Story

Have you ever imagined visiting the past with full knowledge of modern information and technology? If you told people from the Middle Ages or Ancient Egypt about a telephone, a car, or electricity, they would take you for a deity or a superhero. But do you actually know how these things work?

As a child, before bed, I used to imagine with my dad what things like bowstrings would be made of in ancient times. In the morning, looking it up, we would be startled to discover that bowstrings were made of veins and if you wanted instead to make one from gunpowder ingredients you had to urinate on hay!

 

As I got older, I got into mechanics and discovered that many apparently simple things are based on brilliant ideas. All the discoveries and inventions that seemed incredible and almost magical when I was a child actually were just as fantastical as I imagined!

 

I realized that most people knew very little about how such inventions of our civilization as a plow, a mill, a blast furnace or glass are made and how they work. I began making a list of the most amazing inventions I would like to tell my children about. Later I added illustrations, which became more and more bizarre and mysterious. After some time, I finished a draft of The Book of Incredible Inventions and Discoveries. 

 

Now I want to share this book with everyone who hasn’t lost their juvenile curiosity and love for mystery. If you are as fascinated by technical, military, medical and artistic inventions as I am, you definitely will love The Ultimate Guide to Rebuilding a Civilization. This book is an illustrated encyclopedia of mechanisms, processes and materials that have played a significant role in human history.

There is no other book like this. Currently, information about inventions is scattered here and there in boring textbooks and manuals that are neither understandable nor inspiring. The Book of Incredible Inventions and Discoveries presents the most meaningful facts about our culture combined with out-of-this-world ideas and fabulous illustrations. It is the first treatise of its kind on these spectacular magical inventions. Only with your help will we  be able to create this exceptional book.

Vsevolod  Co-founder of The Book

The Book is a unique artifact similar to the most mysterious and mantic books of humankind. The visual symbolism of the book connects it to the prominent fifteen-century Voynich manuscript while its uncommon and original ideas are similar to The Summa Technologiae of Stanisław Lem. The book is also influenced by the aesthetics of the renowned Codex Seraphinianus. The Ultimate Guide is a real masterpiece and an endless source of inspiration.

 

On the pages of The Ultimate Guide you will find visual instructions for making handy mechanisms and materials in case you lose them or forget. With over 400 pages of detailed and catchy illustrations, you will forget about everything and bury yourself in the book. You won’t stop thinking of what you saw.

This section is all about how to be healthy, cheerful, and fresh. Here you’ll find out how to give mouth-to-mouth resuscitation without getting punched in the nose. You’ll learn how to remove your appendix if you don’t need it anymore. We’ll tell you which mushrooms are tasty and which mushrooms are fun (what are mushrooms and what are shrooms). We’ll teach you yoga and Chinese needle therapy. Believe us, all of this knowledge will come in handy in the ruins of the post-apocalyptic world! (not to mention in the modern world, given the cost of medical insurance). We’ll also explain how to make gypsum, glue, penicillin or even all three together from scratch.

The whole world is a big chemistry lab and the only limit here is your lack of knowledge. If there’s sand under your feet, you can make glass. If you see trees around you, it’s a step from there to making paper. The magic of our civilization, which is electricity, can also be made from easily accessible materials. There are tons of ways to make it and we’ll reveal the most original one.

Researchers have concluded that human brain development was always influenced by laziness and greed. We want to have as much as possible with minimal effort and that’s what makes us geniuses. Mills and water pumps will do the work for you. The combustion engine will help you in traveling any distance. Cameras made of boxes and paper with photosensitive surfaces will immortalize your successes.

In all the worlds of the Multiverse in which this book will be published, we’ve agreed that killing people isn’t cool. We wish these inventions never appeared, but still….The trebuchet is pretty darn good. To create saltpeter, which is the main gunpowder component, all it takes is hay and human urine. How long will you have to pee in the pit full of hay? You’ll find this out in The Ultimate Guide. By the way, did you know that the alchemist who discovered gunpowder thought he was creating the elixir of life? Well, if you throw pots full of gunpowder at your enemies, you’ll become immortal (for a while).

The home of ancient man began from fire, so if you don’t want to be dumber than your ancestors you need to learn how to use flint and steel. If all goes smoothly, you’ll be able to build a log house, weave a rug, mould houseware out of clay and build a boat. You’ll learn the art of tying knots and using natural dyes. But above all, you’ll learn how to construct a unique top-class mousetrap, so rodents won’t have any chance. (Failing to do that, read about cat domestication in the Farming section.)

It’s said that wheat domesticated humans rather than the opposite. Agriculture made us who we are today, so in this book you’ll find a detailed description of grain types and animal farming principles. You’ll learn to make fishing nets, help to deliver calves, procure salt and honey. But first you should learn to brew the best-ever wheat beer (which will literally be the best beer in the world since you’ll be the only brewer after the fall of civilization).

Life is not only about surviving; it’s also about not dying of boredom. There will be fewer fights in your survivor camp if you give people cards and chess. Your children won’t set fire to your house (built thanks to the instructions of the Hearth and Home section) because they will be playing ball or flying a kite. You’ll become a local movie mogul if you make a phenakistiscope, a device that creates the illusion of motion. By the way! We’ll tell you how to make a vibrator.

There is nothing similar to the sound of the Australian didg. It’s literally the voice of spirits. This musical instrument exists in all the worlds of the Multiverse, so make sure to read a manual on how to make it. The same applies to the jaw harp, which can be found in the history of any nation on the earth and beyond. During your interworld journey a sitar and a bell will come in handy too. Tell whomever you meet about the music theory of our world and don’t forget to ask about their notation too. 

Rituals, traditions, and etiquette are as significant as mechanisms and materials. The most basic and peculiar inventions of human communication were collected in The Ultimate Guide. How do you tie a tie to make a good impression? What is the philosophy behind fashion? What are the rules of setting a table and marking the road? How exactly do you carry out seppuku in the way that will most impress others?

A Dutch philosopher Johan Huizinga in his book Homo Ludens proved that games appeared long before culture. People enjoyed games and invented a gillion of different games in the ensuing thousand years. Many games also keep arcane knowledge. For example, card suits depict archetypes of the human psyche, chessmen talk about the social organization and hierarchy. You’ll be able to rule the whole world if you know how the main games of humanity, such as football or Monopoly, work and what rules they have.

People had not yet invented writing when they discovered that fried meat was much better than raw and that fermented fruit juice dissipated sorrow and made them sleep like a baby. Over time, cooking has become a real art that requires imagination and ingenuity. Asians held raw fish in a pressing machine for weeks to make sushi. Arab nomads occasionally discovered cheese recipe by keeping milk in bags made of sheep’s stomachs. And don’t forget to learn the recipe of the main food invention, which is bread. Without bread you won’t be able to make your new world fully civilized. 

The intriguing illustrations that combine engineering drawings and medieval art depict the structure of devices and materials in many forms throughout the many worlds of the Multiverse. What does it mean? According to The Ultimate Guide, people find new ideas in the world’s information realm rather than come up with new ones. This means that development of these ideas isn’t connected to anything really. They can appear out of the blue in different worlds of the Multiverse.

In one of these worlds, medieval peasants work fields with tills attached to bicycles. In another world, gladiators of the Colosseum fight under stadium lights. There is a world where indium-gallium alloys are the essence of microelectronics instead of silicon. In one more world zeppelin became the main means of transport when humanity discovered a cheap way to produce helium as opposed to explosive hydrogen. On the pages of The Ultimate Guide you’ll find tons of such examples and probably will think that similar ideas have come to your mind before.

It is made for satisfying curiosity, widening the horizons of your mind, drawing inspiration and teleporting from world to world.

This book will make an excellent gift for all those who are keen on art, technology, history and such puzzling sciences as semiotics and hermeneutics.

It is made for satisfying curiosity, widening the horizones of your mind, drawing inspiration and teleporting from world to world. The book will make an excellent gift for all those who are keen on art, technology, history and even such puzzling sciencesas semiotics and hermeneutics.

The size of The Ultimate Guide is around 13x9 inches and 4.5 pounds. All the pages of the book will be printed on special thick 157gsm paper. This is a high-quality mat art paper, which definitely feels well and holds well. The Ultimate Guide will be a hardcover book and will have stunning matt laminated cover.

 

 



The Book project is promoted by REPROJECT.

story:
Welcome to the Niven's War campaign!

My name is Justin Knight. I am a science fiction author with six published books to my name, including the free one on my mailing list.  This campaign is for the funding of my next book, the Military Science Fiction novel, Niven's War.

Set on a distant, human-populated planet, Niven's War tells the story of a war between two continents that reaches boiling point. Among the fighting, a young fighter pilot struggles to survive when a mission goes wrong and the once escapable pain is now on her doorstep.

Click here to download a preview of the unedited manuscript:   https://dl.bookfunnel.com/dtrxp4ab9p

The cover is illustrated by the amazing Carla Tornielli, an artist whose work I have long admired. After seeing her work for The Grim Reaper and the Sunsworn Source Book, I knew I wanted to work with her on a project, and here it is.

What you are funding:

This campaign is to raise money for the editing and distribution of my novel.

What you need to know:

First off, the book will be around 250 - 300 pages, is already written, and has gone through the first round of edits. Once the campaign is funded, the manuscript will go straight to the editor. You will receive your book much quicker than usual.

The ebook copy will be available for all devices, properly formatted, and looking great, via the BookFunnel app.

Amazon will be used to print the physical copies, making the process cheaper than usual. For those who back a physical copy, it will have to be made available on the site so it can be printed, so please don't be alarmed. However, you will receive your copy at a cheaper price and with a free bookmark.

Stretch Goal Update!

£700 Goal!

Should the project reach £700, I will go straight into production on book two! Every backer who has backed Niven's War will receive a matching copy. If you backed digital, you will get book two digital. If you backed the paperback, you will receive a paperback copy, at no extra cost! Shipping and packaging costs will be on me!
