story:
This campaign is for pre-ordering the book, Walt Disney’s Imagineer Claude Coats—The Making of Disneyland: From Toad Hall to the Haunted Mansion and Beyond. We know there are thousands of readers who want this book, which chronicles Claude Coats' contributions to the creation of Disneyland with Walt Disney.

This book will showcase Claude Coats' key innovations in immersive ride design, and his pioneering use of new technologies and visual methods that still influence theme park experiences today. Here is your chance to own a First Edition of what will be the prize of any Disney collection with its behind-the-scenes text, lush production value and rare, never-before-seen artwork and photos. Supported with the full cooperation of the Claude Coats estate and family, pre-ordering this book is your opportunity to join with us in documenting the legacy of a major creative force in the annals of the Disney universe. This is your chance to make history! 

(The original Toad Hall attraction mural painted by Claude Coats)

Over the last two years, I have worked closely with Claude Coats' son Alan Coats, also an Imagineer, to get a book published about his father through traditional publishing houses. Traditional publishers rely on sales teams to make the decisions on which books get published., so, it's not a surprise that we have been met with “he doesn’t have enough name recognition” from the various  publishers that the project has been pitched to. This has been frustrating to us both because we know that there are thousands of Disney fans and theme park enthusiasts who do know who Claude Coats is and what his stellar accomplishments are in Disney animation and at Disney Theme Parks worldwide. That is why we have decided to pitch to you, the fans and enthusiasts, on pre-ordering Walt Disney’s Imagineer Claude Coats—The Making of Disneyland: From Toad Hall to the Haunted Mansion and Beyond, which we believe will show that this is a story that is worth telling. We hope that you will agree as well.

(Claude Coats and Yale Gracey with Adventure Thru Inner Space model.)

Walt Disney’s Imagineer Claude Coats—The Making of Disneyland: From Toad Hall to the Haunted Mansion and Beyond is the story of artist and designer Claude Coats who, for more than half a century, was one of the most prolific creative talents at The Walt Disney Company and, arguably, the most accomplished. An unpretentious man of strapping stature, Claude was the artist behind some of the most stunning backgrounds produced at the Disney studio during the Golden Age of animation before becoming one of the eighteen founding members, handed-picked by Walt Disney, to start the fabled WED Enterprises—now known as Walt Disney Imagineering.

                  

(Pinocchio backgrounds painted by Claude Coats)

For the first time ever, this all-inclusive book will focus on one of the most revered artists who successfully crossed over from the animation department to become one of the original Imagineers. Working side by side with Walt Disney, Claude Coats was a major influence in not only creating the first theme park, but a new form of creativity called Imagineering that would forever change the worlds of global entertainment, technology, architecture and popular culture.

(Claude Coats, seated center, with (L to R) John Hench, Mary Blair and Walt Disney)

Coats started at the Disney Studios in the background department, working on Mickey and Pluto cartoons. A watershed moment came with his color styling and naturalistic backgrounds for The Old Mill (1937), which featured breakthrough techniques in mood, lighting and color, and the use of the new Multiplane camera, creating what he described as, “the emotional response that comes from a background painting.” His star rose quickly in Walt’s eyes, and he was asked to develop the styling for the opening Wishing Well sequence in Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs.

(Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs, background and overlay by Claude Coats)

With the completion of Lady and the Tramp, Walt Disney asked Claude Coats to be part of the team to design Disneyland. This would begin what Coats would call, “my second Disney career,” as he joined an elite group of artists and engineers working with and on Walt's vision for Disneyland. This book will cover those astonishing first fifteen (15) years of the meteoric rise of the original theme park. 

(Claude Coats painting the scenic flats, in the special effects building on the studio back lot, for the Mr. Toad's Wild Ride attraction at Disneyland, 1955)

With his architectural training and ability to visualize dimensionally, Claude Coats went on to design some of the most beloved theme park attractions including the original Pirates of the Caribbean and the Haunted Mansion. He was known for designing an attraction from the point-of-view of the guest by creating a sense of place that allowed the guest to be part of the story. As Marty Sklar, former head of Walt Disney Imagineering, observed; “Walt saw how Claude could translate his talent into three dimensions, and not everybody could do that. Understanding how things were going to work dimensionally helped him create these immersive environments.”*

*(Dave Bossert & Alan Coats did an extensive interview with Marty Sklar about Claude Coats’ career, one of the last known interviews with Marty before he passed away on July 27, 2017. )

(Claude Coats airbrushing the Pirates attraction model.)

Aside from his contribution to attractions in the original Disneyland theme park, Claude Coats was a key player in the 1964 World’s Fair in New York. He spearheaded the concepts for the Ford Magic Skyway, the GE Carousel of Progress, and the now world famous It’s a Small World attractions. Versions of these and many other iconic attractions that Claude Coats was involved with designing during those pivotal first decades of Disneyland are now permanent fixtures at the Disney theme parks around the world. Walt Disney’s Imagineer Claude Coats—The Making of Disneyland: From Toad Hall to the Haunted Mansion and Beyond will explain in detail the behind-the-scenes stories and anecdotes that make many of these Disneyland attractions iconic. 

(Claude Coats with Walt Disney discussing Primeval World, 1966)

Claude Coats was one of the chief Imagineers involved in the Haunted Mansion, which was the first new major attraction built after Walt passed away in 1966. Claude Coats is best known for creating the spooky, moody atmosphere in the first half of the ride as well as making this a much more scary experience. The original Haunted Mansion at Disneyland is a fan favorite at Halloween with Tim Burton's The Nightmare Before Christmas overlay. Variations of the Haunted Mansion are still one of the seminal attractions at the Disney parks worldwide today.

(Concept art by Claude Coats of the Haunted Mansion graveyard.)

Throughout his career, Claude Coats painted profusely on his own time, often while traveling. He was a master water-colorist known for his layered washes and skillful painting.  His personal art would change from watercolor in the 30s (when he became a member of the California Watercolor Society), to poster paint in the 40s, and by the 60s, working in acrylic, colored pencil and marker—mastering each medium.

In his years as an Imagineer, Claude Coats was known as a mentor to many young artists and aspiring theme park designers. He was always an approachable individual and Dave had the pleasure to know him in his last years at Walt Disney Imagineering. Claude Coats was always generous with his time and they had many wonderful conversations together.

(Claude Coats with Baloo walk-around-character at the Magic Kingdom, Orlando, 1973.)

Walt Disney’s Imagineer Claude Coats—The Making of Disneyland: From Toad Hall to the Haunted Mansion and Beyond is a comprehensive volume generously illustrated with rarely seen artwork from seminal theme park attractions, the 1964 World’s Fair, and Claude Coats' personal work. It will include a thorough text chronicling attractions designed by this Disney Legend, who helped to realize Walt's dreams of a Magic Kingdom and EPCOT in Florida. He also helped spread the magic of Disney entertainment worldwide to Tokyo Disneyland and Disneyland Paris. 

Dave has received permission and the full cooperation of the family, which is allowing unprecedented access to Claude Coats’ papers, artwork and photos.  Claude’s son Alan Coats, an Imagineer in his own right who worked with his father, will write the Introduction. This book will appeal to Disney animation and theme park fans alike. It will be a must have book—the first ever, in-depth look at Claude Coats, one the legendary Disney artists responsible for how animated films translated into immersive theme park experiences.

(Claude Coats discussing the Sleeping Beauty Castle walk-through with Fred Joerger, Walt Disney, Claude and Ken Anderson.) 

Alan and I are launching this campaign to produce a beautifully crafted book on Claude Coats and his pivotal contributions to the creation of Disneyland. Pre-orders of at least 1000 books are needed in order to make this a viable campaign meeting the level of quality this book deserves. As many of you know, Dave took on the mission to document Kem Weber's furniture designs for the Disney Studios and that has become a multi-award-winning book. It also featured many never-before-seen photos and images. We will do the same for this tome and maintain the same level of quality for Walt Disney’s Imagineer Claude Coats—The Making of Disneyland: From Toad Hall to the Haunted Mansion and Beyond.

(Claude Coats working in his home studio.)

We want to raise at least $40,000 in order to have this book professionally created using top quality materials, printing and book binding techniques. This will also cover additional costs associated with publishing including editing, copy editing, design & layout, licensing fees, distribution, shipping, marketing, promotion and advertising. That means if 1000 people order the book at the pre-order price of $40.00, we will be able to create this book. Ultimately, we would like to sell out the 3,000 copy print run. If we do, we may be able to print a softcover version of the book to satisfy any additional demand. Frankly, we would love nothing better than to prove that there are thousands of interested individuals who do know who Claude Coats is and what he contributed to the making of Disneyland. We hope that you agree and will purchase your copy of this important book. Be a part of making Disney history!

Thank you in advance for your consideration and support.

-Dave Bossert & Alan Coats

The sizes listed are the actual image dimensions and there is an additional one-and-half inch white boarder around the image making the overall size three inches larger in height and width.   

The Impact

Walt Disney’s Imagineer Claude Coats—The Making of Disneyland: From Toad Hall to the Haunted Mansion and Beyond will be an important part of the ever expanding story of Disney. It will be another document of the legacy, history and valuable contributions made by Claude Coats to the Disney timeline. As many of you know, we have taken on passion projects in the past and have completed everything we've set out to do. If we can meet our funding goal, we will deliver to you a stunning book with some material you've likely never seen before!

Risks & Challenges

As with any new project there are always risks and challenges. There are hurdles to overcome and unforeseen situations, but that's what makes it fun! We have never backed away from obstacles and this book will be no different. When we start a project, we will finish that project. We have the track-record to prove it. Please note that often times the scope of a book, its title and other production aspects may change as the project evolves. Please visit author Dave Bossert's website to see his publishing accomplishments to date at: www.davidbossert.com 

Other Ways You Can Help

Our hope is that this story is a compelling reason why you will pre-order Walt Disney’s Imagineer Claude Coats—The Making of Disneyland: From Toad Hall to the Haunted Mansion and Beyond. If you agree and order the book, we thank you. You can also help us by getting the word out to your friends and social networks. This campaign will run for 60 days and our hope is that we can meet and exceed the goal in that time frame and then get cracking on producing this long overdue book on Claude Coats.

This campaign is for pre-ordering the book, Walt Disney’s Imagineer Claude Coats—The Making of Disneyland: From Toad Hall to the Haunted Mansion and Beyond. We know there are thousands of readers who want this book, which chronicles Claude Coats' contributions to the creation of Disneyland with Walt Disney.
This book will showcase Claude Coats' key innovations in immersive ride design, and his pioneering use of new technologies and visual methods that still influence theme park experiences today. Here is your chance to own a First Edition of what will be the prize of any Disney collection with its behind-the-scenes text, lush production value and rare, never-before-seen artwork and photos. Supported with the full cooperation of the Claude Coats estate and family, pre-ordering this book is your opportunity to join with us in documenting the legacy of a major creative force in the annals of the Disney universe. This is your chance to make history! 

(The original Toad Hall attraction mural painted by Claude Coats) 
Over the last two years, I have worked closely with Claude Coats' son Alan Coats, also an Imagineer, to get a book published about his father through traditional publishing houses. Traditional publishers rely on sales teams to make the decisions on which books get published., so, it's not a surprise that we have been met with “he doesn’t have enough name recognition” from the various  publishers that the project has been pitched to. This has been frustrating to us both because we know that there are thousands of Disney fans and theme park enthusiasts who do know who Claude Coats is and what his stellar accomplishments are in Disney animation and at Disney Theme Parks worldwide. That is why we have decided to pitch to you, the fans and enthusiasts, on pre-ordering Walt Disney’s Imagineer Claude Coats—The Making of Disneyland: From Toad Hall to the Haunted Mansion and Beyond, which we believe will show that this is a story that is worth telling. We hope that you will agree as well.

(Claude Coats and Yale Gracey with Adventure Thru Inner Space model.)
Walt Disney’s Imagineer Claude Coats—The Making of Disneyland: From Toad Hall to the Haunted Mansion and Beyond is the story of artist and designer Claude Coats who, for more than half a century, was one of the most prolific creative talents at The Walt Disney Company and, arguably, the most accomplished. An unpretentious man of strapping stature, Claude was the artist behind some of the most stunning backgrounds produced at the Disney studio during the Golden Age of animation before becoming one of the eighteen founding members, handed-picked by Walt Disney, to start the fabled WED Enterprises—now known as Walt Disney Imagineering.
                  
(Pinocchio backgrounds painted by Claude Coats)
For the first time ever, this all-inclusive book will focus on one of the most revered artists who successfully crossed over from the animation department to become one of the original Imagineers. Working side by side with Walt Disney, Claude Coats was a major influence in not only creating the first theme park, but a new form of creativity called Imagineering that would forever change the worlds of global entertainment, technology, architecture and popular culture.

(Claude Coats, seated center, with (L to R) John Hench, Mary Blair and Walt Disney) 
Coats started at the Disney Studios in the background department, working on Mickey and Pluto cartoons. A watershed moment came with his color styling and naturalistic backgrounds for The Old Mill (1937), which featured breakthrough techniques in mood, lighting and color, and the use of the new Multiplane camera, creating what he described as, “the emotional response that comes from a background painting.” His star rose quickly in Walt’s eyes, and he was asked to develop the styling for the opening Wishing Well sequence in Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs.

(Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs, background and overlay by Claude Coats) 
With the completion of Lady and the Tramp, Walt Disney asked Claude Coats to be part of the team to design Disneyland. This would begin what Coats would call, “my second Disney career,” as he joined an elite group of artists and engineers working with and on Walt's vision for Disneyland. This book will cover those astonishing first fifteen (15) years of the meteoric rise of the original theme park. 

(Claude Coats painting the scenic flats, in the special effects building on the studio back lot, for the Mr. Toad's Wild Ride attraction at Disneyland, 1955) 
With his architectural training and ability to visualize dimensionally, Claude Coats went on to design some of the most beloved theme park attractions including the original Pirates of the Caribbean and the Haunted Mansion. He was known for designing an attraction from the point-of-view of the guest by creating a sense of place that allowed the guest to be part of the story. As Marty Sklar, former head of Walt Disney Imagineering, observed; “Walt saw how Claude could translate his talent into three dimensions, and not everybody could do that. Understanding how things were going to work dimensionally helped him create these immersive environments.”*
*(Dave Bossert & Alan Coats did an extensive interview with Marty Sklar about Claude Coats’ career, one of the last known interviews with Marty before he passed away on July 27, 2017. )

(Claude Coats airbrushing the Pirates attraction model.) 
Aside from his contribution to attractions in the original Disneyland theme park, Claude Coats was a key player in the 1964 World’s Fair in New York. He spearheaded the concepts for the Ford Magic Skyway, the GE Carousel of Progress, and the now world famous It’s a Small World attractions. Versions of these and many other iconic attractions that Claude Coats was involved with designing during those pivotal first decades of Disneyland are now permanent fixtures at the Disney theme parks around the world. Walt Disney’s Imagineer Claude Coats—The Making of Disneyland: From Toad Hall to the Haunted Mansion and Beyond will explain in detail the behind-the-scenes stories and anecdotes that make many of these Disneyland attractions iconic. 

(Claude Coats with Walt Disney discussing Primeval World, 1966)
Claude Coats was one of the chief Imagineers involved in the Haunted Mansion, which was the first new major attraction built after Walt passed away in 1966. Claude Coats is best known for creating the spooky, moody atmosphere in the first half of the ride as well as making this a much more scary experience. The original Haunted Mansion at Disneyland is a fan favorite at Halloween with Tim Burton's The Nightmare Before Christmas overlay. Variations of the Haunted Mansion are still one of the seminal attractions at the Disney parks worldwide today.

(Concept art by Claude Coats of the Haunted Mansion graveyard.)
Throughout his career, Claude Coats painted profusely on his own time, often while traveling. He was a master water-colorist known for his layered washes and skillful painting.  His personal art would change from watercolor in the 30s (when he became a member of the California Watercolor Society), to poster paint in the 40s, and by the 60s, working in acrylic, colored pencil and marker—mastering each medium.
In his years as an Imagineer, Claude Coats was known as a mentor to many young artists and aspiring theme park designers. He was always an approachable individual and Dave had the pleasure to know him in his last years at Walt Disney Imagineering. Claude Coats was always generous with his time and they had many wonderful conversations together.

(Claude Coats with Baloo walk-around-character at the Magic Kingdom, Orlando, 1973.)

story:
The New Gods Have Won

Or so they thought...

The New Gods struggle to dominate the planet. Through their cultists, monsters and puppets, they wage a shadow war for total supremacy.  Only the Special Tasks Section could keep them from tearing the world apart.  Sworn to protect the innocent, they are the thin blue line between civilization and utter chaos. 

And the STS has been disbanded.

Its equipment has been confiscated. Its support networks have been shut down. Its operators have been scattered to the winds. With the STS gone, there is no one left who can stand against the dark gods and horrific monsters roaming the streets of Nova Babylonia. 

The New Gods have won.

Or so they thought. 

For the operators of Team Black Watch, the mission continues. So long as they draw breath, the war is not over. 

Dispersed across Nova Babylonia, driven deep underground, the men of Team Black Watch do what they can in their own ways to keep the horrors at bay. But when the New Gods launch a fresh offensive, it falls to team sniper Kayla Fox to reconnect the team.

Armed with next-generation weaponry and cutting-edge technologies, they must once again take up arms against the New Gods, and keep them from dragging the world into Hell. 

But the odds are stacked against them. The authorities will not protect them. Their resources are limited. The New Gods have new surprises waiting for them. 

Worst of all, Yuri Yamamoto, Christian mystic and street samurai, the only man who can stand fast against the soul-crushing powers of the New Gods, is in exile. 

With their ace gone, Team Black Watch must find a way to resist the overwhelming power of the New Gods. 

All of humanity depends on it. 

 

The Details

The sequel to Babylon Blues, Babylon Red combines four previously-published webserials and a new never-before-published novel in a single collection. 

This collection includes:

  • Wolves of Babylon

After six months of wandering the nation, Karim Mustafa is called back to Babylon. His patron deity, Galen the White, needs him. Rival Dark Powers seek to press Galen into their service—or destroy him. 

Partnering with Kayla Fox, Karim and Galen must wage a war on two fronts to protect their holdings, and to determine who is the true alpha wolf of Babylon. 

  • Sheriff of the Swamps

James Wood is done with war. He has retreated to his family farm on Moreno Island. But the New Gods aren't done with him. 

Detective Janet Clark is running for Sheriff. Standing against her is a puppet of the New Gods. Despite the odds against her, she is making headway. Now the New Gods want to destroy.

If she wins, James gains a powerful ally. If she dies, he is next.  

James and Kayla must team up to protect Clark from an army of hitmen and monsters. But when the New Gods are involved, things always get complicated. 

  • River of Blood

All Will Connor wants to do is to piece together what's left of his life. But when an attempted hit goes awry, the Liberated finds him. 

And makes a deal with him. 

They will help him find the hitmen. All they want in return is for him to do what he does best.

But nothing is ever that easy when the New Gods are involved. Together with Kayla and Zen Tan, he must find a way to climb out of this situation with his soul intact.

Even if it means wading through a river of blood. 

  • Hunters of the Void

A mysterious hacker contacts Zen Tan with a powerful proposition: carry out a heist, and he will earn a friend for life. 

The catch is, the target of the heist is the Void Collective. A hive mind that will know when its possessions have been stolen. And it will react with extreme violence.

If anyone can do this, it's Zen and Kayla. But this job may just take them to the brink of destruction. 

  • Babylon Red

A voracious predator haunts the waterways of Babylon. Everywhere it goes, it abducts the hapless and the unwary, and leaves witnesses shaken to the depths of their souls. With every hunt, it grows even more powerful. 

The New Gods are pointing the finger at each other. They each believe the other gods have unleashed the horror on Babylon. The authorities are powerless to stop them. This leaves Team Black Watch with only one option. 

Destroy the monster before the New Gods destroy Babylon. 

And without being destroyed in turn. 

A tall order, even for the most formidable operators in the nation. But this time, they have an edge.

This time, they have Yuri Yamamoto. 

This last story is exclusive to this collection. 

BABYLON RED is a massive tome. Presently the entire manuscript runs to 199000 words. Such a huge book would be impossible for most people to publish.

But with your help, it can become a reality. 

 

The Plan

I am Singapore's first Hugo and Dragon Award nominated author. With three successful crowdfunded campaigns and 14 published novels under my belt, I have the experience and the skills to see this project through. 

This campaign aims to cover the costs of publishing BABYLON RED. Contributions will go towards covering the costs of production, especially the cover art and formatting.

By backing this project, you ensure its success. You show the world that you value works that place you as their top priority. You support the indies who work for you, not the gatekeepers who value only their bottom line. 

Best of all, you will receive this book at least two weeks ahead of the market!

The campaign will run for 30 days. In July, the artist will get to work. By September, I plan to deliver the completed book to all backers. 

BABYLON RED is guerilla warfare against eldritch abominations and their cultists, fought with high-powered railguns, cyberwarfare tools, and cold steel. 

Back the project now, and boost the signal to your fellow SFF readers!

Risks & Challenges

Minimal.

The manuscript is complete. The artist has been booked. The formatter is ready to go.

The only major challenge is a sudden emergency that would take the artist and/or formatter out of action. In that unlikely event, I have alternates on standby. 

With my record of completed projects, you can rest assured that your money will go to good use. 

Outreach

Want to stay up to date with my latest news and promotions?

Sign up for my newsletter and receive a free cyberpunk short story set in the universe of Singularity Sunrise!

Subscribe here!

Back BABYLON RED, subscribe now, and get word of the next campaign ahead of everyone else!

story:
Heroine Adventure is the world's first-ever pulp heroines magazine. Presented in traditional 7x10 format, at 128 pages, with illustrations throughout, Heroine Adventure #1 is a standalone, full-length pulp novel and is a true throwback to the classic pulps of yesteryear.

For fans of: Doc Savage, The Shadow, The Spider, Operator #5, and all the classic "hero pulps."

THE STORY

AVA ATLAS is the daughter of scientific expatriates. Born with enhanced bone and muscle density, she has trained her entire life to protect the world as a pulp superwoman. When her father's old colleague vanishes after sending a mysterious telegram, Ava finds that her father faces the same danger from an enigmatic order of faceless figures. Now, Ava must uncover the dark designs of a sinister mastermind shrouded in myth before he can use the world's most prestigious scientific minds to wrap a clawed hand around the globe.
 

COVER A (STANDARD)
 

COVER B (VINTAGE)

 

INTERIOR ARTWORK SAMPLE

 

INTERIOR ARTWORK SAMPLE

THE CAST

AVA ATLAS

The daughter of scientific expatriates, Ava Atlas was born with anomalous bone and muscle density, and has trained her entire life to hone her skills and abilities in order to protect the world and punish villainy as a veritable pulp superwoman.

THE SLEEPING DRAGON

A name whispered in the shadows of the East; a sinister mastermind with a cult of faceless fanatics and the clawed sleeve of an ancient hero's mystical armor, which he has twisted to empower his dark sorcery.

MEI SHUN

Daughter of the Dragon, Mei Shun commands the fanatical Mian Shouwei - the Unseen Guard - tasked with learning everything her father knows, including the dark arts, in preparation to take over his devious machinations in his absence.

INSPECTOR SIN

An occult investigator familiar with the depths of the macabre and proprietor of a mystical pocket watch fueled by blood, Inspector Sin encountered the Sleeping Dragon over a decade ago, and has shrugged off retirement now that his old nemesis has returned.
 

INSPECTOR SIN AND THE SECOND HAND OF SHADOWS

All backers also receive a physical copy of Inspector Sin and the Second Hand of Shadows, the 32-page novella that pre-dates Heroine Adventure #1 and tells the story of how Inspector Sin initially came into possession of his mysterious pocket watch.

PULP ADVENTURE TROVE

HEROINE ADVENTURE GUIDE

Included with the Pulp Adventure Trove, the Heroine Adventure Guide is a companion book that includes character designs and related notes, as well as every piece of artwork from Heroine Adventure Magazine #1 - condensed into this handy companion.

THE PULP ADVENTURE TROVE INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING:

  • Cover A (Standard) - The standard cover for Heroine Adventure #1.
  • Cover B (Vintage) - Vintage-style variant cover for Heroine Adventure #1, designed to have an aged appearance, complete with scuffs, cracks, etc.
  • Inspector Sin and the Second Hand of Shadows - A 32 page novella detailing the origins of Inspector Sin's mysterious pocket watch. 
  • The Heroine Adventure Companion - a companion book with character designs, notes, and all the artwork from the magazine.
  • Double-Sided Bookmark - Logo on one side and artwork on the other.
  • Adventure Society Membership Card - Show off your Adventure Society credentials and use the secret code on the back to decipher coded messages in the pages of Heroine Adventure.
  • Character Art Prints - Set of 4 art prints includes Ava Atlas, The Sleeping Dragon, Mei Shun, and Inspector Sin.

Heroine Adventure is the world's first-ever pulp heroines magazine. Presented in traditional 7x10 format, at 128 pages, with illustrations throughout, Heroine Adventure #1 is a standalone, full-length pulp novel and is a true throwback to the classic pulps of yesteryear.
For fans of: Doc Savage, The Shadow, The Spider, Operator #5, and all the classic "hero pulps."


THE STORY
AVA ATLAS is the daughter of scientific expatriates. Born with enhanced bone and muscle density, she has trained her entire life to protect the world as a pulp superwoman. When her father's old colleague vanishes after sending a mysterious telegram, Ava finds that her father faces the same danger from an enigmatic order of faceless figures. Now, Ava must uncover the dark designs of a sinister mastermind shrouded in myth before he can use the world's most prestigious scientific minds to wrap a clawed hand around the globe. 

COVER A (STANDARD) 

COVER B (VINTAGE)
 

INTERIOR ARTWORK SAMPLE
 

INTERIOR ARTWORK SAMPLE


THE CAST

AVA ATLAS
The daughter of scientific expatriates, Ava Atlas was born with anomalous bone and muscle density, and has trained her entire life to hone her skills and abilities in order to protect the world and punish villainy as a veritable pulp superwoman.

THE SLEEPING DRAGON
A name whispered in the shadows of the East; a sinister mastermind with a cult of faceless fanatics and the clawed sleeve of an ancient hero's mystical armor, which he has twisted to empower his dark sorcery.

MEI SHUN
Daughter of the Dragon, Mei Shun commands the fanatical Mian Shouwei - the Unseen Guard - tasked with learning everything her father knows, including the dark arts, in preparation to take over his devious machinations in his absence.

INSPECTOR SIN
An occult investigator familiar with the depths of the macabre and proprietor of a mystical pocket watch fueled by blood, Inspector Sin encountered the Sleeping Dragon over a decade ago, and has shrugged off retirement now that his old nemesis has returned. 

INSPECTOR SIN AND THE SECOND HAND OF SHADOWS
All backers also receive a physical copy of Inspector Sin and the Second Hand of Shadows, the 32-page novella that pre-dates Heroine Adventure #1 and tells the story of how Inspector Sin initially came into possession of his mysterious pocket watch.

PULP ADVENTURE TROVE

HEROINE ADVENTURE GUIDE
Included with the Pulp Adventure Trove, the Heroine Adventure Guide is a companion book that includes character designs and related notes, as well as every piece of artwork from Heroine Adventure Magazine #1 - condensed into this handy companion.

THE PULP ADVENTURE TROVE INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING:


Cover A (Standard) - The standard cover for Heroine Adventure #1.

Cover B (Vintage) - Vintage-style variant cover for Heroine Adventure #1, designed to have an aged appearance, complete with scuffs, cracks, etc.

Inspector Sin and the Second Hand of Shadows - A 32 page novella detailing the origins of Inspector Sin's mysterious pocket watch. 

The Heroine Adventure Companion - a companion book with character designs, notes, and all the artwork from the magazine.

Double-Sided Bookmark - Logo on one side and artwork on the other.

Adventure Society Membership Card - Show off your Adventure Society credentials and use the secret code on the back to decipher coded messages in the pages of Heroine Adventure.

story:
An Adventure Story About an Extraordinary Woman Who Chose Her Own Way — and Changed the World!

by Geralyn Gendreau

My new book, Jungle Jean, is the official biography of Jean Liedloff, acclaimed author of The Continuum Concept. Her story spans the better part of the 20th century, including scenes from Jean’s childhood in Upper West Side Manhattan, her life as an ingénue modeling for Paris Vogue, the legendary “Party of the Century” on the Grand Canal in Venice, and her unusual alliance with the Italian count she convinced to take her along on a diamond hunting expedition in the Venezuelan jungle.

After that first expedition, Jean returned to her native New York for a different type of adventure, hobnobbing with the likes of George Plimpton, Norman Mailer, Andrew Wyeth, and Margaret Mead, amongst other celebrities, luminaries, and Beat Generation freethinkers of the 1960s.

But the jungle activated something so powerful in Jean, she had to go back and discover what only the pristine rainforest and its inhabitants could reveal. Upon her return to the States, she became a minor celebrity, was interviewed by Barbara Walters, and even appeared on the Johnny Carson show with her pet anteater Clovis in tow. Ten years later, after her fifth and final trip to the Amazon, Jean wrote The Continuum Concept, her now classic treatise on human nature, which led to her decades-long career as a trusted advisor and mentor to parents around the world.

How Jean Liedloff’s Fascination with the Jungle Led to Her Breakthrough: The Continuum Concept

“If the world could be saved by a book, this just might be the book.”
John Holt, author of How Children Learn

Holt was referring to Jean’s 1975 masterpiece, The Continuum Concept, which has been translated into 20 languages, inspiring hundreds of thousands of mothers around the world to trust what their culture taught them to deny: the ancient feminine wisdom in their very bones.

The revolutionary ideas in Jean’s book (many of which are now common knowledge), grew out of informal observations while she lived among the indigenous tribes of the Amazon back in the 1950s and 60s. The book soon became the go-to resource for conscious parents as continuum-informed parenting styles came into vogue.

It’s through her book that I met Jean decades ago and began a relationship that started with her in a mentoring role. Over the years, it blossomed into an enduring friendship which, though often challenging, lasted to her final days. While on her deathbed, Jean honored me with an invitation to write her biography. It was the assignment of a lifetime.

After eight years of hard work, the biography is now complete!

Jungle Jean captures the essence of Jean’s phenomenal life story and the natural parenting movement inspired by her book, including real-life stories — never before published — that bring a deeper understanding of continuum parenting principles and the woman who brought them to light.

Countless parents have said things like, “After reading Jean’s book, I threw all the other parenting manuals away.” This biography will have a similar impact. A captivating adventure story full of psychological insights, Jungle Jean presents Liedloff’s ideas in a way that will make them more accessible to the Millennial, Gen Z, and Alpha-Generation parents who will carry the continuum concept fully into the 21st century.

Jungle Jean Has Already Been Endorsed by Five New York Times Bestselling Authors!

“Jungle Jean ... shows how we can make the journey back to a society characterized by cooperation and joy.”
— Gloria Steinem, The Revolution Within
“The principles of intuitive parenting Jean Liedloff witnessed in the Amazon rainforest and wrote about in The Continuum Concept are valued worldwide. This riveting read gives parents tools to raise more competent and confident children.
— Dr. William Sears, The Attachment Parenting Book
“A refreshing view of human nature. Jungle Jean shows that we truly are designed to be happy.”
— Marcie Shimoff, Happy for No Reason
“A deeply moving story told by a master storyteller... Jungle Jean offers profound insights into the source of well-being.”
— Deborah King, Truth Heals
“This is an important life-changing book, a juicy transformative biography of a pioneer and adventurer told by a fearless friend who reveals the shared wounds of the modern-day human condition. You may come for the storytelling, but you'll leave with compassionate understanding for yourself and others. Highly recommended.”
— Arielle Ford, The Soulmate Secret

As word gets out, the endorsements keep rolling in, most recently from bestselling authors Riane Eisler (The Chalice and the Blade) and Jean Houston (The Possible Human), and Grammy winner Kenny Loggins (Danny's Song) is reading the book now!

It’s time to publish Jean’s biography and breathe new life into the parenting practices she inspired, now backed by scientific research, including studies at the University of Notre Dame, as well as neuro-imaging studies of what Dr. William Sears calls the “mommy brain.”

Jungle Jean Goes Beyond Childrearing and Offers a Vital, Uplifting Message for Our Times

Jean’s experiences while living in the jungle among indigenous people caused her to question our culture’s basic assumptions about human nature — assumptions that have never been more devastating than they are right now. The startling conclusion Jean arrived at — that we are innately cooperative and designed to be happy — carries a vital, uplifting message for our time.

This book speaks to people from all walks of life. Readers of personal growth books will be moved by powerful insights on how we humans can create secure, high-functioning relationships. All who crave enduring, harmonious love-bonds with other human beings will be deeply touched by Jean’s story.

Imagine what the world would look like if the whole of humanity truly understood our essential, inbuilt needs. And that when those needs are met, we grow into happy, cooperative people who live in harmony with others and have the clarity of mind and heart to solve our biggest problems. This is what John Holt meant when he said Jean’s ideas could save the world.

A Renaissance for The Continuum Concept

Join this campaign and help us carry on Jean’s legacy. Her biography is an amazing story by itself — sure to entertain, fascinate, and rock the worlds of those who read it. Add to that Jungle Jean’s potential to introduce future generations to her crucial insights — and to deepen the understanding of those already in the know — and we have an opportunity too powerful to ignore!

So many people feel helpless to do anything about the state of the world. But each human baby has a unique genius that wants to flower and be expressed in service to the world. Clearly, if we’re going to “save the world” we need a whole generation of geniuses right now.

I feel blessed to have been given a high-impact item on my to-do list. But I can’t do it without YOU. Supporting this campaign is your YES vote for humanity, for the continuation of our species on this beautiful blue-green planet.

NOTE: To see detailed descriptions of the “perks” for campaign contributors click or tap once on each perk listed.

Our Funding Goals

Mission-critical goal: $48k

Cover design and printing costs along with the expert consulting and comprehensive publicity campaign that will help Jungle Jean break through all the noise and get noticed by those who will benefit the most.

Stretch goal: $68k

An additional $20,000 will make it possible to produce and publish the audio book, fund the podcast production and launch, and retain a social media expert for ongoing marketing.

Big Hairy Audacious goal: $98k

With another $30,000, we can extend our multifaceted marketing strategy for up to six additional months. Our goal is no less than getting Jungle Jean on the New York Times bestseller list!

Our Publishing Dream Team

  • Tom Jenks, editor extraordinaire, whose client list includes Pulitzer and Nobel Prize winners Alice Munro, Jennifer Egan, and Tobias Wolfe, and the legendary novelist E.L. Doctorow.
  • Susan Shankin, Perspicacity Press
  • Scott Noelle, ContinuumConcept.org
  • Randy Peyser, AuthorOneStop.com
  • Darcy Hughes, Dream Book Marketing
  • Brooks Cole, Brand Strategist & ResonantBrand
  • Jaqueline Walley, copy editor
  • Byron Belistos, Origin Press
  • Laurie Masters, Precision Revision
  • Geoff Affleck, Amazon optimization
  • Ruth “Wonder Lady” Schwartz

...and many more, too numerous to list here, whose talent and passion are taking Jungle Jean to the finish line!

Timeline and Release Date

June 26, 2021 is our projected publication date. The book is currently in the final stages and will be sent to the printer the first week of May for delivery 4-6 weeks later. As we progress, I will update you on the specific release date for online purchases, and when you can expect your perks to be delivered. I will also send info on various online outlets where you can purchase the book, including the Jungle Jean website. We hope to create an audiobook within a year after the book is published.

While any project can run into unforeseen obstacles, I’m confident Jungle Jean will be printed on time without issue, thanks to the fantastic professionals on the team.

Meet the Author

Hi. I’m Geralyn Gendreau, Jean Liedloff’s authorized biographer and the founder of Precision House Publishing. I received my psychotherapy license 1995, the same year I met Jean Liedloff. Then, in 2002, my love for writing led me to take on a side-gig at Authors Publishing Cooperative. Three years later, I’d co-authored and edited four Elite Books anthologies and, in short order, was offered my first of many ghostwriting projects. Now a professional writer and editor with an 18-year track record and more than 20 books to my credit, I imagined getting my own book published would be fairly straightforward. But I was still naïve to the realities of traditional publishing.

After working on Jungle Jean for many years, my hard work caught the attention of an editor at a major New York publishing house. She had read The Continuum Concept and based her parenting style on Jean’s work. I felt certain I’d found my publisher. However, as is all too common in the publishing world, after six months and many unanswered emails, she told me her higher-ups had opted not to take on the project. Two agents and 18 months later, Jungle Jean still had no publisher.

With every new delay, I felt a growing sense of urgency to get my book in the hands of the people who need it NOW — not just the parents who are seeking deeper insights into Jean’s ideas, but anyone seeking true, hope-filled stories reflecting the deeper goodness of humanity. That’s what inspired me to launch my own publishing firm: Precision House. (“Nothing random about us!”)

We believe every great story should have the opportunity to be told, and that writers who have done the work of authoring a good book should be able to get it published in months rather than years.

To that end, I am publishing Jungle Jean with the help of seasoned professionals to gain the knowledge and experience I need to help others get their stories out there.

I have also launched The Author’s Chrysalis, a six-month mastermind program in which I share my expertise as a writer and show clients how to consistently access flow states so they become one of those authors who says, “My book practically wrote itself.”

A platform OF the storytellers, BY the storytellers, and FOR the storytellers. We want every great story to have a chance to be told.

 

Jean Liedloff loved to paint, too!

The perks we’re offering supporters include high-quality art prints of the following four paintings by Jean Liedloff:

 

Please note the number next to the print or prints you want to receive. See the FAQ section for more info about the paintings.

story:
- STUKA -

THE DOCTRINE OF THE GERMAN

DIVE-BOMBER

We are excited to announce our new book Stuka - The Doctrine of the German Dive-Bomber, offering an unprecedented look at the famous Junkers Ju 87 from World War 2. Supporters of this book can choose from a variety of exclusive offers and can actively help expand and improve the book by a series of stretch goals.

Your support ensured the success of our two previous books: The German Army Regulation 470/7 - The Medium Tank Company and the German Army Pamphlet 25a/16: The Assault Platoon of the Grenadier-Company. We want to continue along the path of improving access to German original documents by refining our projects further. With Stuka - The Doctrine of the German Dive-Bomber you can be a part of this journey, as we try to set a new standard in allowing more people access to German documents from World War 2 that further our understanding of it. This is why this third entry is somewhat distinct from the two earlier books in the series.

With the translation of several key original documents, Stuka - The Doctrine of the German Dive-Bomber offers an in-depth look at the tactics, doctrine, training and operational use of the Ju 87, thus having a different scope over the previous releases. Also, by focusing entirely on the English translation, we are able to provide more information and context in our explorative articles that accompany the primary sources.

While this aircraft has been covered in many books, we believe that Stuka - The Doctrine of the German Dive-Bomber is not just distinct but offers a completely new appreciation of this famous bird as we are putting the original sources center stage. Carefully translated into English, these will offer details and new reflections on the Ju 87, with a lot of supplementary information added for your reading pleasure.

As a unique collection of reference documents, annotated and explored in full detail, this book provides something for enthusiasts, history buffs, collectors, historians and researchers, making a great addition to any collection.

What You Get & Why It Is Unique

Stuka - The Doctrine of the German Dive-Bomber includes 8 original Luftwaffe documents translated into English, alongside introductory essays that provide additional information and context. These documents have been carefully curated and gathered from various archives to provide you with the best foundation on the tactics, doctrine, organization, training and operational experience with the Junkers Ju 87 dive-bomber. And the best part is, as far as we can tell, these documents have never been published like this before! These documents include:

  • A full organizational breakdown of a Sturzkampfgeschwader (Dive-Bomber Group), giving a complete look at the structure of a unit. This is accompanied with a visualization chart for quick reference that reflects a full Geschwader (Group) from the individual over to the complete unit.
  • The original training manual on how to dive-bomb with the Junkers Ju 87, illustrated with more than a dozen graphs and visualizations that provide you with a fantastic representation of the given examples.
  • A full original description of the tasks and roles of dive-bombers in the Luftwaffe, giving you the full picture on how the Germans conceptualized the role of the Junkers Ju 87 during World War 2.
  • Ju 87s against motorized columns - how does this work? Look no further than the pamphlet on the use of dive-bomber units against motorized ground forces, foreshadowing the use of the Ju 87 in the campaigns against Poland, France and the Soviet Union.
  • Night bombing in the Ju 87? Yes, it's possible as the notice on the special guidelines on night dive-bombing with the Ju 87 will show!
  • and much more.

 

These documents will allow you not only to read how the Luftwaffe planned to use the Ju 87, but you will also discover the experiences gained in the actual operations, right out of the mouth (or rather, typewriter) of the Luftwaffe.

Stretch goals

Getting this project beyond the minimal funding will allow us to make it even better. With more support, we will be able to upgrade this book by including extra content into the final print.

Current progress

As with our previous projects, we present this project to you after having already invested considerable time and effort into it. As such, you are not backing a product that has yet to be made.

The next steps are:

  1. Finalize short essays providing additional information on relevant documents.
  2. Finish the translation into the final annotated English text.
  3. Complete the formatting and editing of the manuscript.
  4. Order test prints to check the product.
  5. Getting it printed, (and signed for signed copies) and sent to you.

 

The Team & Vision

Christoph Bergs (Military Aviation History) and Bernhard Kast (Military History Visualized)

We are both native German speakers and have worked professionally in English for over five years, continuously translating and exploring German original documents in our daily work. Our vision is to facilitate better access to German primary sources from World War 2 so as to improve our understanding of this critical time in history.

Our past projects were The German Army Regulation 470/7 - The Medium Tank Company and the German Army Pamphlet 25a/16: The Assault Platoon of the Grenadier-Company. Both followed this vision and were also successfully crowdfunded by your support.

As the third release in the series, Stuka - The Doctrine of the German Dive-Bomber we want to do even better, further refining the formula and giving you a new experience in getting down into the very details of the Luftwaffe's own theories and pratical use of one of the most famous aircraft from World War 2.

Shipping

We are happy to announce that shipping is, as usual, included in the final price and that no additional charges are put in place by us for you to receive your book. Based on our previous experiences, we have optimised our printing and shipping processes, ensuring that your orders will be handled promptly and efficiently.

  • Impact of Covid-19: In our last campaign, Covid-19 did have an unexpected impact on production and shipment costs. We did not roll any additional costs on our supporters since this would have been unfair. For this campaign, we do need to take into account these new additional costs. As such the fraction of the cost that was covering shipping has increased to compensate for these new fees.

Our printer produces our books in multiple countries (US & EU). As such it is unlikely that the majority of supporters will be paying additional fees for customs fees, import duties, VAT, or other related charges. While this seems to not have impacted supporters in our previous campaigns, please be aware that we do not cover these additional charges, so supporters will be responsible for paying these if they occur.

Risks & Challenges

This is our third major translation project. We have previously successfully translated, crowdfunded and published the German Army Regulation 470/7 - The Medium Tank Company from 1941, and the German Army Pamphlet 25a/16: The Assault Platoon of the Grenadier-Company from 1944. We have built up practical knowledge and a keen understanding in how to complete such a project and are supported by experts, proof-readers and a professional fulfillment partner. Much of what we know now is experience gained from analyzing our previous campaigns and learning from them.

In our last project, Covid-19 did impact the shipping of our books with associated delays in both production, signing and shipping. We have taken steps to avoid having to contend with the same challenges again by optimising our timelines for production and fulfillment to reflect the changed circumstances. While it remains possible that Covid-19 could impact the production and shipping timelines of our book, we have taken appropriate measures in order to minimize the risks. Likewise, we have adapted the travel requirements for our signed copies in order to limit the risks of postponing shipments as it is our intention to sign every copy by hand. Should this not be possible due to travel restrictions, an alternative solution will be used by which a high-quality signed certificate will be added to each signed hardcover order.

With this project, the work is moving into the finalization phase as such this is not a speculative crowdfunder. The majority of the manuscript, the chapters and visualizations are completed and the book is on schedule.

- STUKA -
THE DOCTRINE OF THE GERMAN
DIVE-BOMBER
We are excited to announce our new book Stuka - The Doctrine of the German Dive-Bomber, offering an unprecedented look at the famous Junkers Ju 87 from World War 2. Supporters of this book can choose from a variety of exclusive offers and can actively help expand and improve the book by a series of stretch goals.
Your support ensured the success of our two previous books: The German Army Regulation 470/7 - The Medium Tank Company and the German Army Pamphlet 25a/16: The Assault Platoon of the Grenadier-Company. We want to continue along the path of improving access to German original documents by refining our projects further. With Stuka - The Doctrine of the German Dive-Bomber you can be a part of this journey, as we try to set a new standard in allowing more people access to German documents from World War 2 that further our understanding of it. This is why this third entry is somewhat distinct from the two earlier books in the series.
With the translation of several key original documents, Stuka - The Doctrine of the German Dive-Bomber offers an in-depth look at the tactics, doctrine, training and operational use of the Ju 87, thus having a different scope over the previous releases. Also, by focusing entirely on the English translation, we are able to provide more information and context in our explorative articles that accompany the primary sources.
While this aircraft has been covered in many books, we believe that Stuka - The Doctrine of the German Dive-Bomber is not just distinct but offers a completely new appreciation of this famous bird as we are putting the original sources center stage. Carefully translated into English, these will offer details and new reflections on the Ju 87, with a lot of supplementary information added for your reading pleasure.
As a unique collection of reference documents, annotated and explored in full detail, this book provides something for enthusiasts, history buffs, collectors, historians and researchers, making a great addition to any collection.

What You Get & Why It Is Unique

Stuka - The Doctrine of the German Dive-Bomber includes 8 original Luftwaffe documents translated into English, alongside introductory essays that provide additional information and context. These documents have been carefully curated and gathered from various archives to provide you with the best foundation on the tactics, doctrine, organization, training and operational experience with the Junkers Ju 87 dive-bomber. And the best part is, as far as we can tell, these documents have never been published like this before! These documents include:

A full organizational breakdown of a Sturzkampfgeschwader (Dive-Bomber Group), giving a complete look at the structure of a unit. This is accompanied with a visualization chart for quick reference that reflects a full Geschwader (Group) from the individual over to the complete unit.
The original training manual on how to dive-bomb with the Junkers Ju 87, illustrated with more than a dozen graphs and visualizations that provide you with a fantastic representation of the given examples.
A full original description of the tasks and roles of dive-bombers in the Luftwaffe, giving you the full picture on how the Germans conceptualized the role of the Junkers Ju 87 during World War 2.
Ju 87s against motorized columns - how does this work? Look no further than the pamphlet on the use of dive-bomber units against motorized ground forces, foreshadowing the use of the Ju 87 in the campaigns against Poland, France and the Soviet Union.
Night bombing in the Ju 87? Yes, it's possible as the notice on the special guidelines on night dive-bombing with the Ju 87 will show!
and much more.

 
These documents will allow you not only to read how the Luftwaffe planned to use the Ju 87, but you will also discover the experiences gained in the actual operations, right out of the mouth (or rather, typewriter) of the Luftwaffe.

Getting this project beyond the minimal funding will allow us to make it even better. With more support, we will be able to upgrade this book by including extra content into the final print.

story:
Welcome to Aahsgoth! (Round 2)

Thank you for stopping by the campaign to fund my debut fantasy novel, The Crimson Gods!

This is the second round of funding to take care of cover art design and a voice actor for the audio book! Any remaining funds will cover the rest of the editing phases as well as ISBN numbers, etc. We finished round one funding 55% of the project which should cover editing. The developmental edit starts April 5th!

My name is Chris, and I am an indie author that decided to create my own world to explore and I  invite you to come on this journey with me. I have been a YouTuber for the past 5 (almost 6 years) covering TV/Movies such as Game Of Thrones, Star Wars, etc. on my channel SmokeScreen.

While I still enjoy talking to the outstanding community on these topics, I have been writing for the past two years on what I hope is a new world people will enjoy with what I believe is an intriguing story. I now also provide writing tips videos and blog posts on Wednesdays in addition to still covering popular shows and live streams. Sign up to my newsletter here for updates!

About The Crimson Gods

"Something ancient this way comes..."

The last king of Aahsgoth abdicated his crown in favor of a ruling council. His children that were born royalty are no longer sure where they fit in this world. On the edge of political fallout, whispers of the past are starting to resurface.

With hundreds of noble and lesser houses that, as written, originated from twelve clans that became the kingdoms themselves, some say Aahsgoth was ruled by the gods themselves in a more magickal time. The Order Of Preceptors however believe most of these are simply fables  or the inventions of singers to glorify a particular king or queen that held their favor. However things are coming to pass that perhaps point to a deeper mystery and a past they may not fully understand.

The Campaign!

This campaign will fund the professional editing (developmental, line, copy, and proofreading) as well as cover design and artwork.  This will also enable a new stream of videos and Q and A's once the novel is released. Subscribe to the YouTube channel!

If this is fully funded it should be close to hire a voice actor for the audio version.

This will mean the world to see my passion come to life. Also this is a big world with thousands of years to fill with content. 

I have decided to self publish and go the indie route as opposed to traditional publishing where I would essentially lose the rights to my story.  This allows me to be sure and in control of how I proceed with many other stories that are planned to take place in Aahsgoth.

What We Need & What You Get!

Our goals and rewards!

  • Approximately $5000 for all edits (4 rounds which include developmental, copy, line, and proofreading). Cover design, character and landscape artwork as well as a voice artist for an audio version.
  • You will get books in all formats (eBook, paperback, hardcover, audio) as well as other goodies such as book marks, book plates, merch, etc. including stretch goals.
  • Signed books will be an option!
  • If the campaign does not reach its goal, all funds will go to toward the costs mentioned, professional editing being the priority. 
  • The tentative release date is June 2021 due to editors being booked out so far (This may be pushed back a bit).

 

The Impact

Your contribution will bring this book (and more) to life and show support for indie authors!

This will continue to support the indie community where artists of all types are in control of their own work!

Join a great community of over 78k YouTube subscribers who all enjoy what you do!

This will mean the world to see my passion come to life. Also this is a big world with thousands of years to fill with content. 

Support indie artists and authors!

Risks & Challenges

Risks for indie projects are purely financial. 

We have built an outstanding community of over 78k fantasy lovers. This gives us a head start!

Support here and the continued support of my Patreon community will get this done! The 4th draft (86k words) is complete!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to support the project that's ok, you can still help!

Get the word out, share this on social media! 

Use the built in Indiegogo share tools!

Subscribe on YouTube for writing and publishing advice, (Or TV show and movie reviews and breakdowns). The bigger the community and the more views on free videos, the more attention the channel gets from the algorithm which brings more awareness.

Sign up for my newsletter on my author website for updates beyond Indiegogo!

Note: The images here are  mockups and are not the final cover and merch designs.

 

Thank you in advance! I hope to see you in Aahsgoth.

 

~Chris

story:
Brilliantly Dyslexic is a children’s book packed with over 20 stories about incredible dyslexics from engineers to entrepreneurs to artists, illustrated by different artists from around the world.

Children see glimmers of themselves reflected in each story - their dreams, worries, struggles, and strengths - and realize .... I can be brilliant too!

With dyslexia affecting so many people (up to 20%!), we need to be talking about it. Brilliantly Dyslexic empowers parents, teachers, librarians, and peers with an understanding of dyslexia and an appreciation that everyone has different struggles and strengths.  And that’s a beautiful thing.

Don’t take our word for it.

 

THE STORIES

Designed as a read-aloud book, the stories are a perfect length for bedtime or classroom reading - just a couple pages.

Each story in Brilliantly Dyslexic features a portrait by a different artist. The uniqueness of each story is amplified by the uniqueness of the art.

PERSPECTIVES FROM KIDS & TEENS 

A section dedicated to sharing experiences, strengths, and advice from dyslexic learners, including kids and teens.

DYSLEXIA BASICS: WHAT EVERYONE NEEDS TO KNOW

We’ve included a section with what everyone needs to know about dyslexia. We’ve got the basics covered - What is it? Where does it come from? Everything is explained in a way that's approachable and engaging for all.

 

 

 

Dyslexia doesn’t show up much in children’s stories. This is a problem…because we all need stories that make us feel seen. When we find those stories, it’s powerful. In the space of three pages, we see ourselves and our lives differently. Maybe it’s possible to do that thing I’ve secretly been dreaming of. Perhaps it won’t always be this hard. Maybe being dyslexic isn’t just an OK way to be…maybe it could be a fantastic way to be.

If you're a kid who struggles to read and write, it’s a HUGE deal to you. And, you need to see that feels-like-it-defines-my-whole-life thing reflected in the world in a positive way. That’s what Brilliantly Dyslexic is about.

 

This is me, Liz, and Quinn, my brilliant + dyslexic daughter. We created Brilliantly Dyslexic.

Struggling with reading and writing, Quinn often felt like she didn’t measure up compared to her classmates. When I started telling her about some successful people with dyslexia, she lit up. She was surprised. How could it be that someone could be both dyslexic and ‘smart’? The more I shared with her, the more her perspective seemed to shift. Perhaps her difficulties weren’t meant to be her whole story after all.

While there is a lot of information online about amazing people with dyslexia, we couldn’t find something designed for children. So, I started writing. We read the stories at bedtime, and Quinn kept asking for more.

Seeing the impact these stories had on my daughter and me, I began to wonder: What if this situation isn’t unique for us? What if we made this a book for the many children and parents who are looking for stories that they can find themselves in?

After 2 years of writing, editing, and working with illustrators, we can’t wait to get this book into your hands.

 

We’ve obsessed about the details from the art to the high quality production finish. You’re going to be proud to have this on your bookshelf / your nightstand / in your classroom.

 

 

 

Credits

Creative Direction: Quinn Trudeau

Graphic Design: Kristine Brogno

Cover Design: Linda Baritski (aka Season of Victory)

Illustrations above: Gillian Dreyer, Paola Rollo, Annie Galvin, Geraldine Sy, Liam Brazier, Li Zhang...many others in the book

Video: West & Social (editing & sound engineering), Image Attribution

 

Risks & Challenges

The stories are written. The illustrations are commissioned. All that’s left to do is finalize the layouts, print, and ship to you!

We’ve brought on some experienced partners who are helping bring this to life including a professional book designer and a fulfillment partner – we're going to deliver!

There is a possibility that COVID-19 related production and freight backups could delay printing or shipping to international warehouse locations. If this is becomes an issue, we will communicate immediately with backers.

story:
I’m Jody. Welcome to my crowdfunder. I’m here to ask for your support in backing my debut memoir, Chimera  – Living Through Leukaemia.

In 1999, on the cusp of adulthood and newly in love, my whole world caved in, taking my breath away. I was diagnosed with a rare and aggressive form of acute leukaemia and given two weeks to live. After a whirlwind of intensive treatment, and close to death, I drifted between worlds, dreaming myself into the care of a wizened old cowboy, my own personal SWAT team and an old crone who wanders the desert collecting wolf bones.

That year broke me apart, before I slowly put myself back together again. Anyone touched by cancer or life-threatening events will know how this feels. We are forced to confront our own mortality and nothing can prepare us. Chimera is my attempt to describe how that felt, how a dance with death changes us, exposing the bones, the very core, of who we really are.

I’ve spent the two decades since facing facts, recovering and integrating the fractured parts of myself, collecting understandings I once thought impossible. Eventually, I caught my breath. My arduous journey revealed itself as what I understand to be an alchemical initiation – a near-death experience framed by the innate, mythic stories that touch all our lives.




I decided to launch the book initially through a crowd-funded campaign. The reasons are twofold. Firstly, I strongly believe in the ‘DIY’ ethos of independent creatives being able to produce professional work and engage directly with an audience. Platforms such as this are a gateway to making that happen. This level of intimate contact with you, my potential reader, is very exciting and opens up worlds of possibilities for us all.

Secondly, I wanted the chance to present the book to my friends, family and wider network of contacts in a direct and meaningful way.



By supporting the campaign you’ll get the very first access to the book, in a high-quality print format unmatched by regular distribution. I’m setting an initial funding target of £3000. If we manage to get beyond this, I will introduce stretch goals and new perks.

This campaign is not about maximising personal profit. Funds raised will go towards the printing costs and other costs associated with producing all the wonderful perks. When the crowd funder ends, I will make a personal donation of a percentage of the overall amount to three cancer charities who helped me back then. They are: The Teenage Cancer Trust, CLIC Sargent (Young Lives Vs Cancer) and Leukaemia Care UK.



Whatever money remains after everything has been paid for and posted will then flow to me. I’ve put several years of work into this project and I hope to demonstrate that writing, designing, publishing and promoting a book yourself is possible. You can even be rewarded with a little money for your efforts.



In this campaign every paperback will be signed, apart from the Bare Bones version. Every eBook comes with a personalised digital thankyou. There will also be an audiobook edition, narrated by me, coming in November.

Each format comes with:

  • A Chimera bookmark, designed by Jody.
  • A postcard version of the fantastic print by Marta Zubieta
  • A link to the companion Spotify playlist, curated by Jody.
  • Your name in the book on the supporters page.


You can pledge a bit more to receive some fantastic perks:

  • A limited edition A3 print by Bristol-based artist Marta Zubieta based on my morphine dreams.
  • A limited edition 'Wolfboy' tote bag designed by Jody with imagery by Marta.
  • Access to a special online Q&A session exploring some of the themes in the book.
  • A  seed-grown Trichocereus cactus, the same genus used for thousands of years in Andean healing ceremonies.
  • A selection of hand-made ferments and a recipe PDF written by Jody.
  • Personal delivery of your pledge.
  • Face-to-face fermentation workshops for 1-4 people.

 



I wrote this book firstly for myself, as a way to understand my experience, but also because I knew that part of my personal responsibility in surviving leukaemia meant sharing the story with the world, for who knows what good it might do out there. It is my wish that this book can bring something like hope to anyone dealing with a life-threatening diagnosis, whether you’re a patient, their friends or family.

If you feel drawn to support the launch of this book in the best possible way, then I would be sincerely grateful for any funds you decide to pledge. To my knowledge, there has never been a survival memoir quite like this – one that bridges the physical with the metaphysical, making visible the layers of myth and story that we live within, whilst remaining grounded in the everyday humanity of what it is to be alive and kicking down here on Earth.

The thought that Chimera will be out there in the hands of people who are really interested to read it brings me great joy. I’m excited to hear your reactions and step into a new phase of life as an author. Who knows, there may be a sequel in the works...



Six years in the making, Chimera is now complete and ready to be breathed out into the world. Once the campaign closes, I will honour the pledges of all those who have backed it, whether the target goal is reached or not.

If you want to contribute but are unable to financially, perhaps you'd like to share the campaign throughout your friend networks. Every action you take to share the project will go a long way towards helping it succeed.

Thanks for your time and now, over to you.

Jody White
Herefordshire, August 2021
story_txt:
I’m Jody. Welcome to my crowdfunder. I’m here to ask for your support in backing my debut memoir, Chimera  – Living Through Leukaemia.In 1999, on the cusp of adulthood and newly in love, my whole world caved in, taking my breath away. I was diagnosed with a rare and aggressive form of acute leukaemia and given two weeks to live. After a whirlwind of intensive treatment, and close to death, I drifted between worlds, dreaming myself into the care of a wizened old cowboy, my own personal SWAT team and an old crone who wanders the desert collecting wolf bones.That year broke me apart, before I slowly put myself back together again. Anyone touched by cancer or life-threatening events will know how this feels. We are forced to confront our own mortality and nothing can prepare us. Chimera is my attempt to describe how that felt, how a dance with death changes us, exposing the bones, the very core, of who we really are.I’ve spent the two decades since facing facts, recovering and integrating the fractured parts of myself, collecting understandings I once thought impossible. Eventually, I caught my breath. My arduous journey revealed itself as what I understand to be an alchemical initiation – a near-death experience framed by the innate, mythic stories that touch all our lives.I decided to launch the book initially through a crowd-funded campaign. The reasons are twofold. Firstly, I strongly believe in the ‘DIY’ ethos of independent creatives being able to produce professional work and engage directly with an audience. Platforms such as this are a gateway to making that happen. This level of intimate contact with you, my potential reader, is very exciting and opens up worlds of possibilities for us all.Secondly, I wanted the chance to present the book to my friends, family and wider network of contacts in a direct and meaningful way.By supporting the campaign you’ll get the very first access to the book, in a high-quality print format unmatched by regular distribution. I’m setting an initial funding target of £3000. If we manage to get beyond this, I will introduce stretch goals and new perks.This campaign is not about maximising personal profit. Funds raised will go towards the printing costs and other costs associated with producing all the wonderful perks. When the crowd funder ends, I will make a personal donation of a percentage of the overall amount to three cancer charities who helped me back then. They are: The Teenage Cancer Trust, CLIC Sargent (Young Lives Vs Cancer) and Leukaemia Care UK.Whatever money remains after everything has been paid for and posted will then flow to me. I’ve put several years of work into this project and I hope to demonstrate that writing, designing, publishing and promoting a book yourself is possible. You can even be rewarded with a little money for your efforts.In this campaign every paperback will be signed, apart from the Bare Bones version. Every eBook comes with a personalised digital thankyou. There will also be an audiobook edition, narrated by me, coming in November.Each format comes with:
A Chimera bookmark, designed by Jody.
A postcard version of the fantastic print by Marta Zubieta
A link to the companion Spotify playlist, curated by Jody.
Your name in the book on the supporters page.
You can pledge a bit more to receive some fantastic perks:
A limited edition A3 print by Bristol-based artist Marta Zubieta based on my morphine dreams.
A limited edition 'Wolfboy' tote bag designed by Jody with imagery by Marta.
Access to a special online Q&A session exploring some of the themes in the book.
A  seed-grown Trichocereus cactus, the same genus used for thousands of years in Andean healing ceremonies.
A selection of hand-made ferments and a recipe PDF written by Jody.
Personal delivery of your pledge.
Face-to-face fermentation workshops for 1-4 people.
 I wrote this book firstly for myself, as a way to understand my experience, but also because I knew that part of my personal responsibility in surviving leukaemia meant sharing the story with the world, for who knows what good it might do out there. It is my wish that this book can bring something like hope to anyone dealing with a life-threatening diagnosis, whether you’re a patient, their friends or family.If you feel drawn to support the launch of this book in the best possible way, then I would be sincerely grateful for any funds you decide to pledge. To my knowledge, there has never been a survival memoir quite like this – one that bridges the physical with the metaphysical, making visible the layers of myth and story that we live within, whilst remaining grounded in the everyday humanity of what it is to be alive and kicking down here on Earth.The thought that Chimera will be out there in the hands of people who are really interested to read it brings me great joy.
