story:
Welcome to Aahsgoth!

Thank you for stopping by the campaign to fund my debut fantasy novel, The Crimson Gods!

My name is Chris, and I am an indie author that decided to create my own world to explore and I  invite you to come on this journey with me. I have been a YouTuber for the past 5 (almost 6 years) covering TV/Movies such as Game Of Thrones, Star Wars, etc. on my channel SmokeScreen.

While I still enjoy talking to the outstanding community on these topics, I have been writing for the past two years on what I hope is a new world people will enjoy with what I believe is an intriguing story. I now also provide writing tips videos and blog posts on Wednesdays in addition to still covering popular shows and live streams. Sign up to my newsletter here for updates!

About The Crimson Gods

"Something ancient this way comes..."

The last king of Aahsgoth abdicated his crown in favor of a ruling council. His children that were born royalty are no longer sure where they fit in this world. On the edge of political fallout, whispers of the past are starting to resurface.

With hundreds of noble and lesser houses that, as written, originated from twelve clans that became the kingdoms themselves, some say Aahsgoth was ruled by the gods themselves in a more magickal time. The Order Of Preceptors however believe most of these are simply fables  or the inventions of singers to glorify a particular king or queen that held their favor. However things are coming to pass that perhaps point to a deeper mystery and a past they may not fully understand.

The Campaign!

  • This campaign will fund the professional editing (developmental, line, copy, and proofreading) as well as cover design and artwork.  This will also enable a new stream of videos and Q and A's once the novel is released. Subscribe to the YouTube channel!
  • If this is fully funded it should be close to hire a voice actor for the audio version.
  • This will mean the world to see my passion come to life. Also this is a big world with thousands of years to fill with content. 

I have decided to self publish and go the indie route as opposed to traditional publishing where I would essentially lose the rights to my story.  This allows me to be sure and in control of how I proceed with many other stories that are planned to take place in Aahsgoth.

What We Need & What You Get!

Our goals and rewards!

  • Approximately $5000 for all edits (4 rounds which include developmental, copy, line, and proofreading). Cover design, character and landscape artwork as well as a voice artist for an audio version.
  • You will get books in all formats (eBook, paperback, hardcover, audio) as well as other goodies such as book marks, book plates, merch, etc. including stretch goals.
  • Signed books will be an option!
  • If the campaign does not reach its goal, all funds will go to toward the costs mentioned, professional editing being the priority. 
  • The tentative release date is May-June 2021 due to editors being booked out so far.

The Impact

Your contribution will bring this book (and more) to life and show support for indie authors!

  • This will continue to support the indie community where artists of all types are in control of their own work!
  • Join a great community of over 78k YouTube subscribers who all enjoy what you do!
  • This will mean the world to see my passion come to life. Also this is a big world with thousands of years to fill with content. 
  • Support indie artists and authors!

Risks & Challenges

Risks for indie projects are purely financial. 

  • We have built an outstanding community of over 78k fantasy lovers. This gives us a head start!
  • Support here and the continued support of my Patreon community will get this done! The 3rd draft (86k words) is complete!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to support the project that's ok, you can still help!

  • Get the word out, share this on social media! 
  • Use the built in Indiegogo share tools!
  • Subscribe on YouTube for writing and publishing advice, (Or TV show and movie reviews and breakdowns). The bigger the community and the more views on free videos, the more attention the channel gets from the algorithm which brings more awareness.

Sign up for my newsletter on my author website for updates beyond Indiegogo!

Note: The images here are  mockups and are not the final cover and merch designs.

 

Thank you in advance, I hope to see you in Aahsgoth.

 

~Chris

story:
Introducing the 6.1 mechanical pencil. Stand out features include a hand machined all metal body, six different grip styles, choice of lead size, finish / material / color, and more! 

The intersection of form and function.

The backstory:

I’ve been a fan of mechanical pencils since first using them in middle school.  Being young, I started off like most people with a basic Bic or Papermate. As I progressed to high school and was accepted into a charter program centered around engineering, I started using mechanical pencils even more.  Build quality and reliability became more important.  I switched to using Pentel p20x series pencils for their robust lead advance mechanism.

Throughout the years since, I’ve mainly stuck to using the Pentels I had used back in high school.  The build quality of the mechanism was very high quality, but the cheap feeling of the barrel assembly was starting to become a turn off.  I had started a job in a more demanding environment that really required a higher quality writing implement.

I tried using some full metal versions from the likes of Rotring and Pilot, and while I liked parts of both designs, I felt it was time to take things I liked from all of the mechanical pencils I had tried over the years and build my own.

As a machinist doing technical drawings, I knew I preferred a hex barrel to keep the pencil from rolling.  An all metal body was a must as well.  I experimented with different grip sections including different knurled patterns, as well as rounded sections and cutouts.

For the internal mechanism, I chose to use my old reliable Pentel p20x series. First released in 1970, the mechanism has proven to be robust and reliable.

By donating to this campaign, not only will you be receiving a beautiful mechanical pencil, but you'll be helping me to keep doing what I love; machining and making  new things!

Fabrication process:

I start off with 6ft of hexagonal stock and cut each piece to individual pencil length on a bandsaw.  The individual pieces are then faced square in my lathe and center drilled on each end.  The grip pattern is then cut in.  Finally, the body is bored to the correct size.  Post processing is done on a variety of belt and disc sanders to clean up any burrs and provide an even finish.  If the optional powder coating is selected, depending on what is required, the powder is baked on either before or after machining.

 

Dimensions and weight:

For the basic pencil, overall length (tip to cap) is ~142.5mm / 5.6” . The hexagonal part of the body is ~7.86mm / 5/16” across the flats. The diameter of the round knurled grips is ~7.8mm / 5/16”.  Custom dimensions (both width and height) are available via special order.  Check the FAQ for info on how to get in touch with me.

Raw pencils have the following weights:

  • Aluminium 13g
  • Brass 27g

Grip styles:

So, what am I offering?  Six different styles of grip in the standard configuration, with each grip style being offered at different perk levels.  (Grip options can be combined via special order)

  • The most basic design is the straight hex barrel with a chamfered edge on both ends.  (all designs use chamfered edges on both the top and bottom of the barrel) Simple, clean, and the heaviest option available.

  • Next up is the hex to a round grip profile, for those who prefer a round grip section that won’t bite into their fingers.  This also allows the user to more easily rotate the pencil to any degree to use the lead in any desired way.

  • Then we have the ribbed hex.  This grip style features evenly spaced ribs cut into the hex grip section for a unique design and better grip.

  • Finally we come to our last group of grip options.  Knurling!  Knurling is offered in three different levels to suit the end user.:
  •  A fine version featuring small tight knurling and providing a good purchase while not biting into the fingers.  This is the nearest to the classic mechanical pencil knurling.

  • The middle of the road option is a medium knurl offering more purchase.  The pattern of the knurl is more easily observed and provides a more substantial grip surface.

  • And lastly, a coarse version (community dubbed gnarly knurl).  This version features large diamond shaped points pretty much guaranteeing a no slip grip no matter the circumstances.

 

More customization – barrel material, powder coating,  lead size, tip material, lead sleeve length:

Two choices of body material are available:  6061 aircraft grade aluminum and brass. The brass will develop a patina over time and is the heavier of the two.  However, powder coating is available as an option on both materials to add color and protection along with  scratch resistance.

    The standard powder coating is a slightly textured near matte black.  Custom colors are available as an extra cost option, above the standard black coating.

    Thanks to the use of pentel p20x internals, I’m able to offer 4 different lead sizes at this time.

    • 0.3mm (extra charge)
    • 0.5mm
    • 0.7mm
    • 0.9mm (extra charge)

    The tip and eraser cap can also be powder coated black for a stealth look.  As another option, the tip can also be had in brass.

    Some people prefer the 2mm short lead sleeve that was only found on the earliest model p20x's, as compared to the 5mm sleeve on all other models.  I am able to offer the 2mm sleeve on all lead sizes.

    Packaging:

    Every pencil is packed in an elegant cardboard carton that can be recycled if not needed.  Each box is hand numbered with your pencils limited production number as well.

    Eraser:

    Every pencil comes with a standard Pentel p20x series eraser under the cap to correct mistakes.

     

    Updates:

    I will continue to post updates as the campaign continues, and after it has ended with build progress etc.

     

    Additional Info:

    • Naming convention: "So, 6.1.  What's that all about?"  All pencils start off as hex (6 sided) stock and are machined from there.  So there's the 6.  1 is a reference to this being my first public offering.  If this campaign is successful, I plan on releasing a hex 2mm lead holder (6.2) and a hex based pen (6.3).  So what do you refer to it as when people ask what it is? A GSB 6.1.
    • Disassembly / Cleaning: The barrel is a single piece all metal construction.  The p20x internals are able to be taken out and the mechanism cleaned by simply unscrewing the tip and pulling the internals out.  The barrel can be cleaned with isopropyl alcohol and a stiff brush like a tooth brush.  Neither the bare metal or the powder coating are affected by the alcohol.
    • Ordering process: "You mentioned all of these available customization options, but I don't see any of them in the perks?" After you select your base pencil grip style, you'll be asked what material and lead (0.5mm or 0.7mm standard) size you want. Upon proceeding to checkout, you'll see a list of many more options including different lead sizes, powder coating options, and more.  If there's something else you want (ex: custom powder color, barrel diameter, etc) check out the FAQ for options on how to contact me.

     

    Risks and Challenges:

    I'm set up and ready to start production immediately.  I've been machining since I was in high school, and  have always been interested in quality design.  My only real concern is if this campaign becomes way more popular than I'm expecting.  However, my job offers me a lot of flexibility, so even if that is the case, it shouldn't be an issue.

     

    Wrapping up:

    Thank you for taking the time to read through my indiegogo page.  Even if you don't plan on supporting me, it means a lot that you took the time to check it out.

     

    Garret

story:
Who We Are

In 2019, a queer voice actor from Pittsburgh, Sam Logsdon, had an idea- with so many authors and artists living in one area, there should be more opportunities for collaboration. They decided to gather their friends and acquaintances and asked how to turn raw talent into something bigger. Realizing that promoting local artists was merely a starting point, the idea for Phoenix of Alexandria was developed! It's going to be more than just another publishing company: PoA is a queer-led, queer-focused business that plans to amplify voices in the community. Along with co-founder, Dani Mauroni, a team of editors, and dedicated contributors, Phoenix of Alexandria has been able to create their first publication: Rivets! This is a Pittsburgh-born literary collection (with a few non-local contributions) that highlights the talent of queer authors and visual artists. This fundraiser is going to take PoA to it's LLC status, so we can start working for the queer arts community! 

What We Need & What You Get

This fundraiser is going to be used for the following items:

  • Our LLC
  • Printing Costs
  • Compensation for Contributors
  • Our Logo (yes, the artist who made our logo believes in our company so much that he agreed to complete the logo and wait for payment!)
  • Compensation for the Editors
  • Upgrading Storage to Google Drive (we go through a lot of data)

If we raise enough money, we would use it for:

  • Lawyer/ Business Contracting fees 
  • Funds for the second issue

Depending on your contribution you'll get:

  • Digital copy of Rivets
  • Physical copy of Rivets
  • USB Drive with Phoenix of Alexandria logo
  • Bookmark and Tote Bag with Phoenix of Alexandria logo (made by Pittsburgh's very own Kween Tees!)
  • Access to Meet and Greet with Founders and Editors

If we make less than our goal, the funds will be use to compensate contributors and the logo artist first, then depending on how much we raise, printing costs and the LLC. We want to do right by the folks who support us, so if nothing else we want to make sure they are compensated for their hard work.

The Impact

Lee and Low Books published a study regarding diversity in publishing. While they noted the changes publishing has gone through since 2015 and the outside influence in politics and media, they still made an effort to show why more diversity is needed. Using the 2019 statistics, these are trends in the publishing industry overall:

  • Race: 76% White/Caucasian, 7% AAPI, 6% Latinx, 5% Black, and less than 1% Native American 
  • Gender: 74% Cis Women, 23% Cis Men, 1% Non-binary/GNC, and less than 1% each Trans Women, Trans Men, and Intersex.
  • Orientation: 81% identify as heterosexual
  • Disability: only 11% of the industry reported having a disability

Representation matters - the people working on the publication and distribution of books influence the industry. Diversity in publishing= diversity in stories. Phoenix of Alexandria is going to prioritize BIPOC and Queer voices, because those are the voices who need amplified. The more platforms disabled, queer, and non-white writers and artists have, the more exposure their stories have, which helps to remove stigma and reinforce empathy.

(Source: https://blog.leeandlow.com/2020/01/28/2019diver...)

Risks & Challenges

We are starting this venture with limited resources. We are relying on this campaign to fund our LLC, first issue costs, and potentially have a down payment for future issues. However, since we are a queer-focused company, we know the power of the community. We know that no matter what we accomplish, it'll be because our fellow queers and allies. If, for whatever reason, we don't raise enough money for a physical print, we will give you at least a digital copy. The artists and authors who made Rivets the fantastic literary collection it is deserve to be recognized in whatever compacity. And you deserve recognition for your contribution to our success. Regardless of the outcome of this campaign, we are proud of all the people who believed in this project. We are proud so many people advocate for a more diverse landscape in publishing.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand if you can't financially contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you, from the bottom of my queer heart.

~ Sam Logsdon, Founder of Phoenix of Alexandria
story_txt:
Who We Are
In 2019, a queer voice actor from Pittsburgh, Sam Logsdon, had an idea- with so many authors and artists living in one area, there should be more opportunities for collaboration. They decided to gather their friends and acquaintances and asked how to turn raw talent into something bigger. Realizing that promoting local artists was merely a starting point, the idea for Phoenix of Alexandria was developed! It's going to be more than just another publishing company: PoA is a queer-led, queer-focused business that plans to amplify voices in the community. Along with co-founder, Dani Mauroni, a team of editors, and dedicated contributors, Phoenix of Alexandria has been able to create their first publication: Rivets! This is a Pittsburgh-born literary collection (with a few non-local contributions) that highlights the talent of queer authors and visual artists. This fundraiser is going to take PoA to it's LLC status, so we can start working for the queer arts community! 

What We Need & What You Get
This fundraiser is going to be used for the following items:

Our LLC
Printing Costs
Compensation for Contributors
Our Logo (yes, the artist who made our logo believes in our company so much that he agreed to complete the logo and wait for payment!)
Compensation for the Editors
Upgrading Storage to Google Drive (we go through a lot of data)

If we raise enough money, we would use it for:

Lawyer/ Business Contracting fees 
Funds for the second issue

Depending on your contribution you'll get:

Digital copy of Rivets
Physical copy of Rivets
USB Drive with Phoenix of Alexandria logo
Bookmark and Tote Bag with Phoenix of Alexandria logo (made by Pittsburgh's very own Kween Tees!)
Access to Meet and Greet with Founders and Editors

If we make less than our goal, the funds will be use to compensate contributors and the logo artist first, then depending on how much we raise, printing costs and the LLC. We want to do right by the folks who support us, so if nothing else we want to make sure they are compensated for their hard work.

The Impact
Lee and Low Books published a study regarding diversity in publishing. While they noted the changes publishing has gone through since 2015 and the outside influence in politics and media, they still made an effort to show why more diversity is needed. Using the 2019 statistics, these are trends in the publishing industry overall:

Race: 76% White/Caucasian, 7% AAPI, 6% Latinx, 5% Black, and less than 1% Native American 
Gender: 74% Cis Women, 23% Cis Men, 1% Non-binary/GNC, and less than 1% each Trans Women, Trans Men, and Intersex.
Orientation: 81% identify as heterosexual
Disability: only 11% of the industry reported having a disability

Representation matters - the people working on the publication and distribution of books influence the industry. Diversity in publishing= diversity in stories. Phoenix of Alexandria is going to prioritize BIPOC and Queer voices, because those are the voices who need amplified. The more platforms disabled, queer, and non-white writers and artists have, the more exposure their stories have, which helps to remove stigma and reinforce empathy.
(Source: https://blog.leeandlow.com/2020/01/28/2019diver...)

THE DRINKS:

 

EXAMPLE FLAVOUR COMBINATIONS:

THE EMPRESS
hibiscus · rosebud · verjus rouge · blackcurrant
Mild floral and red fruit sweetness, with a dry finish and aroma of roses.

FORTITUDE
lychee shrub · jasmine tea · lemon oil 
Sharp and acidic, balanced by white fruit flavours and strong lemon aromatics

THE FOOL
almond orgeat · mint · lemon
A bright lemonade with nutty, floral notes – some liken it to a cotton candy!

THE TOWER
tamarind · smoked tea · cinnamon · cardamom · lime · tonic
Smoky, earthy sweetness, balanced by a tang of citrus and complemented with mild bitter note.


RECIPE ART

We delighted to have Yuliya Tsoy illustrating each recipe! Her blend of precision and whimsy is exactly what this project needs.


TAROT ART

We deeply love Pixie Colman Smith's iconic artwork for the Rider-Waite Deck, but we want to see a more inclusive and dreamy take on those illustrations. We are working with a phenomenal illustrator named Cindy Fan. Cindy is doing her own version of the Major Arcana that will appear alongside the drink recipes in the book, and be printed as a standalone deck.

Here are some of that incredible artwork:
 


 

THE TEAM
 

 

Thank you so much for reading! If you have any questions at all, please email us!

story:
What is Home Sweet Homes?

Home Sweet Homes is a revolutionary and unique tool designed to elevate the way you co-parent by bridging the gap between transitions and focusing on supporting the person who needs it the most, your child. It thoughtfully combines the benefits of a planner and journal into one physical book, which stays with your child as they go back and forth between their two homes. 

This tool has been created to help you, your co-parent, and your child through the challenges stemming from a separation or divorce which often include:

  • Supporting your child's mental and emotional wellbeing
  • Feelings of disconnect amongst parent-child and co-parents 
  • Lack of continuity between transitions
  • Limited or inconsistent schedule transparency and accessibility (for child)
  • Missing out on your child’s day to day life 

Home Sweet Homes prioritizes the needs of your child and encourages him or her to feel supported amidst this life change. Inside, you’ll find monthly and weekly calendar spreads, empowering affirmations, tandem child/parent reflections and writing prompts, weekly challenges, activity pages, free space for creativity, an emergency contacts section, and more.

In its entirety, Home Sweet Homes is a unique reference guide, teaching tool, and touching memory book rolled in one.
 

Why I Created Home Sweet Homes

After my son's dad and I separated, I felt stressed, anxious, and worried witnessing my son having to adjust to the constant back and forth between homes. And so, I searched everywhere for any tools, products, or solutions that could help make things easier, but didn't find anything that existed.  I tried co-parenting apps, and although they were helpful for adults, it wasn't a solution that directly involved children.

One day, I was at a dollar store and came across a $2 planner.  I actually debated on whether I should buy it! On the days I had my son, I started writing in a summary of our day then passed it along to my son's dad where he would do the same. When my son came back home with the planner, it was not just nice, but extremely helpful knowing what they had been up to. I started involving my son more in the process, helping him use the calendar to see his schedule and writing in our daily summary together.

It evolved to become a back-and-forth journal and planner which was so useful for all three of us that I wanted to create and design one specifically to help co-parents and their children facing the same problems we experienced. 

Why am I Running a Crowdfunding Campaign?

The purpose of this campaign is to fund an initial print run of Home Sweet Homes. This hardcover book is filled with 274 full-color pages.  Having Home Sweet Homes be entirely in color was extremely important to me as I want children to feel joy and happiness when using this tool, in the midst of their often difficult and stressful circumstances of living in two homes. 

Printing in color is expensive but for a book this length, you can only imagine what those costs might be! In addition to being a single mom, I'm also currently unemployed, I was laid off at the end of 2019 and by March 2020, COVID-19 hit and suddenly nobody was hiring!

Mid-2020, I consciously decided to hold off my job search and spent the second half of the year designing and creating Home Sweet Homes. That said, crowdfunding gives me a way to reduce my financial risk. Plus, it is also a fun and exciting way for me to get the word out about this one-of-a-kind tool!
 

Want to Try it for Free?

Get 3 months of the Home Sweet Homes journal and planner for free.

Just follow these two simple steps! 

Use these share buttons to share on social media.

Specs & Features

  • Undated 12-month weekly planner. Flexible to start anytime
  • Dimensions: A5 size, 5.8" x 8.3" x 0.8". Portable size will easily fit in a child’s backpack
  • Weight: just around 1 pound
  • 274 colorful pages throughout the book
  • Hardcover with a matte finish. Sturdy enough to withstand back and forth travel
  • High-quality 100 gsm paper inside, about 1.75 times thicker than a standard sheet of printer paper
  • Lay-flat binding
  • Two ribbon bookmarks, cream and orange, to quickly access most used sections

 

Benefits

 

How to Use

The Home Sweet Homes journal and planner is a tool that stays with your child. It is recommeded for children between ages 4 to 10. The basic premise is that each daily journal entry is to be filled by the parent or caregiver who has primary physical custody or your child if they are able to write.

When it’s time for your child to transition homes, make sure the journal goes with him/her. Your co-parent or child will then fill out the journal during the days at their home. When your child returns to you, you’ll be able to read about the things they have been up to while away.

What’s inside? Learn about its contents below.

All About Me
Eight fun-filled activity pages capture meaningful details about your child’s life including their favorite things, handprint, and more. Activities that celebrate your child’s two homes are also incorporated.

Progress Chart
Tracking a specific behavior, goal, or habit on a daily basis for your child can be fun, interesting, and helpful. While maintaining a consistent system to do so can be challenging with your child living in two homes, this progress chart is the perfect tool to facilitate it.

Track up to 3 items each month such as how many veggies were eaten, how many books were read, or how many kind acts were performed.

12 Monthly Affirmation Themes and Reflection
Each month focuses on an affirmation, helping to develop a positive mindset. A corresponding monthly journaling activity encourages reflection, participation, and discussion between parents and child.

 

For the monthly reflection, decide on how each parent will be involved. Will both parents participate each month? Will one parent take the lead or will you switch off taking the lead each month? Decide on what works best for your situation.



Monthly View
Create an overview where everyone can easily reference each month’s schedule and events. The undated calendar allows you the flexibility to start at any time and will last for an entire year.

Weekly View
A snapshot of each day allows you, your co-parent, and most importantly your child to stay in the know and connected. Take a closer look at the weekly view’s features below.

• Open-end journal entry:
Parent or child can fill out the daily entry. This can be a summary, achievement, or something funny your child said. It's whatever you want to say, as each of you are the contributing authors!

• Home schedule:
Your child can easily reference their schedule at any time with this tool.

• Daily feelings exercise:
Track, monitor, and discuss your child's mood

Weekly challenge:
A super simple activity reinforces the monthly affirmation. Nothing special is required to complete the activity, just yourselves, Home Sweet Homes, and sometimes a writing tool. Each challenge will fosters participation and discussion with your child!


Free space pages
Five pages per month, (2 lined and 3 blank), can be used in any way desired. Record responses to weekly challenges, make a list, draw or put together a monthly scrapbook. The possibilities are endless!


 

Names and Numbers
This section allows for contact information of family, friends, and others to be accessible to your child at anytime. 


Medical History and Emergency Contacts
Are you and your co-parent prepared for the unexpected? This important section is purposefully placed at the end of the journal to be easily and quickly accessible.  It includes space for the following information: 

  • Allergy
  • Blood type: child and parents
  • Medication
  • Emergency numbers: police, fire dept, poison control
  • Emergency contacts and order in which to call
  • Medical contacts: pediatrician/dental
  • Insurance information

 

What Others are Saying


 

Perks

Affirmation Poster:
A digital poster in the form of a PDF containing the affirmations in Home Sweet Homes will be sent to all supporters by email. 

Virtual Meet & Greet+ Q&A:
A group meetup will be organized once Home Sweet Homes has been shipped. During this virtual meeting, I'll introduce myself, walk you through Home Sweet Homes and answer Q&A.  
 

Pay it Forward Program

I believe in the power of Home Sweet Homes as a unique solution to help support a child and completely transform their experience when living in two homes after parents separate. I want nothing more than for all children of divorce/separation to feel as loved and supported as possible during this difficult time.

Knowing how challenging finances can be for co-parents, the Pay it Forward program is an initiative to make Home Sweet Homes accessible to children whose parents may not be able to afford a copy.

For the duration of this crowdfunding campaign, for monetary donations of $25 or more, I will send a copy of Home Sweet Homes (shipping will be covered) to someone who needs this. 

If you are someone who could benefit from this program, please fill out the Home Sweet Home Pay it Forward intake form. 

 

Stretch Goals

And... look forward to receiving the following items included in your shipment should this campaign reach the following stretch goals!


 

    Risks & Challenges

    Potential risks and challenges that may arise include the following:

    1. Supply Chain
      There are a lot of moving parts to get a product manufactured. We will be in constant communication with our vendor(s) to get ahead of any problems that may arise.
    2. Quality Issues
      We have partnered with a manufacturer with over a decade of experience in printing journals and planners, however, there is always the possibility something could go wrong. We plan on running quality checks onsite during production and again post-production.
    3. Fulfillment
      Fulfillment of rewards may be delayed because of: 1) Supply chain risks mentioned above or 2) this campaign exceeds our expectations! (With preference for the latter.) While we’d love to personally fulfill the rewards for this campaign, we have a trusted fulfillment center ready to help if the order quantity is beyond our capabilities. Our goal is to fulfill each order in a timely manner and for HSH to arrive to you in excellent condition.

    Our Promise in Handling These Challenges
    If anything happens that will affect the projected timeline, we will be transparent and communicate those changes to you immediately. We do ask for your patience and understanding in getting this new product launched.
     

    Shipping

    I would love nothing more than for children and co-parents across the world to benefit from using Home Sweet Homes. We ship worldwide, however, the reality is that shipping and taxes are expensive for countries outside of the U.S.  

    Shipping is not included in the price. For international orders, shipping charges do not include duties, taxes, customs VAT, or any other fees that may be charged by your country. Please check with your local customs office about rules and regulations that may apply to you. These fees are solely your responsibility, and we can neither cancel a shipped perk nor will we pay those fees. In the event that a package is returned or destroyed due to the non-payment of such fees, your perk will be considered fulfilled.

    Please note: Shipping charges will be added after the campaign ends and each backer will be responsible for paying these costs. If stretch goals are reached, the retail value of the merchandise will increase, and therefore, taxes /customs fees may also be subject to increase.
     

    How You Can Help

    If you aren’t able to financially contribute to this campaign, but you believe this product and my mission to help co-parents and children stay connected, there are still many ways you can help:

    Please, spread the word and make some noise about Home Sweet Homes! Every share and mention will help spread awareness about this tool to the many children and co-parents in the world.

    • Know of a co-parent who could use the HSH journal and planner? Let them know about this campaign!
    • Directly share this campaign with any…
      • Child and/or family counselors, therapists or related professionals
      • Family law professionals (divorce lawyers, mediators, etc.)
    • Share this campaign with your social circles on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn! 

    ​


     

    Stay in Touch!

    • Visit our website at https://homesweethomesjournal.com/
    • Join the Home Sweet Homes community on Instagram and Facebook: @homesweethomesjournal
    • Send me your feedback, suggestions, and/or comments to hello@homesweethomesjournal.com. I would love to hear from you!

    Timeline

    This is the projected timeline. Should any issues arise that will affect the fulfillment date, I will post updates via this campaign page and email. 

    Special Thanks To...

    Creating Home Sweet Homes has been one long and crazy ride!! How do I even begin to thank everyone who has played a role in making this happen? I'm not entirely sure... but, I am consumed with gratitude as its creation would not have been possible without the help and support from so many... So, from the bottom of my heart... THANK YOU!!


    Thank you to my son, Emile, for being the inspiration behind Home Sweet Homes and for being a super tough kid as your mama and papa navigate this whole co-parenting thing. I hope one day you will be proud of me, what we've made, and the impact it will have on others. ❤️

    Thank you to my co-parent, old friends, and new I’ve made on this special journey… It's been incredible to have people from all over the world who have cheered me on and believed in me and this dream of mine to help co-parents and their children. A few folks who I'd like to recognize for their extraordinary support are Laurent, Matthew, Sally, Laila, Deborah, and Tamar!

    And finally, one last huge and tremendous shoutout to Jacqui Jade O’Donnell (@jacqui.jpg), the wonderfully talented designer behind HSH. Thank you for hanging in there with me for the past few months. I will always be grateful to you for making my vision come to life. 

     

    About Me

      Hi! I'm Fiona, a boy mom and former analyst, turned dreamer, turned do-er, turned entrepreneur after finding a lack of resources and tools available to support children after a separation or divorce. I am passionate about mental and physical wellness and sustainable living. I love the outdoors, road trips -- especially those off the beaten path, and am a serial meditator. Originally from Rockville, MD I've lived in Los Angeles, CA for the past decade.

Please note: Shipping charges will be added after the campaign ends and each backer will be responsible for paying these costs. If stretch goals are reached, the retail value of the merchandise will increase, and therefore, taxes /customs fees may also be subject to increase. 
How You Can Help
If you aren’t able to financially contribute to this campaign, but you believe this product and my mission to help co-parents and children stay connected, there are still many ways you can help:
Please, spread the word and make some noise about Home Sweet Homes! Every share and mention will help spread awareness about this tool to the many children and co-parents in the world.

Know of a co-parent who could use the HSH journal and planner? Let them know about this campaign!
Directly share this campaign with any…
Child and/or family counselors, therapists or related professionals
Family law professionals (divorce lawyers, mediators, etc.)


Share this campaign with your social circles on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn! 

​
 
Stay in Touch!

Visit our website at https://homesweethomesjournal.com/

Join the Home Sweet Homes community on Instagram and Facebook: @homesweethomesjournal
Send me your feedback, suggestions, and/or comments to hello@homesweethomesjournal.com. I would love to hear from you!

Timeline
This is the projected timeline. Should any issues arise that will affect the fulfillment date, I will post updates via this campaign page and email. 

Special Thanks To...
Creating Home Sweet Homes has been one long and crazy ride!! How do I even begin to thank everyone who has played a role in making this happen? I'm not entirely sure... but, I am consumed with gratitude as its creation would not have been possible without the help and support from so many... So, from the bottom of my heart... THANK YOU!!
Thank you to my son, Emile, for being the inspiration behind Home Sweet Homes and for being a super tough kid as your mama and papa navigate this whole co-parenting thing. I hope one day you will be proud of me, what we've made, and the impact it will have on others. ❤️
Thank you to my co-parent, old friends, and new I’ve made on this special journey… It's been incredible to have people from all over the world who have cheered me on and believed in me and this dream of mine to help co-parents and their children. A few folks who I'd like to recognize for their extraordinary support are Laurent, Matthew, Sally, Laila, Deborah, and Tamar!
And finally, one last huge and tremendous shoutout to Jacqui Jade O’Donnell (@jacqui.jpg), the wonderfully talented designer behind HSH. Thank you for hanging in there with me for the past few months. I will always be grateful to you for making my vision come to life. 
 

About Me




Hi! I'm Fiona, a boy mom and former analyst, turned dreamer, turned do-er, turned entrepreneur after finding a lack of resources and tools available to support children after a separation or divorce. I am passionate about mental and physical wellness and sustainable living. I love the outdoors, road trips -- especially those off the beaten path, and am a serial meditator. Originally from Rockville, MD I've lived in Los Angeles, CA for the past decade.

story:
More about the story:

This book is for parents who want a way to show their children how individual freedom can help people reach their full potential.
 

In the course of human history, freedom let people do great things:

Raise families, discover electricity, and explore outer space.

See… compared to Earth, you and I are really quite small.

But sometimes the smallest things make the biggest changes of all.




 

What makes this book different?

This book is different from many popular children's books because it emphasizes a person's capacity for greatness—not their physical identity. 
 

Being free means something magical.

To some, it is an idea that is rather radical.

Being free is about the choices we make…

The things we do, the risks we take.



Is there a lesson in the story?

Of course! In addition to inspiring young readers, "What Does It Mean to Be Free?" teaches the simple rule of freedom:
 

There is only one rule to freedom and it is really quite easy:

Do not hurt yourself or others. Inspire them to live freely.




 

Why do you need my money?

The boy in this book is free, but lunch is not. We need your help making it across the finish line to get this story to print. Here is a complete list of our final costs, and where your money will be going: 

  • $1500-2000 for final payments to our amazing illustrator (s/o Kseniya Urban)
  • $1500-2000 for final payments to our rockstar designer
  • $500 for the first installment of printing costs
     

​My goal is to have the first batch of pre-orders in the mail by late August/early September 2021.


Why should I trust you?

I wrote this book with my son first in mind. Every detail has been handled with care. The script has been reviewed by a third-party editor who specializes in political philosophy. The art team is professional and experienced in publishing children's books. 

My background, specifically, lends relevant experience to the project:

  • 2 years as a communications director in Congress
  • 3+ years as a political campaign staffer
  • 1.5 years as a multi-media entrepreneur
  • 10+ years as a political student and writer
     

If you are not able to contribute at this time, please consider sharing this campaign with family and friends!

story:
Short Summary

     Hi!  My name is Jane C. Lovelle and I am an aspiring author and writer.  This campaign that I am running isn't really intended for people to donate, but you may do so if you wish.  This is primarily for me to pace my own funds so that I can effectively save up to get self-published.  If you intend on donating, I will have reward perks for those who do so as seen on the campaign page.

     The Drop of a Plug is a story about a small-town business man named Van Carston slipping into a coma after a horrific accident.  His family is left to pick up the pieces of his legacy as well as patch up the family's relationship that had long since been squandered by Van's borderline abusive relationship and impact on the family.

What I Need & What You Get

  • To cover baseline publishing costs, I will need $500 dollars to get the ball rolling on this project.  Things such as commission costs for illustrations and editing has already been taken care of.  If you'd like to read a digitized version book for free, then please DM me over on Twitter @janeclovelle
  • If you donate $10 dollars or more, you will get the book once it is released.  $25 dollars or more will get you a copy that has been signed by yours truly. (So long as you select the appropriate perk)
  • 100% of the funds generated by this campaign will go to publishing costs.  If the goal isn't reached within the 60 day period, then funds will still be raised to cover the publishing costs, the process will just be quite a bit slower.

The Impact

  • I feel that my work would be a great contribution to the rest of the world of literature, and my hopes are that, when you read it, you'll feel the same.  Like I said, you may read my manuscript before you contribute.

Risks & Challenges

  • Though there is virtually no risk from contributing, I still want to assure the reader that I am a qualified and competent writer who will deliver a product that is nothing short of intriguing and thought-provoking.  Anything you can give would be greatly appreciated in my eyes.
  • As I've stated previously, if the required funds are met, the book will still be inevitably published, it just may take longer for the process to occur.  I am 100% in on this, and there is very little that could change my mind.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you lack the funds, but are interested, I would greatly appreciate it if you would share my campaign to the furthest reaches of the internet.
  • Also, don't forget to use Indiegogo's built-in share tools.

story:
Uncomfortably Dark Horror presents...

with the support of Stitched Smile Publishing and The House of Stitched Magazine.

A New Twist on an Old Classic: Horror can be beautiful. 

Hello and welcome to the new classic campaign. My name is Candace Nola and I am a horror author, editor and reviewer. I own and operate UncomfortablyDark.com and I am also an editor and writer for The House of Stitched Magazine. 

I'm here to challenge you, the readers, to raise the bar for your expectations in horror.  I love books, all books, all genres but my favorites are the classic leather-bound, gilt edged, beautifully illustrated volumes.  Horror books have some of the most beautifully illustrated covers in the business but why do we need to wait for the passage of time to enjoy them in a classically styled hardcover? 

My intention with this campaign is to create a book that is both incredible to read and to look upon.  Something beautiful to withstand the test of time. A limited edition volume meant to be collected, cherished and passed down. 

Uncomfortably Dark Presents: The Baker's Dozen

Limited Edition Hardcover

  • The foreword will be provided by horror legend and four time Bram Stoker Award nominated author, Jeff Strand.  Jeff is the author of "Autumn Bleeds Into Winter", "The Odds" and many more.  Jeff's story in The Bakers Dozen is sure to delight and disturb. 
  • The interior pages will be a unique mix of glossy white and jet black pages with crisp black & white text. 
  • This hardcover will have a beautiful classically designed cover by artist Don Noble. 
  • Each story will be prefaced by an illustrated faux "book cover" designed by artist John Kostov and followed by the exclusive Dark Dozen interview, only seen on Uncomfortably Dark.
  • The contributing authors of this limited edition volume will each be appearing in this fall's Dark Dozen interview series. 

The Contributing Authors:

Jeff Strand-4 Time Bram Stoker Award Nominee & Splatterpunk Award Winner

Patrick C. Harrison, III-Splatterpunk Award Nominee (Multiple)

Christine Morgan-2019 Splatterpunk Award Winner for Lakehouse Infernal

Aron Beauregard-Splatterpunk Award Nominee for "The Slob"

Rowland Bercy, Jr.-2020 American Fiction Award winner for "Unbortion"

Lee Franklin-author of "Nang Tani" and "Berserker: Green Hell"

Chris Miller-Splatterpunk Award Nominee for "Dust"

Kenzie Jennings-Splatterpunk Award Nominee for "Reception" and "Red Station"

Mike Ennenbach- Splatterpunk Award Nominee for "The Incident on Barrow Farm"

Daniel Volpe-author of "Talia" & "Billy Silver"

Ruthann Jagge-author of "Criss Cross Girls" & "Midnight at the Glass Slipper"

Carver Pike-Splatterpunk Award Nominee for "Slaughter Box"

Candace Nola-author of "Hank Flynn" &  "Breach"

*Please note-only the limited edition hardcover will contain the exclusive Dark Dozen interviews. The eBook and paperback will contain the stories and illustrations only.

Cover Reveals and artwork sneak peeks will occur over the course of this campaign. Stay tuned to see all updates.

 

The Book: The Baker's Dozen

As every good baker knows, every dozen has an extra thrown in for good measure, and we have kept that tradition with our anthology.  13 tales of darkly disturbing, gleefully gory, baked-good filled debauchery penned for you by some of the best horrors writers in the industry await you within the uncomfortably dark pages. Each author was challenged to incorporate some type of baked good or baking theme into their original story. You'll want to sink your teeth into this delightful treat,  again and again. 

 

Funds and Perks:

My goal is $2500 to help offset the cost of the design, illustrations and printing costs.  My stretch goal is $4500 which will fully fund the printing of the hardcovers and 100 paperbacks.  

Full Funding will amount to $8,195.00, which will go towards the below:

  • Cover the full cost of the interior illustrations-$1,500.00
  • Cover the full cost of shipping of all perks and books, when published. approx.$1500.00
  • Cover the cost of the printing of the first 100 paperbacks copies to be delivered with the hardcovers to help expedite delivery due to Amazon delays. $900.00
  • Cover the full printing cost of 200 limited edition hardcovers of "The Bakers Dozen". $4060.00
  • Cover costs for marketing & promoting. 
  • Any excess monies will be equally distributed among the contributing authors to increase their payment for their stories.  

 

The Impact

  • I believe this anthology will be an outstanding addition to any readers bookshelf. 
  • I believe this edition will set a trend for more horror authors and publishers to create their own new classics, filling bookshelves with long-lasting collector's items to be enjoyed for generations. 
  • I intend to create a limited edition hardcover in conjunction with Uncomfortably Dark, at the end of every year, involving the participating authors for that years Dark Dozen Interview series.   

 

Risks & Challenges

There is minimal risk to backing this project as it will be privately funded if the goal is not met.   Each donation level includes a copy of the book, either in digital, paperback or the limited edition hardcover. The hardcover collector's edition will also contain exclusive interviews with the authors. 

  • Private resources have been obtained for this project, the funding is to help offset my personal costs and reduce the financial strain on my personal assets. 
  • Every donation made will receive the listed perk and book version as well as their name in the acknowledments section of the book and on the project page for the Website.  

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Any way you can help spread the word, will help make my biggest dream a reality and will help create a lasting legacy for my work with Uncomfortably Dark.

  • Share the link on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and anywhere else you can. 
  • Shout about it, share it, like it, post it, follow it! 
  • Contribute in any amount just to support the project. 

 

Uncomfortably Dark Horror, bringing you the best in horror, one uncomfortably dark page at a time. Help me create my legacy.

Any way you can help spread the word, will help make my biggest dream a reality and will help create a lasting legacy for my work with Uncomfortably Dark.

 Uncomfortably Dark Horror, bringing you the best in horror, one uncomfortably dark page at a time. Help me create my legacy.

story:
About Football is Everywhere

Football is Everywhere is a highly visual collection of football stories from around the world, showcasing that football is everywhere in a form of a magazine, showcasing how much it impacts people’s lives, in many big and small ways, whether it’s a small town of 20 people managing to keep their club going, whether it’s the Faroe Islands where most of the population plays football, or whether it’s a 4,000 people town reaching the highest tier of football in Sweden. It’s a magazine created with the intention to honor the football communities and their efforts, around the world, that we intend to launch roughly every 3-4 months, depending on the complexity of the stories. 

The first issue? It's based on the North of Sweden, the land where the sun almosts never sets in the summer, and where you won't see much light in the winter. We cover the stories of some of the most successful football teams in the North such as Umeå IK, covering their rise and downfall, while at the same time, covering the stories of much smaller teams, that most people probably never heard about, that reached their own successes, whether it was a town of just 2,000 people advancing to the top tier of Swedish football, or whether it's the story of the oldest active coach in Sweden (he's 85) who has been involved in the club he co-founded, for the past 70 years. 

The second issue? It covers the rich culture of a tiny island of just 50,000 people which most people don't know the location of, with that being the Faroe Islands. This is a land that went from having sand pitches in the 80s to one of the most football-involved populations there is. 

How did the idea come to be

Being involved in football in many different ways, we always saw the impact football had on people. But we haven’t seen the stories of that impact being told, almost anywhere. That’s when we decided to take things into our own hands, and how the idea for Football is Everywhere was born.

 

...With a little twist. 

 

See, Football is Everywhere was originally meant to be a set of documentaries. At the time we were living in Italy in Naples so it made the most sense to make the first set about Capri. That was in March 2020. The day before we took the ferry to the island where we were to interview a team playing in Capri, the match got canceled...We still went and started shooting the documentary, shooting a set of interviews, but on the day we returned to Naples, the whole of Italy was in a full lockdown. That put a major hold on that project. And then a year later came the idea of replacing documentaries with a magazine. 

What We Need & What You Get

We’ve done all the hard work. We’ve found the stories. We traveled to them and then told them in the most beautiful way possible, combining great stories with beautiful imagery that we took. We then had our designer Matt do his magic and convert it into possibly the most beautiful football magazine ever done.

...But naturally printing costs. And the way printers work, you need to print several thousand copies at once so that you can create something that is somewhat affordable. And that's why we've created this crowdfunding campaign. This €4000 will bring the project that we already made, to paper.  It will kickstart this printing process while at the same time allowing us to work on the next issues of the magazine.

About the Creators of the first issue:

PATO JERZAK

 Pato Jerzak is currently a professional football player and also the person behind the idea of "Football is Everywhere". Having grown up in a privileged country (Sweden) where she never was stopped from playing football, knowing that in many countries it's not possible to play, especially for women, she is on a mission to change that. With this magazine, she wanted to show the beauty and importance of football in communities.

MICHAEL SMOLSKI

Michael Smolski is a sports documentary filmmaker coming from Ireland with a passion for telling stories worth telling especially in the world of football.  He's also a sports photographer and journalist but prefers to spend his time filming. He's currently working on two major football documentaries.

MATT BERRY

Matt Berry is a British graphic designer based in Buckinghamshire, UK that has been practicing graphic design for over 20 years. He currently runs his own design practice called Made by Berry. In 2012 he turned a passion-project into a football brand called Dinkit. Dinkit fuses the beautiful game with graphic design and typography to create football art & design.

THE PERKS:

Statue Worthy Package:

We called this a "Statue Worthy" Hero package because you are our football hero. You are helping bring these football stories to paper. For you, we have some special perks.

Lifetime subscription. The ability to choose the location of a future issue. Your name in the future issues we will create. (Does not apply to issue 1), and 2 Wooden Framed A2 Posters with either a metallic or matte finish. 

  • 1x lifetime subscription.
  • Your name in the thank you section in future issues of the magazine.
  • Choose the location of a future issue.
  • Every issue one week prior to launch.
  • 2x Wooden Framed A2 Poster (Frame at the back.)

"Retire your number” Package: 

  • 2-year subscription.
  • 2021 issues.
  • Your name in the thank you section in future issues of the magazine.
  • Every issue one week prior to launch.
  • 1x Wooden Framed A2 Poster

Season Ticket Package:

  • 1-year subscription.
  • 2021 issues.
  • 1x Wooden Framed A3+ Poster

VIP Ticket Package:

  • 3 magazine issues.
  • 1x Wooden Framed A3+ Poster

(BEST DEAL) Premium + Hotdog:

  • 1 magazine.
  • 2x A3+ posters

Premium:

  • 1 magazine.
  • 1x A3+ poster.

The Basic Fan+

  • First issue.
  • A4 poster.

The Ultras:

  • North of Sweden + Faroe Island magazine issues

The Basic Fan:

  • 1st issue of the magazine.

ABOUT THE POSTERS:

We are going to launch posters ranging from A2, to A3+ (bigger than A3) to A4. These are either going to be photos that cover up all the printable area or otherwise, will contain text, whether it's one of our pre-made texts, or whether it's one of your choice (there's a character limit.) All the poster photos shown will be available, but we are also going to add to that list which you will see in the coming days in the "Updates" section.

When the time is right, we will send you out a survey in which you can fill out the poster of your choice and the finish you would like, whether it's the metallic or matte finish. 

Some of the perks include framed posters. These are posters that have a layer of wood behind them, meaning a frameless design, but we are also looking at adding other options in the future.  For those that want to frame their poster their own way, or perhaps to leave it as it is, we do, of course, also have that option.

The first issue? It's based on the North of Sweden, the land where the sun almosts never sets in the summer, and where you won't see much light in the winter. We cover the stories of some of the most successful football teams in the North such as Umeå IK, covering their rise and downfall, while at the same time, covering the stories of much smaller teams, that most people probably never heard about, that reached their own successes, whether it was a town of just 2,000 people advancing to the top tier of Swedish football, or whether it's the story of the oldest active coach in Sweden (he's 85) who has been involved in the club he co-founded, for the past 70 years. 
The second issue? It covers the rich culture of a tiny island of just 50,000 people which most people don't know the location of, with that being the Faroe Islands. This is a land that went from having sand pitches in the 80s to one of the most football-involved populations there is. 
How did the idea come to be

Being involved in football in many different ways, we always saw the impact football had on people. But we haven’t seen the stories of that impact being told, almost anywhere. That’s when we decided to take things into our own hands, and how the idea for Football is Everywhere was born. ...With a little twist.  See, Football is Everywhere was originally meant to be a set of documentaries. At the time we were living in Italy in Naples so it made the most sense to make the first set about Capri. That was in March 2020. The day before we took the ferry to the island where we were to interview a team playing in Capri, the match got canceled...We still went and started shooting the documentary, shooting a set of interviews, but on the day we returned to Naples, the whole of Italy was in a full lockdown. That put a major hold on that project. And then a year later came the idea of replacing documentaries with a magazine. 

What We Need & What You Get
We’ve done all the hard work. We’ve found the stories. We traveled to them and then told them in the most beautiful way possible, combining great stories with beautiful imagery that we took. We then had our designer Matt do his magic and convert it into possibly the most beautiful football magazine ever done.
...But naturally printing costs. And the way printers work, you need to print several thousand copies at once so that you can create something that is somewhat affordable. And that's why we've created this crowdfunding campaign. This €4000 will bring the project that we already made, to paper.  It will kickstart this printing process while at the same time allowing us to work on the next issues of the magazine.
About the Creators of the first issue:
PATO JERZAK

 Pato Jerzak is currently a professional football player and also the person behind the idea of "Football is Everywhere". Having grown up in a privileged country (Sweden) where she never was stopped from playing football, knowing that in many countries it's not possible to play, especially for women, she is on a mission to change that. With this magazine, she wanted to show the beauty and importance of football in communities.
MICHAEL SMOLSKI


Michael Smolski is a sports documentary filmmaker coming from Ireland with a passion for telling stories worth telling especially in the world of football.  He's also a sports photographer and journalist but prefers to spend his time filming. He's currently working on two major football documentaries.
MATT BERRY


Matt Berry is a British graphic designer based in Buckinghamshire, UK that has been practicing graphic design for over 20 years. He currently runs his own design practice called Made by Berry. In 2012 he turned a passion-project into a football brand called Dinkit. Dinkit fuses the beautiful game with graphic design and typography to create football art & design.

Statue Worthy Package:

Lifetime subscription. The ability to choose the location of a future issue. Your name in the future issues we will create. (Does not apply to issue 1), and 2 Wooden Framed A2 Posters with either a metallic or matte finish.

ABOUT THE POSTERS:

We are going to launch posters ranging from A2, to A3+ (bigger than A3) to A4. These are either going to be photos that cover up all the printable area or otherwise, will contain text, whether it's one of our pre-made texts, or whether it's one of your choice (there's a character limit.) All the poster photos shown will be available, but we are also going to add to that list which you will see in the coming days in the "Updates" section.
When the time is right, we will send you out a survey in which you can fill out the poster of your choice and the finish you would like, whether it's the metallic or matte finish. 
Some of the perks include framed posters. These are posters that have a layer of wood behind them, meaning a frameless design, but we are also looking at adding other options in the future.  For those that want to frame their poster their own way, or perhaps to leave it as it is, we do, of course, also have that option.
