story:
Enter the prolific worlds of Savage Realms Gamebooks...

Book 0: Balance of Fate: The Legorian Kings Saga (coming soon)

Book 1: What Dreams May Come (also coming soon)

Book 2: Malivor: Cataclysm's Edge

and... 

Book 3: An as yet untitled gamebook by gifted storyteller David Lowrie, author of the Shadow Thief series, Hellscape: Straight to Hell, and Psycho Killer

Book 4: House of Torment by Pat O'Neill

MALIVOR: CATACLYSM'S EDGE

Malivor: Cataclysm's Edge (MCE) is the highly-anticipated, third title in the Savage Realms Gamebooks library and is written in the style of the Choose Your Own Adventure and Fighting Fantasy gamebooks. YOU determine the outcome of the story by the choices that you make! Sometimes, your very fate will even depend on the roll of the dice themselves!

The two small shorts that you got in issues 1 and 2 of the Gamebook Zine were only a taste of what will truly be an epic storyline and gamebook!

 

SYNOPSIS

Tasked with finding a lost family heirloom, you unwittingly stumble upon an ancient evil whose malevolent plot could very well bring about the complete and utter destruction of your world...

 

AN EXCERPT FROM MALIVOR: CATACLYSM'S EDGE

Rounding a bend, you abruptly emerge from the passage onto a large shelf of rock in what seems to be a cavern of considerable size. To your right, a stone staircase spirals downwards until it is lost from view. An almost identical flight of stairs hugs the cavern wall to your left as it ascends upwards to what looks like the opening of yet another tunnel. The chanting seems to be coming from somewhere directly beneath you. Crouching low and making your way to the edge of the rocky outcropping, you are shocked by what you see transpiring below!

Standing in a close-knit circle around an enormous, open sarcophagus made of stone are nine figures in dark, hooded robes. With their hands raised, they recite the words to what is obviously an incantation over the desiccated remains of a large humanoid lying inside of the sarcophagus. Even as you are watching, another mysterious figure appears. He is hooded as well, but wears a strange mask, and at his approach, the others disrobe, but continue chanting while standing there naked. It is not long before the rattling cacophony of their chant reaches fever pitch, and then, quite suddenly, there is an abrupt and very unnerving silence as they allow the man with the mask to pass through them. Approaching the sarcophagus and holding his hands above the body, the man utters several words in an unfamiliar dialect, simultaneously producing a dagger from within his robe. Almost immediately after, one of the women, in a trance-like state, breaks from the circle. Slowly making her way over to the sarcophagus, the woman leans over it, and as she does so, the man with the mask slits her throat, dousing the withered remains within with her blood. One by one, each of the others follow suit, offering themselves as well in what is literally a sacrificial bloodbath.

“Lord Malivor, the Malevolent,” cries the man with the mask as he carves glyphs in the air with his hands, “long have we, your faithful followers, waited for the advent of your second coming, and now, we beseech thee rise ― rise and be reborn, fulfilling the ancient prophecy that says you will destroy the kingdoms of Ataraxia and usher in your own glorious kingdom of eternal darkness! May it be as foretold!”

What happens next is unexpectedly more horrifying than anything you could have imagined, for the blood-drenched flesh of the desiccated corpse rapidly begins to regenerate, miraculously transforming into healthy, living tissue!

“You have done well, my disciple,” says Malivor, as he sits up and steps out of the sarcophagus.

Completely naked, the formidable being you now see emerging from the sarcophagus is anything but human, easily standing one-and-a-half times taller than the average man. Two small horns protrude from the front of his hairless head, while serrated teeth and hands and feet culminating in deadly talons only further add to his frightening appearance.

The man with the mask immediately falls to his knees with his face to the ground.

“You may rise, Agamon,” Malivor says.

“What is thy bidding, my lord and master?” Agamon asks, as he slowly gets to his feet and removes his mask.

“The Draconomicon and the Sigil Stone of Sargonis… have you been able to locate their where ―” Malivor begins before being cut off, for it is at that very moment that something unanticipated and most inconvenient happens ― you accidentally sneeze, and quite loudly for that matter! Both Malivor and Agamon look up towards you in surprise, and in another instant, before you even have time to react, Malivor is standing over you.

“It would seem, Agamon, that we have ourselves an interloper!” Malivor says, his mouth twisting into a smile of cruel amusement as he reaches down, grabs you swiftly by the neck and lifts you effortlessly into the air so that you are both at eye level to one another. Feet dangling, you quickly draw your sword, but Malivor easily wrenches it from your grasp with his free hand like a toy being taken from a small child.

“Your insolent and intrusive act merits nothing less than death, and die you shall, foolish mortal, but your end will not be today! No... instead, I will allow you to see that which is soon to come ― the fall and utter destruction of your beloved Ataraxia!” declares Malivor, the carrion stench of his breath convulsing your stomach as he speaks.

Instantly, your mind’s eye is raptured to a place of absolute and unimaginable devastation ― a barren and broken wasteland of charcoal and ash, where the air is literally saturated with the fetid smell of burning flesh and rotting corpses. Waveless and unmoving, the oceans have become little more than stagnant ponds filled with death and decay, and a thick haze of smoke practically obscures a blood-red Ataraxian sun.

And then, the vision rapidly fades and you suddenly awaken as if from a deep slumber to find yourself in the cavern again and lying face-down on the outcropping of rock. Both Malivor and Agamon are gone.

Picking yourself up, you recover your longsword, and determine that your chances of finding a way back to the surface are much greater with the staircase leading upwards. Following the tunnel at the top, you eventually emerge from the entrance of a well-hidden cave just outside of Autumn Glade. The sun has just begun to rise as you immediately make your way back to the chapel ruins with the hope of retrieving your mount, and it is with great relief that you find your horse, Beatrix, grazing not far from the entrance to the undercroft where you left her.

Somehow, Malivor must be stopped, and his plan to overthrow all of the kingdoms of Ataraxia thwarted, but how? Still very much overwhelmed and reeling inside from the terrifying vision of apocalyptic ruin, you mount your horse, and carefully consider the limited options before you.

A full day’s ride northwest from your position is the sea port and Capital City of Evan-Yor. Perhaps there is something the Coalition of Kings can do to stop Malivor if you raise the alarm. Unfortunately, to get there, you will have no choice but to ride through some extremely hazardous terrain, including the notoriously treacherous Murkmire Swamp.

On the other hand, if you were to head due south, lying nearly the same distance away is the University of Divination and the Arcane Arts. Maybe the mages there could shed some light on the Malivorian Prophecy of which Agamon spoke. Too, they might know more about the mysterious Sigil Stone of Sargonis as well as the Draconomicon. With that being said, getting there will be just as dangerous, if not more so, with your trek taking you through the harsh and desolate Badlands of Bukhari.

If you decide to make for the sea port of Evan-Yor with the hope of speaking to the Coalition of Kings, turn to 105

Or, will you choose to ride south for the University of Divination and the Arcane Arts? If this is your choice, turn to 179

 

ANOTHER EXCERPT FROM MALIVOR

Sometime later, the path you have been following unexpectedly opens up into a broad clearing. Right away, your mount begins to roll her eyes, visibly shaken and trembling in fright as she tries to retreat backward. And then, you simultaneously smell and see it ― the heavy stink of carrion and rotting flesh and what appears to be the opening to a large, crater-like pit just ahead! Its outer rim is literally strewn with the carcasses and skeletal remains of both men and beasts, and like the moat around a castle, it is surrounded on all sides by a stagnant pool of putrid, green slime. 

Suddenly, a large serpentine head perched on a long, scaly neck rises from its depths. This is quickly followed by a second, and then a third, fourth, and finally, a fifth head, as a terrifying, reptilian monstrosity crawls out of the pit.

Even as the hydra begins advancing towards you, you and your halfling companion have already dismounted ― you readying your double-edged blade and Tolman drawing his own after quickly lighting a torch...

 

FEATURING THE INCREDIBLE ARTWORK OF PER GRADIN

An epic story is only made better with the addition of epic art. That's why Savage Realms Gamebooks is excited to announce that fantasy artist, Per Gradin, will be bringing his dynamic style and phenomenal talents as an RPG illustrator to this book.

Here's the first illustration for Malivor: Cataclysm's Edge:

Below are some more samples of his mind-blowing work!

 

And featuring fillustrations by artist, Pat O'Neill...

 

THE GAME MECHANICS

RULES OF PLAY

The book you are holding in your hands is unique. Not extraordinary by any means, but unique in the fact that it is also a role-playing game. It is also unique in the sense that YOU choose your own destiny; that by your own choices YOU determine the direction and outcome of this story! In fact, sometimes your very fate might even depend on the roll of the dice themselves!

WHAT YOU WILL NEED

In addition to this gamebook and the CHARACTER LOG sheet contained within, you will also need a pencil with an eraser, and two six-sided dice (one for yourself and one for your opponent(s). The only other thing you will need for gameplay is a blank sheet of paper so that you can track damage to your LIFE FORCE and tally the damage you inflict upon your opponents.

CREATING YOUR CHARACTER

Included with this interactive adventure is a CHARACTER LOG sheet. It is highly recommended you make photocopies of it for gameplay. (Malivor: Cataclysm's Edge CHARACTER LOG sheets are also available for downloading and printing on our Facebook page, under the files tab at Savage Realms Gamebooks).

YOUR NAME

In the space provided, write your character’s NAME.

YOUR LIFE FORCE (LR SCORE)

Not simply just a measure of your health, it is also a measure of your overall fortitude, stamina, and resilience. Your default LR score is always 25, and any damage you sustain, whether it be from opponents, traps, or whatever, is subtracted from this number. (Use a separate sheet of paper to track any damage you might take during the course of your adventure).

CHARACTER CLASS

In this gamebook, you play the role of a FIGHTER ADEPT.

YOUR COMBAT SKILL SCORE (CSS)

This encompasses both your attack and defensive abilities when in combat. To determine your Combat Skill Score, or CSS, roll 1d6 and record that number in the space provided. If your roll is a 3 or LESS, then your default CSS is automatically a 3.

SKILL AND ATTRIBUTE SCORES

In addition to your Combat Skill Score, you also have three other skills as well as six attributes.

Your skills:

STEALTH

(This affects your ability to sneak, hide, silently take out opponents or even blend into a crowd).

LOCK PICKING

(This affects your ability to unlock and open doors, chests, and locks).

PICKPOCKETING

(This affects your ability to remove items from someone’s person or even plant something on them without being detected).

Your attributes:

INTELLECT

(This attribute comes into play with regard to solving problems and puzzles).

STRENGTH

(This attribute comes into play when you need to complete certain physical tasks).

AGILITY

(This attribute is a measure of your ability and  speed when running or fleeing, but could also come into play when dodging attacks).

CHARISMA

(This affects your ability to bribe, persuade, intimidate, barter and even lie).

RESISTANCE

(This affects your ability to resist certain lesser spells, as well as poisons, venom and toxins).

LUCK

(Although it is neither a skill nor an attribute, you can never have too much luck on your side).

Using your allotted budget of 18 points, distribute those points between your skills and attributes now. Each skill and attribute must have a minimum of 1 point assigned to them, but cannot, at any time in the game, ever have more than 5. (Write these numbers next to their corresponding skill or attribute on your CHARACTER LOG sheet).

PLEASE NOTE that as the game progresses, you will have opportunities to increase the scores of both your skills and your attributes, but those scores can never exceed 5, which is the maximum you can have for each one.

YOUR PURSE AND YOUR INVENTORY

Throughout the game, you will find various items that can be used during the course of your adventure. Gold pieces and gold coins are added to your PURSE. Everything else that you find is recorded in your INVENTORY. Any items that you consume, sell or are stolen must be removed from your INVENTORY.

You begin your quest with EIGHT items ― a double-edged longsword, chainmail armor, a bedroll with a blanket, provisions (food), TWO HEALTH potions and a wound dressing kit. Add these items to your INVENTORY now.

ENCOUNTERS

This is where you can keep track of all the various monsters and enemies you have faced and defeated throughout your adventure.

COMBAT

The combat in this gamebook is a simple, two-dice (2d6) attack/defend system. Each combat round begins with you rolling 1d6 and then adding it to your Combat Skill Score. The other 1d6 is rolled for your opponent and then added to their Combat Skill Score (represented in the text as Combat). Whoever has the highest total between you and your opponent is the party that “hits.” A 1d6 is then rolled to see how much damage was inflicted. A tie, where both of your totals are the same, means that neither of you hit.

This continues until you or the opposing side has been eliminated!

MULTIPLE OPPONENTS

Although in real-life combat scenarios multiple opponents would most likely attack simultaneously, in this adventure, they are fought one at a time.

HEALTH POTIONS

HEALTH potions can be used at any time to restore lost LR points, except when you are in combat. Each HEALTH potion can be used ONE TIME to restore 5 points. You are also free to use as many of them as you wish at any time, but your LIFE FORCE can never ever exceed its original default of 25.

DYING

If you are killed in combat, or die because of a failed check or choice you made, your adventure is over and you must return to the beginning of this book and start your quest all over.

USING YOUR SKILLS AND ATTRIBUTES

Throughout the course of this story, you will be introduced to unique scenarios that may call upon you to use a specific attribute. Whenever this happens, you will be prompted to do an attribute check by rolling a 1d6. If your roll is AT or UNDER your CURRENT SCORE for the attribute that is being checked, you have successfully passed that check. If, however, your roll exceeds your current score, then your check has failed.

SKILL AND ATTRIBUTE INCREASES

In real life, we learn from our failures and mistakes. For this reason, skill and attribute increases in this book are awarded for FAILURES rather than successes. This not only simulates learning, but prevents power creep and the “success-breeds-success” dynamic. Of course, if that failed check results in your untimely demise, then obviously, you will NOT be awarded an increase.

 

Now that you have a firm grasp of the gameplay mechanics...

Welcome to the World of Ataraxia!

 

BOOK SPECIFICATIONS

Both the paperback and hardback editions of the book will be approximately 6" x 9" and will be between 250 and 300 pages in total length, depending on the final number of illustrations.  Should you decide not to partner with us in this campaign, paperback copies will be available after the pledges have been fulfilled on Amazon.

 

THE REWARDS

Rewards include:

a virtual high-five and your name in the acknowledgments

digital wallpaper featuring exclusive artwork by artist, Per Gradin, from Malivor: Cataclysm's Edge (MCE)

a PDF of the book

bookplate stickers signed by the author featuring exclusive art by Per Gradin from MCE

SIX autographed prints of artwork by author/artist, TroyAnthony Schermer, inspired by Malivor: Cataclysm's Edge

TWO sets of TWO custom dice (4 dice total) featuring the Savage Realms dragon logo

FOUR exclusive FULL COLOR bookmarks featuring artwork by Per Gradin from MCE

EXCLUSIVE prints of some of Per Gradin's artwork from the book

and finally, a LIMITED EDITION, HARDBACK edition of the book with an alternate cover

All rewards will be shipped from the Savage Realms base of operations in beautiful Colorado Springs, CO in the United States. Should you decide not to partner with us in this campaign, paperback and hardback copies will be available after the pledges have been fulfilled on Amazon and its affiliate markets.

Thank you in advance for your support!

 

Be sure to join our Facebook group to stay up-to-speed on all things Savage Realms:

Savage Realms Gamebooks

https://www.facebook.com/groups/240797886828681/

 

Follow us on Twitter: Savage Realms Gamebooks @SGamebooks

 

And on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/gamebook_adventures/?...

 

Please message us with any feedback, questions, or concerns at: savagerealmsgamebooks@gmail.com

Or, will you choose to ride south for the University of Divination and the Arcane Arts? If this is your choice, turn to 179
 
ANOTHER EXCERPT FROM MALIVOR
Sometime later, the path you have been following unexpectedly opens up into a broad clearing. Right away, your mount begins to roll her eyes, visibly shaken and trembling in fright as she tries to retreat backward. And then, you simultaneously smell and see it ― the heavy stink of carrion and rotting flesh and what appears to be the opening to a large, crater-like pit just ahead! Its outer rim is literally strewn with the carcasses and skeletal remains of both men and beasts, and like the moat around a castle, it is surrounded on all sides by a stagnant pool of putrid, green slime. 
Suddenly, a large serpentine head perched on a long, scaly neck rises from its depths. This is quickly followed by a second, and then a third, fourth, and finally, a fifth head, as a terrifying, reptilian monstrosity crawls out of the pit.
Even as the hydra begins advancing towards you, you and your halfling companion have already dismounted ― you readying your double-edged blade and Tolman drawing his own after quickly lighting a torch...
 
FEATURING THE INCREDIBLE ARTWORK OF PER GRADIN
An epic story is only made better with the addition of epic art. That's why Savage Realms Gamebooks is excited to announce that fantasy artist, Per Gradin, will be bringing his dynamic style and phenomenal talents as an RPG illustrator to this book.
Here's the first illustration for Malivor: Cataclysm's Edge:

Below are some more samples of his mind-blowing work!
 
And featuring fillustrations by artist, Pat O'Neill...
 
THE GAME MECHANICS
RULES OF PLAY
The book you are holding in your hands is unique. Not extraordinary by any means, but unique in the fact that it is also a role-playing game. It is also unique in the sense that YOU choose your own destiny; that by your own choices YOU determine the direction and outcome of this story! In fact, sometimes your very fate might even depend on the roll of the dice themselves!
WHAT YOU WILL NEED
In addition to this gamebook and the CHARACTER LOG sheet contained within, you will also need a pencil with an eraser, and two six-sided dice (one for yourself and one for your opponent(s). The only other thing you will need for gameplay is a blank sheet of paper so that you can track damage to your LIFE FORCE and tally the damage you inflict upon your opponents.
CREATING YOUR CHARACTER

Included with this interactive adventure is a CHARACTER LOG sheet. It is highly recommended you make photocopies of it for gameplay. (Malivor: Cataclysm's Edge CHARACTER LOG sheets are also available for downloading and printing on our Facebook page, under the files tab at Savage Realms Gamebooks).
YOUR NAME
In the space provided, write your character’s NAME.
YOUR LIFE FORCE (LR SCORE)
Not simply just a measure of your health, it is also a measure of your overall fortitude, stamina, and resilience. Your default LR score is always 25, and any damage you sustain, whether it be from opponents, traps, or whatever, is subtracted from this number. (Use a separate sheet of paper to track any damage you might take during the course of your adventure).
CHARACTER CLASS
In this gamebook, you play the role of a FIGHTER ADEPT.
YOUR COMBAT SKILL SCORE (CSS)
This encompasses both your attack and defensive abilities when in combat. To determine your Combat Skill Score, or CSS, roll 1d6 and record that number in the space provided. If your roll is a 3 or LESS, then your default CSS is automatically a 3.
SKILL AND ATTRIBUTE SCORES
In addition to your Combat Skill Score, you also have three other skills as well as six attributes.
Your skills:
STEALTH
(This affects your ability to sneak, hide, silently take out opponents or even blend into a crowd).
LOCK PICKING
(This affects your ability to unlock and open doors, chests, and locks).
PICKPOCKETING
(This affects your ability to remove items from someone’s person or even plant something on them without being detected).
Your attributes:
INTELLECT
(This attribute comes into play with regard to solving problems and puzzles).
STRENGTH
(This attribute comes into play when you need to complete certain physical tasks).
AGILITY
(This attribute is a measure of your ability and  speed when running or fleeing, but could also come into play when dodging attacks).
CHARISMA
(This affects your ability to bribe, persuade, intimidate, barter and even lie).
RESISTANCE
(This affects your ability to resist certain lesser spells, as well as poisons, venom and toxins).
LUCK
(Although it is neither a skill nor an attribute, you can never have too much luck on your side).
Using your allotted budget of 18 points, distribute those points between your skills and attributes now. Each skill and attribute must have a minimum of 1 point assigned to them, but cannot, at any time in the game, ever have more than 5. (Write these numbers next to their corresponding skill or attribute on your CHARACTER LOG sheet).
PLEASE NOTE that as the game progresses, you will have opportunities to increase the scores of both your skills and your attributes, but those scores can never exceed 5, which is the maximum you can have for each one.
YOUR PURSE AND YOUR INVENTORY
Throughout the game, you will find various items that can be used during the course of your adventure. Gold pieces and gold coins are added to your PURSE. Everything else that you find is recorded in your INVENTORY. Any items that you consume, sell or are stolen must be removed from your INVENTORY.
You begin your quest with EIGHT items ― a double-edged longsword, chainmail armor, a bedroll with a blanket, provisions (food), TWO HEALTH potions and a wound dressing kit. Add these items to your INVENTORY now.
ENCOUNTERS
This is where you can keep track of all the various monsters and enemies you have faced and defeated throughout your adventure.
COMBAT
The combat in this gamebook is a simple, two-dice (2d6) attack/defend system. Each combat round begins with you rolling 1d6 and then adding it to your Combat Skill Score. The other 1d6 is rolled for your opponent and then added to their Combat Skill Score (represented in the text as Combat). Whoever has the highest total between you and your opponent is the party that “hits.” A 1d6 is then rolled to see how much damage was inflicted. A tie, where both of your totals are the same, means that neither of you hit.
This continues until you or the opposing side has been eliminated!
MULTIPLE OPPONENTS
Although in real-life combat scenarios multiple opponents would most likely attack simultaneously, in this adventure, they are fought one at a time.
HEALTH POTIONS
HEALTH potions can be used at any time to restore lost LR points, except when you are in combat. Each HEALTH potion can be used ONE TIME to restore 5 points. You are also free to use as many of them as you wish at any time, but your LIFE FORCE can never ever exceed its original default of 25.
DYING
If you are killed in combat, or die because of a failed check or choice you made, your adventure is over and you must return to the beginning of this book and start your quest all over.
USING YOUR SKILLS AND ATTRIBUTES
Throughout the course of this story, you will be introduced to unique scenarios that may call upon you to use a specific attribute. Whenever this happens, you will be prompted to do an attribute check by rolling a 1d6. If your roll is AT or UNDER your CURRENT SCORE for the attribute that is being checked, you have successfully passed that check. If, however, your roll exceeds your current score, then your check has failed.
SKILL AND ATTRIBUTE INCREASES
In real life, we learn from our failures and mistakes. For this reason, skill and attribute increases in this book are awarded for FAILURES rather than successes. This not only simulates learning, but prevents power creep and the “success-breeds-success” dynamic. Of course, if that failed check results in your untimely demise, then obviously, you will NOT be awarded an increase.
 
Now that you have a firm grasp of the gameplay mechanics...
Welcome to the World of Ataraxia!
 
BOOK SPECIFICATIONS
Both the paperback and hardback editions of the book will be approximately 6" x 9" and will be between 250 and 300 pages in total length, depending on the final number of illustrations.  Should you decide not to partner with us in this campaign, paperback copies will be available after the pledges have been fulfilled on Amazon.
 
THE REWARDS
Rewards include:
a virtual high-five and your name in the acknowledgments
digital wallpaper featuring exclusive artwork by artist, Per Gradin, from Malivor: Cataclysm's Edge (MCE)
a PDF of the book
bookplate stickers signed by the author featuring exclusive art by Per Gradin from MCE
SIX autographed prints of artwork by author/artist, TroyAnthony Schermer, inspired by Malivor: Cataclysm's Edge
TWO sets of TWO custom dice (4 dice total) featuring the Savage Realms dragon logo
FOUR exclusive FULL COLOR bookmarks featuring artwork by Per Gradin from MCE
EXCLUSIVE prints of some of Per Gradin's artwork from the book
and finally, a LIMITED EDITION, HARDBACK edition of the book with an alternate cover
All rewards will be shipped from the Savage Realms base of operations in beautiful Colorado Springs, CO in the United States. Should you decide not to partner with us in this campaign, paperback and hardback copies will be available after the pledges have been fulfilled on Amazon and its affiliate markets.
Thank you in advance for your support!
 
Be sure to join our Facebook group to stay up-to-speed on all things Savage Realms:
Savage Realms Gamebooks
https://www.facebook.com/groups/240797886828681/
 
Follow us on Twitter: Savage Realms Gamebooks @SGamebooks
 
And on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/gamebook_adventures/?...
 
Please message us with any feedback, questions, or concerns at: savagerealmsgamebooks@gmail.com

story:
MY FATHER, MY FAITH  

a daughter's inspiring true story of medical advocacy and love's ability to heal

Welcome to my Page & Passionate Project!

I have been a writer and photographer most of my creative life.  I started this project after my father's passing (the late cartoonist Alex Toth), but set it down for over a decade, because it was so emotional to write.  Ironically, I found the manuscript on Father's Day 2020, and the rest of the manuscript poured out onto the pages.  It was time.

While my father received notoriety and accolades for his work, the truth is, his desire to lean into relationships and love were his greatest unlived dreams.  Without that, he felt isolated an alone.   

I came back into his life (after 10 years), and he'd not left his house in 20 years.  Against all odds, and the predictions of doctors and a psychiatrist, he left to seek medical attention and embark on a new chapter.

The trials and errors within the medical system were unfathomable.  And yet, the miracles were so profound, they cannot be overlooked.  Within faith is the opportunity to see the silver lining in all things, even hardship and loss.

With timing, all things come with an opportunity, a lesson, or both.  

My father left this lifetime loving and being loved in a way that never would have happened otherwise.

My book with imagery included, is estimated at 150 pages.  It is currently in a formal edit.  I've chosen BookBaby as the (self) publisher.  They will also be assisting with the final version of the interior formating, as well as the ebook formatting and initial distribution.  I will follow with an audio version of the book (that I will be reading).

The book is designed as a small hardcover that can sit on a coffee table.  It is simple, clean and black & white, inside and out (my father would have loved that, as do I).

It makes a unique gift or inspiring self read.  It can cross over to many genres including self help, medical advocacy, faith, spirituality, caring for parents (or loved ones) loss/grief, relationships/healing, and art/comic.

Contributors that support my campaign with a contribution of $30 will receive a copy of the ebook; contributions of  $50 will receive a signed hard copy of the first edition.  I am gratefully embracing all contributors as part of my initial launch team.  The prospect of generating reviews from any/all contributors would be a gift.  

I will be updating along the way, as I move into the stages of publishing, marketing and launching. 

I have many other books swirling around in my creative mind and heart. 

I hope this is just the beginning of exploring one passionate project at a time.

Please feel free to reach out with any and all questions.  

In gratitude, dana

story:
Short Summary

My name is Ryden Allen. I'm an autistic, nonbinary parent (oh, and I work in a library, but really, parenting is my number one job!) When I started the process of becoming pregnant, I looked for anything I could relate to. There's, well, not a lot out there. Since then, I've written two picture books and a young adult novel about my experiences, one of which you'll be able to support here!

I wrote My Daddy's Not Like Other Daddies because I wanted to give my kid and all the others I see in his shoes something to relate to. I bring him home picture books every week, and none of them reflect our family. I'd say it's about time to change that.

The book has already been accepted for publication at a local publisher, but we need help covering the cost to print it. Otherwise, we've got a book...that no one can read. Which is basically no book at all. Your contribution will literally change the world of children's picture books by helping to produce something that is needed and barely exists, if at all. You'll also help me, a trans person myself, to write more books to reach even more audiences and keep on increasing diversity in media!

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need about $600. This will allow us to print 100 books, enough to get us started without creating a burden on myself or on buyers. It will go directly to printing the book that you are paying for and sending it to you. The book is completed, so if we don't reach our goal, it will still be printed, but it will take longer to get it out, there may be less printed, and it will increase my own debt burden since I'll have to pay out of pocket.

Either way, if you contribute, you will get to support an Own Voices project and increase diversity in kids' lit! Plus you'll have the chance to get first copies of my book, copies of my new adult book Expectations, and MASSIVE THANKS. Can you feel the thanks coming your way already?!

 

The Impact

This book is important to me because not only will it create representation for my child and their family, but it will help me keep writing (financially and moralistically) and just keep us keeping on.

But it's bigger than that. Have you ever browsed books and been disappointed not to find anyone you can relate to? Maybe you're a tomboy and all the girls in media are fancy princesses. Maybe you're a different race than all the protagonists you enjoy. My book will increase diversity in an area barely touched and give kids and their parents a chance to see themselves in a book and know their voices are worth hearing.

 

Risks & Challenges

This book has been accepted for publication. It has completed art and text that is ready to go except for finishing touches. It's happening, whether we meet our goal or not.

That said, if we don't meet the goal, it will be a slower publication process. Not only will it increase hardship on me (not to be self-centered, but, uh, I need to not be in any more debt and instead put my money towards my kid), but it will also take more time as we will have to print smaller batches. This will also drive up the cost to buyers, a population that is more likely to face economic hardships themselves.

But it will happen. I will use credit cards and (hopefully mild) price increases to pay for printing, as well as open it to pre-orders. I will be upfront in challenges and letting anyone pre-ordering know my timeline.

Another challenge is getting books in the mail. I live by a post office, but I'm a single parent (for other single parents, enough said--for non-single parents, it's just harder to get places while hauling a small child). I plan on making weekly trips and enlisting help of family if ordering gets high enough to be necessary. I've sold items online and always made my deadline, I'm really good at time management, and one of the perks is to get to the front of the line.  Unless something extreme happens (*looks at 2020* *knocks on wood with both hands*), if you contribute, you will be getting your perk, no matter what.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, that's fine. Look, we've all had a crazy year (and a half...). I'm right there with you. What you can do is share it among your friends and family. Hit the share button. Talk about it at the (new, socially distanced) water cooler and in the grocery line. Got queer friends? Let them know a book is coming that's just for them! Even if they can't contributed, they can be excited for it! Mention it to your librarian--while they might not be able to contribute to Indiegogo, it will get the book on their radar and when it does come out, one way or another, they'll be able to add it to their collection. Even if you can contribute, please do this anyway! Get excited about it, because that makes things happen!

story:
About the project:

Random Walk is a science fiction novel about a team of US Air Force astronauts who unexpectedly find themselves in the far reaches of our galaxy. Cut off from Earth with no idea where they are or how they got there, they have to work together to find a way home before their life support runs out.

Your support will enable me to professionally publish Random Walk, the first book in a planned series. I have already written the draft, and the money we raise will go toward professional publishing services to make this a high-quality product.

(See below for an excerpt!)


Why I’m asking for money:
Most indie authors pay the expense of publishing and marketing their books out of pocket and hope that sales will exceed those up-front costs. Unfortunately, I don't have that kind of cash. Publishing services to avoid dropped plot points, distracting typos and bad cover art are expenses I just can’t afford without your help.


How the money will be used:
This campaign’s funding is flexible, so even if we fall short of the goal, I’ll be able to use what we do get to pay for some combination of publishing services. With the full funding of $5,000, I will be able to pay for:

Stretch Goal #1: $8,000
With this amount, I can also pay for professional copyediting and interior design (how the words look on the page). These are important services I'd rather not do without.

Stretch Goal #2: $10,000
If we reach this goal, I will also be able to afford professional proofreading (it makes a difference!), and additional marketing materials - which I'll share digitally with all of you.

Stretch Goal #3: $50,000
Now we’re really dreaming! If you make this fantasy a reality, I'll be able to market the book professionally and everyone giving $10 or more will get an exclusive, high-quality Random Walk lab notebook/journal!


Assurances:
Worried about quality? Let me give you my assurances...

Publishing: I am a professional freelance editor with a Master’s Degree in Book Publishing. I am planning the novel's production and release very carefully.

Writing: It’s true, this is my debut novel, but I've studied the craft extensively and have started building publication record. I have published magazine articles and guest blogs, and recently had a meditation and a poem accepted for publication. I also self-published a book of poems and have written a full-length play, among other things. I’m a good writer, and this is the best thing I've written to date - so says my mom, and she isn't the type who thinks everything I write is Pulitzer material. (Thanks, Mom!)

You can read an excerpt from the draft here! And now you can read chapter one!

Science: I have worked very hard to make any actual science in the book as accurate as possible, and to ensure the fictional elements are reasonable.

The Military: Several of my characters are members of the US Air Force. I myself am an Air Force veteran, so I was able to draw on my experience for this novel. I also got to invent a few military units and acronyms. It’s been pretty fun!

Reward fulfillment: I’ve done my research and am confident I will have no problem getting rewards out to everyone on time. I will be assisted in this effort by the project management experience I gained in the Air Force, and by my Dad, who is the world’s greatest organizer.


Timeline:
Random Walk will be released on December 10, 2019. You will have your ebook on launch day. All tangible rewards will be mailed out within a week of the launch. So donate now and get your rewards in time for the holidays!


Reward Tiers:

Economy ($1 or more): You don’t have much to spare, but you want to support the project – thank you!! Every dollar is greatly appreciated.

Digital Reader ($10 or more): Trendy but still on a budget, you’ll receive my thanks and the ebook of Random Walk.

The Purist ($30 or more): You want a hard copy, thank you very much, and you’re going to get one! Along with my thanks and the ebook, you’ll also receive a signed paperback copy of Random Walk.

Nerd ($50 or more): You just have to go that one step further. Sign up for this tier and you’ll receive everything the Purists get, plus an awesome, 4” embroidered squadron patch – just like the main characters wear on their uniforms. Get ready to cosplay!

Connoisseur ($100 or more): As a book-lover, you appreciate the beauty of the object itself. In addition to my thanks, the ebook, and the embroidered unit patch, you will receive a signed, limited-edition hardback, complete with dust jacket. Fancy!

Groupie ($150 or more): When you support someone, you support them hard. Get ready for all the cool stuff included in the Connoisseur reward tier, plus two matted 5x7 prints: the cover art for Random Walk, and a sketch of one of the main characters (your choice).

Collector ($250 or more): Not satisfied with just one book and two prints? At this tier you get my thanks, the ebook, a signed paperback copy of Random Walk, the unit patch, all four matted prints, AND a signed hardback copy. Bam.

Enthusiast ($500 or more): For this ridiculous level of patronage, you get all the Collector swag, your name in the acknowledgements of the book, PLUS a custom-made Challenge Coin! A military tradition, Challenge Coins are heavy, detailed, and beyond awesome – I keep my collection in a fancy case. You’ll love it.

 

One more thing:

Don't forget to share this campaign on Social Media, and thank you for your support!

I have published magazine articles and guest blogs, and recently had a meditation and a poem accepted for publication. I also self-published a book of poems and have written a full-length play, among other things. I’m a good writer, and this is the best thing I've written to date - so says my mom, and she isn't the type who thinks everything I write is Pulitzer material. (Thanks, Mom!)You can read an excerpt from the draft here! And now you can read chapter one!Science: I have worked very hard to make any actual science in the book as accurate as possible, and to ensure the fictional elements are reasonable.The Military: Several of my characters are members of the US Air Force. I myself am an Air Force veteran, so I was able to draw on my experience for this novel. I also got to invent a few military units and acronyms. It’s been pretty fun!Reward fulfillment: I’ve done my research and am confident I will have no problem getting rewards out to everyone on time. I will be assisted in this effort by the project management experience I gained in the Air Force, and by my Dad, who is the world’s greatest organizer.Timeline:Random Walk will be released on December 10, 2019. You will have your ebook on launch day. All tangible rewards will be mailed out within a week of the launch. So donate now and get your rewards in time for the holidays!Reward Tiers:Economy ($1 or more): You don’t have much to spare, but you want to support the project – thank you!! Every dollar is greatly appreciated.Digital Reader ($10 or more): Trendy but still on a budget, you’ll receive my thanks and the ebook of Random Walk.The Purist ($30 or more): You want a hard copy, thank you very much, and you’re going to get one! Along with my thanks and the ebook, you’ll also receive a signed paperback copy of Random Walk.Nerd ($50 or more): You just have to go that one step further. Sign up for this tier and you’ll receive everything the Purists get, plus an awesome, 4” embroidered squadron patch – just like the main characters wear on their uniforms. Get ready to cosplay!Connoisseur ($100 or more): As a book-lover, you appreciate the beauty of the object itself. In addition to my thanks, the ebook, and the embroidered unit patch, you will receive a signed, limited-edition hardback, complete with dust jacket. Fancy!Groupie ($150 or more): When you support someone, you support them hard. Get ready for all the cool stuff included in the Connoisseur reward tier, plus two matted 5x7 prints: the cover art for Random Walk, and a sketch of one of the main characters (your choice).Collector ($250 or more): Not satisfied with just one book and two prints? At this tier you get my thanks, the ebook, a signed paperback copy of Random Walk, the unit patch, all four matted prints, AND a signed hardback copy. Bam.Enthusiast ($500 or more): For this ridiculous level of patronage, you get all the Collector swag, your name in the acknowledgements of the book, PLUS a custom-made Challenge Coin! A military tradition, Challenge Coins are heavy, detailed, and beyond awesome – I keep my collection in a fancy case. You’ll love it. One more thing:Don't forget to share this campaign on Social Media, and thank you for your support!

story:
Let us first state the obvious: This book is not meant to objectify women. On the contrary: this book is made in honor and praise of women—all women—and boobs are the red thread that leads us on this particular journey. 

This book is also not about the size or appearance of any boob, or even about having them or not. Big boobs, small boobs, no boobs—it doesn’t matter. We favor no one and include everyone.

Instead, this book is about what boobs symbolize. As an icon, these fascinating, visually striking, biological wonders of cultural importance transcend language, yet throughout history they have often been misunderstood and mishandled. Boobs are the basic symbols of life, freedom, prosperity, joy, safety, sex, independence—not to mention food—and they tirelessly bear the promise of a brighter future. After you finish reading this book, you may ask yourself, why, is there anything a boob can’t do?

And last but not least, this book is about how to care for your boobs. Our number one goal is to inspire boob health, including screening and self-examination, because when it comes to breast cancer, the battle of the boob is one we will win. That’s why all profits from the future sale of this book will go directly to organizations that focus on the research, prevention, and treatment of breast cancer.

Let our boobs invite you to share a giggle, reflect, and impress on you something new. Then, let’s look beyond the boobs, at the larger picture of what it means to be a woman, a man, a human. Women, this one’s for you. You strong, resilient, gentle, loving yet powerful souls. We look up to your natural beauty and wisdom. Whoever you are, whatever kind of boobs you have, you inherently have the magic.

So then, in boobs we trust, and in women we believe. Hail the boob! Hail all women! The future belongs to you so please be strong for us all, and let your boobs lead the way.

Recent studies suggest that many women in the U.S. are not following recommended guidelines for mammography screening by having their first screening later than recommended, not having one at recommended intervals or not receiving appropriate and timely follow-up of positive screening results. 

Our offer is simple: You get a beautifully printed, one-of-a-kind book filled with art from a vast array of artists with diverse styles but a singular message; while 100% of future profits go to support breast cancer organizations. That’s a win-win in our book.

Daughters, mothers, sisters, friends, girlfriends, wives, co-workers that you feel close enough to say the word “boob” in front of. Anyone and everyone that enjoys pop art and/or needs a little reminder to tune in to their breast health. 

Risks and challenges

We have extensive experience in publishing and book production, paired with a decade-long relationship with printers and distributors. We have complete trust in their abilities. Our timeline is carefully thought through and planned in order to eliminate any production snags, with a time buffer built in to cover anything unexpected.

story:
The Impact of The Lost Pleiad

There is an entire community of people in the world who identify as Starseeds, including myself. What I’ve learned is that many resonate with the teachings of Starseeds and their incredible power for love and intense desire for connection.

When I first learned about Pleiadian Starseeds over seven years ago, I knew this was a book I needed to write. I felt that if I wrote this, I could help this community and the readers around the world feel more connected to one another.

I also believe this book speaks to the sense of loneliness and disconnect we all feel at one point or another, especially when we are on a search for belonging.

 

When people read this book, I want them to feel like:

  • There is hope everywhere
  • You are deeply and universally loved
  • We are all connected
  • We are powerful creators
  • You are here for a purpose

 

About The Lost Pleiad - Pleiades Greek Myth Retelling

 

The Lost Pleiad is the premiere fictional novel in The Lost Pleiad book series.

My name is Kelly Branyik and I am a published author and article writer. I started this first novel back in November 2020 for NaNoWriMo and it’s my first fiction novel ever. 

I’m putting together this campaign to raise funds for publishing while also giving exclusive access to the first batch of printed books to those eagerly awaiting its launch.

I am also donating 40% of everything I raise to two causes. 

The Young Writer’s Foundation, which works with young writers ages 12 - 19 as they develop their writing skills.

NaNoWriMo, which helps people finish their writing or creative projects in a 30-day challenge.

*Update 8/20/2021: Since this campaign didn't meet the necessary funds needed, I will be donating to one foundation instead of two. A $255 donation will go to NaNoWriMo this time! 

The purpose of this campaign is to release my book successfully while also helping others who are on their writing journeys

Writing novels has been a long-term dream of mine ever since I read my first Kristin Hannah novel.

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

In order for me to reach my publishing goals, I need to raise $15,000. 

  • 60% of those funds will be used for publishing and marketing (Both paperback and hardcover, possibly audiobook)
  • 20% will be happily donated to the Young Writer’s Foundation
  • 20% will also be happily donated to the platform that helped me get started, NaNoWriMo

 

There are incredible perks for you when you contribute to this project. Some of which are:

  • Donation to non-profits that help people become their best writing self
  • Signed hardcover or paperback copies of The Lost Pleiad
  • A sneak peek chapter prior to launch
  • A Zoom invitation to the official book launch this 2021
  • Handmade resin galaxy diamond replicas (a secret to the story)
  • A Write With Light Publications, LLC branded T-Shirt
  • A branded sticker & bookmark

 

If I don’t reach this entire goal, the same percentage of donations listed above will still be put toward these amazing organizations and whatever I can print for those who purchased a perk.

 

Risks & Challenges

All self-published authors face a common challenge; a lack of resources and funds to print their books. 

Without the help of a traditional publishing company, you are really on your own when it comes to publishing, printing, and marketing your books.

I realize, by doing this, I risk losing funds, not raising enough to publish my book or market it, thus taking me back to square one where I sort of squeeze by while the potential for this novel fades.

It is very challenging marketing your book without a history of marketing and branding power behind you (i.e. traditional, big-name publishers).

The bigger risk of going with self-publishing or hybrid publishing is that it might not work. However, I have great confidence this will be a story loved by many.

 

The Lost Pleiad Synopsis

 

She set out on a journey to find home, and ended up finding two. Which one will she choose?

Anya Allen has always felt out of place on Earth and strangely felt more connected to the stars. Stargazing has been a life-long hobby for Anya but there is one constellation she favors above all others; The Pleiades. 

As befuddling as this connection was, she still spent years convincing herself everyone felt just as lost in the world as she did. But at 30-years-old, her strongest desire to belong takes her on a journey to discover who she really is and her true place in the Universe. 

As her online research awakens her introspective curiosity, she discovers truths about the star cluster that evokes a possibility she only vaguely suspected; she might not be from planet Earth. 

How can that be?

Motivated to get answers, Anya seeks assistance from a duo of lightworkers, who introduce her to metaphysical travels that will shoot her to the one place she had only ever imagined as a child. As her abilities to move between two worlds intensifies, so does a budding romantic bond with one person who knows and accepts her better than anyone, Sam. 

Suddenly, Earth was feeling like the home she had always yearned for.

Their deepening love threatens to disrupt Anya’s desires to visit a world unknown and find the place she truly belongs.

Through a series of interstellar travels, Anya finally finds the home she has always longed for but which world is she actually destined to live in?

 

**Grab your copy today and take a spiritual and thrilling journey to the stars!**

The Lost Pleiad is a romantic and inspiring full-length Greek mythology retelling of The Seven Sisters as told in 170,000 words. This self-explorative story will transport science fiction and Greek mythology fans to a marvelous galactic world within our Universe that many believe exist but have never actually seen.

Binge the COMPLETE series!

 

THE READING ORDER:

  • Book 1: The Lost Pleiad (2021)
  • Book 2: Pearl of the Sky (Tentative Release 2022)
  • Book 3: A Star and Her King (Tentative Release 2023)

 

***Fans of Greek mythology stories like Circe and spiritual science fiction stories like To Sleep in a Sea of Stars, will fall in love with this confusing and uplifting journey to finding home. People of the Pleiadian community will resonate with this story and what it means to learn who they are in the Universe.***

If you love sci-fi stories like Dune, To Sleep in a Sea of Stars, or retold Greek mythology stories like Circe you will enjoy The Lost Pleiad! Get your copy today and take this inspiring journey to the stars.

story:
U-JOINTS project

An international research project on the theme of connections in design and architecture.

A joint – the union of two or more parts – is a fundamental element in almost any designed object, be it a famous bridge, the coffee maker in your kitchen, or a revolving office chair.

The joint comes in every possible size and material: nanoscale or the size of a room; plastic, steel, carbon fibre, wood or wool. A joint might be ingeniously engineered or the result of garage tinkering. Designers, architects and engineers alike appropriate standard connectors; they assemble and personalise them. Sometimes, they invent new joinery from scratch. Truly multivalent, the joint is the kind of detail that holds the world together.

But because a joint is often invisible, hidden elegantly within an object, it can be overlooked.
U-JOINTS sheds light on these hidden details in an in-depth survey of joints.


U-JOINTS - Equations of a universal lifestyle exhibition, Salone del Mobile, Milano, 2018 ©Delfino Sisto Legnani


U-JOINTS - Equations of a universal lifestyle exhibition, Salone del Mobile, Milano, 2018 ©Delfino Sisto Legnani
 

U-JOINTS background

The U-JOINTS research project was initiated in 2018 with an exhibition. Called U-JOINTS – Equations of universal life, it took shape as an eclectic introduction to the topic of connections. Curators Andrea Caputo and Anniina Koivu broke joints open, organised them by material and production processes, reassembled them into prototypes, and used them in real-world applications. For eight days, U-Joints featured 919 exhibits by 50 international designers and industry professionals. On show was everything from the most common joints to design’s most innovative ones, as well as those that have had the greatest influence on contemporary design and architecture.

Encouraged by the exhibition’s success and the remarkable attention and endorsement it garnered, the team launched an extensive research challenge: a comprehensive review of the world’s joints and how they hold things together.

Employing an inclusive and collective approach from the very beginning, the ongoing research is shared with the public through a series of exhibitions in which contemporary designers, researchers, institutions and critics are invited to share their work with joinery.

Each show reads like the chapter of a book.

In 2019, A taxonomy of nails, screws, rivets, bolts and nuts looked at basic fasteners and was held at Galerie l’elac of ECAL/University of Art and Design Lausanne in Switzerland.

Next, Adhesives and Fusions will open to the public on 6 March 2021 at the Gewerbemuseum Winterthur. Further exhibitions are being planned.

Finally, after almost three years of work, we are excited to launch our comprehensive book on the topic. U-Joints – A taxonomy of connections will come out in 2021.


U-JOINTS - A taxonomy of nails, screws, rivets, bolts and nuts exhibition, ECAL, Lausanne 2019 ©Calypso Mahieu
 


U-JOINTS - A taxonomy of nails, screws, rivets, bolts and nuts exhibition, ECAL, Lausanne 2019 ©Calypso Mahieu
 

U-JOINTS  the book

U-JOINTS – A taxonomy of connections is an encyclopedic publication that looks at human history through its details, and invites us to see our built environment in whole new ways.

Weighing in at more than 900 pages, this is the most far-reaching book ever published on the topic of joints. Comprehensive and interdisciplinary, the book features technical information about joinery as well as stories and commentaries. The heart of the book is a vast taxonomy of more than 1300 joints, organized into six main chapters: Basic fasteners, Mechanical joints, Knits and Knots, Wood joints, Adhesives, and Fused joints.

Each chapter traces the macrocosm of joinery. Together, they create a vast overview of the most common joints as well as insight into joinery’s unique solutions, historical and contemporary. Little known surprises and forgotten connecting methods abound.

Furthermore, the book features 80 essays and interviews, as well as 120 anecdotes. These share the often-unknown stories of joints, from how they were invented to their many inventive applications. The book also includes more than 1000 images, 240 illustrations and numerous patents. 15 new photographic works by young and upcoming photographers reframe the overlooked details for readers to discover.

The book was compiled by a team of more than 50 authors, photographers, illustrators, researchers, experts, scholars, scientists and story tellers, enthusiasts, users, designers, architects, artists, writers and critics, dreamers and makers. Together we hope to bring the many fascinating facets of joints to life.

This is a prototype. The final cover and product may slightly differ. ©Margot Sparkes
 


This is a prototype. The final cover and product may slightly differ.
 


A sample spread of the Taxonomy section, featuring more than 1300 joints and connections.
 

The Taxonomy includes most common joints as well as unique solutions from history. ©Margot Sparkes
 


Photographers were commissioned to shed light on the often hidden details of an object.​
 


A new generation of photographers produced more than 15 portfolios of joints and connections.
 


More than 50 authors contributed essays and interviews with international architects, designers, artists, inventors, scholars, makers and users of well-designed products and architectures.
 

The publication includes more than 80 in-depth articles on connections in design, architecture and art.

Eleonora Castellarin is the mastermind behind the extensive Taxonomy.

Graphic Thought Facility created the straightforward and simple layout that presents an immensity of information effortlessly.

Contributors, subjects and authors include: AATB, Johanna Agermann Ross, Anni Albers, Florian Amoser, Ant Farm, Ron Arad, Archigram, Inés Ariza, ARUP, Clifford Ashley, Margherita Banchi, Anne Bates, Luca Becchetti, Elizabeth Bisley, Philippe Block, Raul Gonzales Bravo, Barbara Brondi, Franco Bulian, Gabriela Burkhalter, Marianne Burkhalter, Jacques Carelman, Marco Casino, Charlie Chaplin, Pierre Charpin, Brendan Cormier, Matthieu Cortat, Marco Costantini, Thomas Demand, Benjamin Dillenburger, Pierre Doze, Delphine Drouin-Prouvé, Norman Foster, Buckminster Fuller, Fabrizio Gallanti, Ilaria Giannetti, Fabio Gramzio, Susanne Graner, Sam Grawe, Maxime Guyon, Sebastian Hackenschmidt, James Hennessey, Yngve Holen, Clare Hunter, Dylan Iwakuni, Philippe Johnson, Hella Jongerius, Jane Joyce, Hettie Judah, Eliyahu Keller, Ruby Kitching, Matthias Kohler, Kengo Kuma, Shiro Kuramata, Tiffany Lambert, Mike Lane, Sergio Leone, Liam, Daisy and Dave, Miles Lewis, Vico Magistretti, Enzo Mari, Michael Marriott, Allegra Martin, Sally McGrane, Angus McGuyver, Alberto Meda, Leonardo Mosso, Marc Newson, Claes Oldenburg, Damian Ortega, Victor Papanek, Des Pawson, Gaetano Pesce, Tom F. Peters, Philippe Petit, Marta Pezzoli, Francesca Picchi, Mariana Popescu, Jean Prouvé, Piercarlo Quecchia, Marco Rainò, Peter Rice, Peter Lymburner Robertson, Richard Rogers, Nadja Rottner, Simone Sandahl, Delfino Sisto Legnani, Bruce Sterling, Oli Stratford, Deyan Sudjic, Christian Sumi, Superstudio, Skylar Tibbits, Margaret Tudor, Alice Twemlow, Jonas Villinger, Justinas Vilutis, Konrad Wachsmann, Hans Wegner, Yves Weinand, Richard Wiborg, Mark Whitby, Lebbeus Woods, Frank Lloyd Wright, Marco Zanuso, Peter Zumthor, and many more!


Each chapter constitutes a proposal: by looking at particular details, we can help you understand the constructed world a little better. As a result, this publication is many things: a manual in a workshop, an encyclopedic reference guide for scholars and design enthusiasts, as well as an indispensable resource for students of architecture and design.
 

U-JOINTS press and comments

Paola Antonelli, senior curator, MoMA: "U-Joints has been my favorite stop in Design Week. Curated by Andrea Caputo and Anniina Koivu, it is an outstanding exhibition on joints and connections. It features an obsessive taxonomy and a thorough timeline. Unadulterated curatorial delight!”

Alice Rawsthorn, design expert: “You may never confuse a clamp with a coupling, or a dovetail with a rivet again.”

Alice Stori, design curator: “If you have to see one thing this Salone make it the U-Joints exhibition curated by Andrea Caputo and Anniina Koivu! Every designer and design student should bring their sketch book and get down to basics.”

Zoë Ryan, director of the Institute of Contemporary Art, University of Pennsylvania: “U-Joints […] examines a multitude of simply that – ways to join things together – through 50 designers’ experiments, prototypes and products. Great show.”

Disegno magazine: “Curators Andrea Caputo and Anniina Koivu are to be applauded. On paper, their pitch for U-Joins sounds dry and inaccessible: an exhibition examining a history of the joint and other connecting technologies within design. The results, however, are anything but. U-Joints is engrossing and animated, while nonetheless not shirking the inherent technicality and geekery of its subject matter; it manages the delicate balance of being both a real designer’s design exhibition, while also remaining of interest to a general audience.”

Modern Design Review: “U-Joints is not only one of the best shows of this year’s Salone, it’s one of the best shows to be presented at the Salone for a long time.”
 

Publication specs

Graphic Design: Graphic Thought Facility 
Format: 21x26.9 cm (8,25x10,59 in)
Volume: 900+ pages
Language: English
 

Editors

Andrea Caputo is an architect and researcher living in Milan. He combines his professional practise with ongoing research in the architectural and urban planning fields, and has published numerous editorial projects and articles. In 2011, Andrea opened his award-winning architecture studio in Milan and three years later, in 2017, he opened another in Shanghai. His work is recognised for its unexpected solutions, often juxtaposing different materials, which draw attention to the smallest of architectural details. The studio works internationally, developing complex projects on all scales, in collaboration with a qualified network of specialist consultants. His first investigation into urban culture’s aesthetic and social influences was published as All City Writers (Critique Livre, 2009) and soon became a sought-after reference work for street culture. From 2018-19, he edited Domus magazine's "Studio Visit" column, which explored contemporary architecture studios’ practices. Currently, Andrea’s studio is engaged on behalf of the Vastushilpa Foundation of Ahmedabab to conduct a vast survey on the architecture of Balkrishna Doshi, Pritzker Prize 2018. www.andreacaputo.com

Anniina Koivu is a design writer, curator, consultant and teacher, who divides her time between Milan and Lausanne. She works across a number of fields, from curation to art direction, product development, and editorial and research projects, which she develops for clients such as Kvadrat, Iittala, Vitra, Camper and the Shorefast Foundation of Fogo Island. Her latest publication is Vico Magistretti: Stories of Objects (Ecal/Triest, 2020), the result of an investigation of the little-considered moment in the lifespan of design products when production ends, with a focus on the reasons that lead up to this ‘death’ of the design object. She wrote the comprehensive monograph on Ronan and Erwan Bouroullec Works (Phaidon, 2011) and has edited and contributed to a number of publications such Materialising Colour: Journeys with Giulio Ridolfo (Phaidon, 2020), Atlas of Furniture Design (Vitra Design Museum, 2019), Industrial Facility (Phaidon, 2018), Arita 2016/ (Phaidon, 2017), The Walking Society (Lars Müller, 2015) and Pierre Charpin's Entre Les Vases (Birkhäuser, 2009) among others. Serving as editor-in-chief, Anniina launched the first print issue of Interwoven (Kvadrat, 2020), an (online) magazine on contemporary culture and independent criticism. Among her recent curatorial works are Tehdas – Fabrik – Factory (Fiskars Village Art & Design Biennale, 2019), an exhibition exploring the diversity of contemporary design production, and Typologie: the wine bottle and the cork stopper (Milan, 2019). She has been a speaker, moderator and juror at international design competitions and events. She is Head of Master Theory at University of Art and Design Lausanne ECAL. www.anniinakoivu.com

Now, working collectively and collaboratively, we will also self-publish this large volume and share it with the wider public at an accessible price. U-JOINTS project
An international research project on the theme of connections in design and architecture.A joint – the union of two or more parts – is a fundamental element in almost any designed object, be it a famous bridge, the coffee maker in your kitchen, or a revolving office chair.
The joint comes in every possible size and material: nanoscale or the size of a room; plastic, steel, carbon fibre, wood or wool. A joint might be ingeniously engineered or the result of garage tinkering. Designers, architects and engineers alike appropriate standard connectors; they assemble and personalise them. Sometimes, they invent new joinery from scratch. Truly multivalent, the joint is the kind of detail that holds the world together.
But because a joint is often invisible, hidden elegantly within an object, it can be overlooked.U-JOINTS sheds light on these hidden details in an in-depth survey of joints.U-JOINTS - Equations of a universal lifestyle exhibition, Salone del Mobile, Milano, 2018 ©Delfino Sisto LegnaniU-JOINTS - Equations of a universal lifestyle exhibition, Salone del Mobile, Milano, 2018 ©Delfino Sisto Legnani 

U-JOINTS background
The U-JOINTS research project was initiated in 2018 with an exhibition. Called U-JOINTS – Equations of universal life, it took shape as an eclectic introduction to the topic of connections. Curators Andrea Caputo and Anniina Koivu broke joints open, organised them by material and production processes, reassembled them into prototypes, and used them in real-world applications. For eight days, U-Joints featured 919 exhibits by 50 international designers and industry professionals. On show was everything from the most common joints to design’s most innovative ones, as well as those that have had the greatest influence on contemporary design and architecture.Encouraged by the exhibition’s success and the remarkable attention and endorsement it garnered, the team launched an extensive research challenge: a comprehensive review of the world’s joints and how they hold things together.Employing an inclusive and collective approach from the very beginning, the ongoing research is shared with the public through a series of exhibitions in which contemporary designers, researchers, institutions and critics are invited to share their work with joinery.Each show reads like the chapter of a book.In 2019, A taxonomy of nails, screws, rivets, bolts and nuts looked at basic fasteners and was held at Galerie l’elac of ECAL/University of Art and Design Lausanne in Switzerland.Next, Adhesives and Fusions will open to the public on 6 March 2021 at the Gewerbemuseum Winterthur. Further exhibitions are being planned.Finally, after almost three years of work, we are excited to launch our comprehensive book on the topic. U-Joints – A taxonomy of connections will come out in 2021.
U-JOINTS - A taxonomy of nails, screws, rivets, bolts and nuts exhibition, ECAL, Lausanne 2019 ©Calypso Mahieu 
U-JOINTS - A taxonomy of nails, screws, rivets, bolts and nuts exhibition, ECAL, Lausanne 2019 ©Calypso Mahieu 
U-JOINTS  the book
U-JOINTS – A taxonomy of connections is an encyclopedic publication that looks at human history through its details, and invites us to see our built environment in whole new ways.
Weighing in at more than 900 pages, this is the most far-reaching book ever published on the topic of joints. Comprehensive and interdisciplinary, the book features technical information about joinery as well as stories and commentaries. The heart of the book is a vast taxonomy of more than 1300 joints, organized into six main chapters: Basic fasteners, Mechanical joints, Knits and Knots, Wood joints, Adhesives, and Fused joints.
Each chapter traces the macrocosm of joinery. Together, they create a vast overview of the most common joints as well as insight into joinery’s unique solutions, historical and contemporary. Little known surprises and forgotten connecting methods abound.
Furthermore, the book features 80 essays and interviews, as well as 120 anecdotes. These share the often-unknown stories of joints, from how they were invented to their many inventive applications. The book also includes more than 1000 images, 240 illustrations and numerous patents. 15 new photographic works by young and upcoming photographers reframe the overlooked details for readers to discover.
The book was compiled by a team of more than 50 authors, photographers, illustrators, researchers, experts, scholars, scientists and story tellers, enthusiasts, users, designers, architects, artists, writers and critics, dreamers and makers. Together we hope to bring the many fascinating facets of joints to life.

More than 50 authors contributed essays and interviews with international architects, designers, artists, inventors, scholars, makers and users of well-designed products and architectures. 

The publication includes more than 80 in-depth articles on connections in design, architecture and art.Eleonora Castellarin is the mastermind behind the extensive Taxonomy.
Graphic Thought Facility created the straightforward and simple layout that presents an immensity of information effortlessly.
Contributors, subjects and authors include: AATB, Johanna Agermann Ross, Anni Albers, Florian Amoser, Ant Farm, Ron Arad, Archigram, Inés Ariza, ARUP, Clifford Ashley, Margherita Banchi, Anne Bates, Luca Becchetti, Elizabeth Bisley, Philippe Block, Raul Gonzales Bravo, Barbara Brondi, Franco Bulian, Gabriela Burkhalter, Marianne Burkhalter, Jacques Carelman, Marco Casino, Charlie Chaplin, Pierre Charpin, Brendan Cormier, Matthieu Cortat, Marco Costantini, Thomas Demand, Benjamin Dillenburger, Pierre Doze, Delphine Drouin-Prouvé, Norman Foster, Buckminster Fuller, Fabrizio Gallanti, Ilaria Giannetti, Fabio Gramzio, Susanne Graner, Sam Grawe, Maxime Guyon, Sebastian Hackenschmidt, James Hennessey, Yngve Holen, Clare Hunter, Dylan Iwakuni, Philippe Johnson, Hella Jongerius, Jane Joyce, Hettie Judah, Eliyahu Keller, Ruby Kitching, Matthias Kohler, Kengo Kuma, Shiro Kuramata, Tiffany Lambert, Mike Lane, Sergio Leone, Liam, Daisy and Dave, Miles Lewis, Vico Magistretti, Enzo Mari, Michael Marriott, Allegra Martin, Sally McGrane, Angus McGuyver, Alberto Meda, Leonardo Mosso, Marc Newson, Claes Oldenburg, Damian Ortega, Victor Papanek, Des Pawson, Gaetano Pesce, Tom F. Peters, Philippe Petit, Marta Pezzoli, Francesca Picchi, Mariana Popescu, Jean Prouvé, Piercarlo Quecchia, Marco Rainò, Peter Rice, Peter Lymburner Robertson, Richard Rogers, Nadja Rottner, Simone Sandahl, Delfino Sisto Legnani, Bruce Sterling, Oli Stratford, Deyan Sudjic, Christian Sumi, Superstudio, Skylar Tibbits, Margaret Tudor, Alice Twemlow, Jonas Villinger, Justinas Vilutis, Konrad Wachsmann, Hans Wegner, Yves Weinand, Richard Wiborg, Mark Whitby, Lebbeus Woods, Frank Lloyd Wright, Marco Zanuso, Peter Zumthor, and many more!
Each chapter constitutes a proposal: by looking at particular details, we can help you understand the constructed world a little better. As a result, this publication is many things: a manual in a workshop, an encyclopedic reference guide for scholars and design enthusiasts, as well as an indispensable resource for students of architecture and design. 
U-JOINTS press and comments
Paola Antonelli, senior curator, MoMA: "U-Joints has been my favorite stop in Design Week. Curated by Andrea Caputo and Anniina Koivu, it is an outstanding exhibition on joints and connections. It features an obsessive taxonomy and a thorough timeline. Unadulterated curatorial delight!”
Alice Rawsthorn, design expert: “You may never confuse a clamp with a coupling, or a dovetail with a rivet again.”
Alice Stori, design curator: “If you have to see one thing this Salone make it the U-Joints exhibition curated by Andrea Caputo and Anniina Koivu! Every designer and design student should bring their sketch book and get down to basics.”
Zoë Ryan, director of the Institute of Contemporary Art, University of Pennsylvania: “U-Joints […] examines a multitude of simply that – ways to join things together – through 50 designers’ experiments, prototypes and products. Great show.”
Disegno magazine: “Curators Andrea Caputo and Anniina Koivu are to be applauded. On paper, their pitch for U-Joins sounds dry and inaccessible: an exhibition examining a history of the joint and other connecting technologies within design. The results, however, are anything but. U-Joints is engrossing and animated, while nonetheless not shirking the inherent technicality and geekery of its subject matter; it manages the delicate balance of being both a real designer’s design exhibition, while also remaining of interest to a general audience.”
Modern Design Review: “U-Joints is not only one of the best shows of this year’s Salone, it’s one of the best shows to be presented at the Salone for a long time.”
