story:
In 2015 Jingle arrived at our house as a medical foster dog. He had been rescued with 11 other dogs from a dogfighting situation. The were given Christmas names and referred to as the Christmas Dogs - Jingle, Bells, St. Nick, Rudolph, Clarice, and Clarice's puppies Dasher, Dancer, Prancer, Vixen, Comet, Cupid, and Blitzen.  Jingle had severe anxiety when he arrived with us but with a lot of patience, many visits to the vet clinic, and lots of love, he blossomed into the sweetest dog you've ever met. 

I wrote a children's book about the time leading up to our finally adopting him. It's tentatively called Jingle All the Way - Home. To self publish and get the marketing I need for the full-color book, it's going to cost about $4000. Publishing alone will cost $2000+, Marketing - ~$1500, and $500 for Amazon listings and other features. 

I am retired and on a fixed income. I'd surely love some help getting the book off my computer before November. I would need to raise these funds by September to do that. 10% of any proceeds from the book will be donated to the Brandywine Valley SPCA who rescued Jingle from a life of fear and hurt. If I do not reach my goal I take the remaining funds out of my retirement account to publish.

The world needs to hear more successful pit bull stories. The breed is so maligned and fighting dogs are often automatically euthanized. Jingle has come so far; he's a totally different dog than the one we began to foster. The staff at the SPCA can't get over how he has become a confident, calm dog. I'd love to show kids and the adults who read them the book that pit bulls can be retrained and that fighters can become lovers.

Jingle and I would be over the moon to get this funded so the world will get a chance to meet this wonderful dog. His story needs to be told.

story:
Voices from Direct Provision

Voices from Direct Provision is a series of submissions the Abolish Direct Provision campaign has posted on social media since its foundation. 

For asylum seekers, ADP has provided a safe space for anonymous submissions, outlining the deplorable living conditions Direct Provision poses.

 The Voices from Direct Provision book will consist of these submissions, voicing the concerns of people stranded in the limbo that is DP.

The book will be broken down into three sections.

1. Introductions - a small intro to institutionalisation in Ireland; an overview of how ADPI was founded; narratives from a post-DP perspective

2. Voices from Direct Provision - a collection of written and audio submissions from asylum seekers spanning 2018-20; children's drawings about how DP makes them feel 

3. Responses - essays contributed by experts and artists in various fields, responding to topics raised in part 2; suggestions on ways to move forward and build a framework for a more functional, inclusive Irish society

Submission from a child in Direct Provision; Romaysa dreams of living in a house

 

Funding Breakdown:

Production: Printing and Binding Costs with Naas Printing Ltd - Tallav Books is keen to produce books that are printed and bound here in Ireland; all design work, proofreading fees and other associated production costs will also contribute to small, independent Irish artists and contributors. 

Abolish Direct Provision: All profits from book sales will go towards the ADP campaign. ADP organise events such as wellness retreats, feminist conferences and other empowerment events for asylum seekers. ADP also organises support funds such as Pregnancy and Maternity Kits which supply expectant families with the essentials required during pregnancy and when their newborn babies arrive.

All such events are decided by asylum seekers, so your purchase of this book means you're directly empowering asylum seekers to receive support in areas they deem most necessary.

 

Preview of a piece written by contributor Juliet Amamure:

Juliet is founder and managing director of Julie’s Kitchen. She is a development professional with cross-disciplinary experience in natural resources management and sustainable agriculture. She was a Social Entrepreneur Ireland awardee in 2009. Juliet has keen interest in global health and wellbeing, that promotes the health of vulnerable people especially those seeking internal protection. On refugee day in 2010, she received a refugee award for advocating and promoting health for women living in direct provision. In December 2019 Juliet was among the Abolish Direct Provision Ireland team to the United Nations’ Convention to Eliminate Racism and Discrimination (UN CERD) in Geneva, Switzerland. 

*

I have witnessed women, especially single women, being sexually exploited for €50. Old men picked them up and dropped them off again. Some people worked in the black market, cleaning toilets in pubs. They worked not on a salary, but on copper coins people dropped for them as tips. They had no option but to do work so that they can send money back to loved ones in their countries of origin and to subsidise the €19.10 per week.

*

Not all was beds of red roses; little did I know I was gradually breaking down mentally. My back developed sharp pain and I started losing my sleep. Sometimes I watched my kids sleep. Occasionally they woke up finding me sitting in the dark.  I resorted to drinking alcohol to accept what was going on in my life. Six years in limbo really took a toll on my mental health. To the extent that I got irritated so easily, I preferred being locked in prison to being in DP. 

On one occasion, after drinking in the middle of the night, I walked out of the Centre in my bikini. The security guard on duty called the guards on me. I thank God our guards in Ireland are not like those in the USA. They let me breathe inside the cell until psychiatric personnel came to assess me. A normal person cannot walk out of the Centre almost naked, but I did. 

*

I stopped community work, yet initially I worked as a volunteer researcher for AkiDwa, Social Policy Research Institute in UCD, and the National Women’s Council of Ireland. We provided catering services to many civil society organisations to raise money for Diaspora Women’s Initiative (DWI) health retreats. 

I completely disassociated myself from everyone. I lost all the connections I had built over time. I lost faith in what I believed in. Again, this mirrors deteriorating mental health. It was so hard and so inhumane; reporting with kids to Immigration once every month. This meant the kids missed out school each time I had to report. I had been put on deportation order for three years of my life. On reaching Immigration, I had to go to Counter Number One.  

I will never forget Counter Number One.  

*

Image of Juliet via Independent.ie, 28/11/2007

 

A little bit about Tallav Books:

Tallav is a new creative company based between Dingle, Co. Kerry and Dublin City. 

 'Tallav' which is a play on the irish 'talamh', means 'ground' in Irish; reflecting the company's ethos of helping create diverse, community based projects from the ground up. 

 

"Tallav is about providing a community where creators from any background feel supported and can have their voices amplified through a variety of mediums. The beauty of creating pieces through crowdfunding, is that the pledgers become part of that community."

- Fiadh, Founder

 

 

Voices from Direct Provision will be Tallav's first large-scale endeavour.

If you own a bookshop or other retail outlet and would like to stock the book, please send an email to tallavone@gmail.com and we'll sort you out with a trade-priced specific bundle!

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

We completely understand that not everyone is able to contribute financially, here is a list of some other ways you can help!

Follow @abolishdpireland and @tallav.collective on Instagram. Through these pages you'll be able to share posts and keep yourself, friends and family updated on the book's progress.

Share this campaign page on your social media. Sharing is such a simple and viable option for most people, so if you have a spare moment, please press the share link and tell your friends to check it out.

story:
Hayden Keyes knows everything there is to know about knights, legends, and fantasy, but that obviously doesn't mean he has ever jousted, worn a suit of armor, or flown on the back of a dimension-traveling griffin.

In fact, Hayden's life is pretty average. Well, that is up for you to decide. Hayden never met his real parents, though his foster ones are great. Sure, they have a hoarding problem and an irrational fear of Halloween costumes, but nobody's life is perfect, right? All Hayden wants is to fit in. And be the star of his middle school's basketball team. That would be nice.

But Hayden's life is about to turn all kinds of crazy. When a pumpkin-headed knight and a pair of hungry trolls posing as eighth graders show up at school, suddenly Hayden finds himself holding a one-way ticket to uncovering the mysteries of his past, facing a monstrously dangerous destiny, and the chance to return to his true home . . . BETWEEN, land of New Camelot, the Knights of the Round Table, and a world of magic Hayden never dreamed existed.

SAMPLE MY WRITING BY DOWNLOADING A FREE SHORT STORY AND PRELUDE TO THE SERIES! Pick it up HERE.

Hey there. My name is Stephen Clarke and I am the author of Hayden and the Knights: The Magic Hollow. Thanks for taking the time to look at my campaign. The Magic Hollow is a fantasy YA adventure, and its beta copies have already won the hearts of people of many ages! It features action, humor, a diverse cast, and heartwarming and exciting character arcs.

I wrote the first draft of this novel over ten years ago. Today, and five drafts later, it is ready to be published. MH Publishing is an indie publisher with a love for fantasy, science-fiction, and horror. Ultimately, we decided to publish my own novel as a pilot. We hope to continue to deliver wonderfully good fiction for years to come. Hopefully, this is only the beginning of the journey!

In some ways, you are not only backing this book, you are backing an independent publisher. We hope to be able to publish other authors' works in the coming years dependent on the success of our pilot series.

 

With flexible funding here on Indiegogo, we see this as an excellent way to prerelease The Magic Hollow, and offer a lot of awesome additional content! If you are new to crowdfunding, we will explain the basics of our campaign here!

If you would like to show support for The Magic Hollow and MH Publishing, you can pledge toward our funding goal. In return, you will be able to choose rewards from the list of perks. For the best deal, we recommend the featured perk, Knight of the Round Table. That said, there are even more perks waiting to be unlocked, so please look them over carefully.

If you aren't interested in purchasing a bundle and just want to snatch a copy of the book, select The Paige tier for an eBook or The Squire tier for a print edition. If you see one or two items you would like then you can choose that item from the list of available add-ons, after you choose the base perk.

Possible rewards include exclusive art prints, enamel pins, personalized numbered signed copies, acknowledgment in the book's credits, a one-on-one author video chat, custom artwork, and more.

While publishing a book is possible nowadays often at low cost, we knew we wanted to do more. Our ultimate goal is to create an independent publishing legacy that will go far beyond this series. We also want to produce beautiful, artisan-quality, earth-friendly books that will look great on the shelves of bookstores, right alongside books published by the big five.

This type of publishing is not cheap and requires a lot of funds up front. We hope that together we can make this dream a reality, and share The Magic Hollow with as many people as possible!

Other Ways to Help

Even if you can't contribute financially, if you believe in this project, you can still help spread the word! Ultimately, we want this book to get into the hands of as many readers before its worldwide release as possible. The more we can spread the word, the easier time we will have getting books on actual store shelves!

Please share our campaign with anyone you think would enjoy the story!

You can stay in touch with us on social media. Follow us on Instagram at magichollowbooks or Facebook at MagicHollowBooks.

 

Risks & Challenges

There are many expenses required up front to publish and print a book, especially in the coveted Hardcover format. You are pre-ordering a novel from an independent publisher, launching their first title. While we are confident in our ability to release a quality product on-time, there could always be complications in printing and distribution which could affect our ability to deliver on the timeline promised. There is also the possibility that we are unable to deliver Hardcover editions, and would have to do paperback instead. While we will do everything we can to ensure that doesn't happen, please be aware of the risk, due to the higher expense associated with printing hardcover novels. As a new author, you are likely not familiar with Stephen's writing style. Ultimately, we can't guarantee you will love the book, though we want to be as transparent as possible! For that reason we have made the prelude/short story available for free. Please read it if you are unsure of whether you will like this book or not. You can immediately unsubscribe from the newsletter required to get the download if you desire.

Take heart knowing that the book is already complete and currently in the final editing phases. We have received quotes and are in contact with a US-based printing company.

While we will do everything we can to ensure that doesn't happen, please be aware of the risk, due to the higher expense associated with printing hardcover novels. As a new author, you are likely not familiar with Stephen's writing style. Ultimately, we can't guarantee you will love the book, though we want to be as transparent as possible! For that reason we have made the prelude/short story available for free. Please read it if you are unsure of whether you will like this book or not. You can immediately unsubscribe from the newsletter required to get the download if you desire.
Take heart knowing that the book is already complete and currently in the final editing phases. We have received quotes and are in contact with a US-based printing company.

story:
Journalism is important and its defunding, which actually takes place at grassroots level, stifles and disrupts free speech and the public access to alternative and often vital news. Have you heard about Dana Rivers? Most of you reading this haven’t. Yet women have been asking why this story has gone ignored by major and independent media. You are directly affected by this because if you are only hearing one message from large organisations with an agenda, you will not be aware of alternative viewpoints or stories that have been buried by propaganda. You will be uninformed. Supporting grass roots journalism ensures that a variety of views can be expressed, considered and evaluated. That is the basis of a free speech democracy which you and the generations to come need to thrive.

Background to Launching "Disappearing Acts"

I am Julian Vigo, an anthropologist, writer, filmmaker and editor of Savage Minds. I came into journalism after a career in academia. In 2010 I left academia and went to Haiti to conduct an ethnographic-journalistic project on child trafficking to include an analysis of the problems within the NGO and UN model which professionalised older colonial ideologies and professions, shifting them from “viceroy” to “humanitarian worker.” Meanwhile, these humanitarian disasters were pretty much all manmade with human trafficking being as much a byproduct of "humanitarian work" as much it was a product of its orbiting politics and not a coincidental manifestation. Still, there was no media coverage critical of the NGO and UN presence very much acting as a colonial power in the country as it had for decades before. This experience informed my approach to journalism.

First, I learned that news subjects coverage were dependent upon the political tendency of the publication. It rarely matters what the facts are—it matters what readers want, even if that means to serve up a dish of fake news. I also had to learn quickly which types of stories I could pitch to left-leaning papers. For instance, in my early work on gender identity politics, I wrote for one of the few left-of-centre publications that would touch this subject. No other papers on the left would go near this subject. Soon after, however, even that publication told me they couldn't run these stories given that they were invariably met by an onslaught of hate mail. 

Second—and the main driver of this fundraiser—is that in my shift to journalism I found that this field operates as a pyramid scheme in terms of which writers receive payment for their work while the rest are expected to write for free. Recently, I pitched a story to a new publication in the UK and was told that this publication doesn’t pay “general freelance contributors.” Imagine telling mechanics that they won’t be paid for their work! You would be left with an idle vehicle. Journalism is work. My first piece on the gender debate from 2013, “The Left Hand of Darkness,” involved months of research, interviews, and fact-checking. I was not paid for this and many other articles since I was employed at the time and I felt committed to not usurp the few resources directed at full-time writers. Now that I am a full-time writer and editor, getting paid isn't an option and like other writers, I feel that our profession deserves a liveable wage. It is time that everyone contribute to ethical labour practices and chip in where and when we can and commit to supporting independent journalism. (Here is where I am tempted to pull out a picture of my two children ages five and eight. They're extremely cute.)

There is a political undercurrent within publishing that affects which news items are deemed “fit to print” and which stories are completely ignored. Just review the media surrounding convicted murderer Dana Rivers or his trial. The fact is that most media did not cover this story at all. Where women are concerned it is often the case that right-of-centre news media will more likely cover these stories whereas the left-leaning media is fully entrenched in identity politics that mostly eschews—and even derides—sex specificity. Where female staff journalists are being paid less than their male cohorts we see that equal pay is more often a concept than it is an exercise. In the world of freelance journalism, however, getting paid at all is a struggle as publications are answering their readers's demands. With the surge of online new media since 2000, readers have been trained to consume divisively-postured news stories, purely capitalism-driven infomercials and listicles on "free" websites—Forbes, Newsweek, the BBC, and other major media outlets, hence this is what the reader's clamour for. All this translates to few journalistic pieces being commissioned about women, the poor or the murderer of a lesbian couple and their child.

This self-fulfilling news cycle is straight out of Manufacturing Consent (1988) by Edward Herman and Noam Chomsky which exposes the "propaganda model "of American media and how the press “manufactures” public unity by ensuring that is is exposed to a narrow median body of political ideas, usually in line with political partisanship. Even many independent media outlets are being driven down by neoliberal ideology as unspoken rules are adopted whereby the roots of gender ideology must not be investigated, covering right-wing protests is forbidden, and asking questions about the origins of COVID-19 is verboten. Today the news is more about cheerleading partisan opinion than investigating and fact-checking news events. This is where disaster capitalism has been fully embraced by news organisations that ought to be pushing back and covering these and other uncomfortable stories. 

We are launching "Disappearing Acts" to return to ethical journalism while covering those stories long-ignored or entirely misrepresented. 

Summary of "Disappearing Acts"

“Disappearing Acts” is a series produced by Savage Minds whose focus is on investigative journalism, ethnography and video related to various types of disappearance. The title of this series refers to the portion of magician performances where invariably a woman is made to disappear inside of a box or behind a curtain. The disappearances highlighted in our series will focus on various types of vanishing acts from the fading of material reality in public discourse to the disappearance of fact-based reporting within media today to the cover image of this campaign taken from my research on child trafficking.

Where the news media has shifted from telling the stories of events on the ground to focussing on opinion stories and running infomercials for big business as "news items," the links between the physical disappearances of human life to the disappearance of objective journalism are not coincidental. From the disappearance of the word "woman" to the newly formed journalistic ethos enshrined into journalist union guidelines which requires that all material reality be abandoned in favour of ideology, we find a common thread in these seemingly disparate disappearances that form part of an intricate journey where media, corporations, NGOs, Big Tech and Big Pharma are collectively complicit in undermining language and objectivity while advancing neoliberal identities for the subject to embrace.

Commercial media strategy today operates within the framework of the rinse and repeat of manufactured news intended to divide along class and party lines. The poor and lower-middle-classes are barely an afterthought in major media coverage today as these voices have long been wiped off of the 24-hour news cycle. Conterminous to the disappearance of fact-based reporting is the manufacturing and curation of various debates by Big Tech today that advance ephemeral identity politics. In an era where sensationalisation and polarisation of the news go hand in hand, many independent media also falls into this pattern of writing up the latest "angry op-ed" that will trigger readers' latest resentment ending in a stream of revenue-earning clicks. Sadly, the news model today relies upon activating an ever-angry readership who then turn to social media to share "outrage stories" resulting in more clicks despite the fabricated nature of these news stories. Who wants to read about Nile water flowing downstream of Ethiopia's GERD when we can get angry about a pronoun "misuse"?

Media research has shown that much of mainstream news outlets are caught up in spreading misinformation in large part due to how news media is funded as "sponsored stories" have become one of the models for financing larger media operations where outlets like Forbes runs a publication catering to its commercial clients by using its "journalistic" cover to provide six-digit funded webspace to companies looking for top-billed advertising. The description for this service Forbes describes on its site, "Connoisseur provides brands with a direct link to the Forbes audience showcasing everything luxury. This is our artful form of custom storytelling presented in the most visually-stunning and prestigious content formats." Forbes like other major media regularly produces fake news that is sold as objective reporting. CNN also engages in this practice under the moniker of a "brand solutions" and "special reports," running the line between infomercial dressed up as investigative journalism while acting out the full-fledged promotion of a brand. No better example of the power of this lobby could be seen than during lockdown where both media outlets haemorrhaged story after story on vacation travel.

"Disappearing Acts" is intended to be a permanent series within Savage Minds examining the various historical and present-day problems of how news stories are covered to include the disappearance of on the ground objective reporting along with the rise of infomercials-as-news stories for the multi-national corporations that can pay the prices that major media commands. As many journalists around the planet reporting the news are still suffering the effects of the HuffPost-era erosion of their salaries and profession and readers have been simultaneously trained to accept "outrage articles" and listicles as "news," our series will engage reporters on-the-ground to report the news while giving readers information instead of prescriptions for living.

To launch "Disappearing Acts," Savage Minds needs to raise the funds necessary to pay journalists. After a series of discussions with various journalists around the world, the consensus overwhelmingly supports the need to return to bare bones journalism where questions are asked, subjects are interviewed, facts are checked and all sides of the stories covered. Producing ethical news stories requires paying writers and editors a living wage. Savage Minds is asking those who are invested in returning to grassroots journalism to support this series.

Some of the topics "Disappearing Acts" will cover include, but are not limited to:

-the disappearance of women and girls and the conterminous rise of Big Pharma

-the disappeared bodies of human trafficking

-the lobbies promoting the disappearance of free speech

-the disappearance of science & the promotion of legal fictions (identity politics)

-Big Tech's containment of the news through social media censorship

-the disappearance of objective news media in the age of sponsored news stories

"Disappearing Acts” will follow these and other subjects through the analyses of events and the inclusion of interviews, expert voices and meta-analyses.

We must connect the dots between major media's non-stop laudatory coverage of Bill Gates during the pandemic while the creators of the Great Barrington Declaration have been painted as "unhinged" science deniers. "Disappearing Acts" will hold major media and Big Tech accountable as to why the origins of COVID-19 are now being revised retroactively by news outlets and why social media giants are stifling discussion about this issue. In an era where political and scientific query necessitates coverage, dialectic and information from all sides, it is clear that major news outlets are operating as propaganda platforms with no due diligence to truth while disappearing what they deem to be oppositional voices and the lives of the disenfranchised.

Please help fund “Disappearing Acts” so that we can expand our news coverage to fact-based reporting while paying journalists on the ground for their labour.

What We Need

Your economic support of "Disappearing Acts" will mean that writers can come onboard to Savage Minds ready to do ground-breaking research in their area of expertise and make visible the once invisible. Here is what we need from you:

  • We are raising €20,000 which will provide enough money to pay professional writers, editors and videographers.
  • If you can't donate today, please share this Indiegogo crowdfunding wildly. 
  • If you are a marketing expert, help! We were not born with that clownfish gene that allows us to be cis-marketing experts. Throw us a bone!
  • If we fall short of the €20,000 we will still move forward as planned and get as many writers to pitch and submit stories while we continue to fundraise. 
  • Read Savage Minds where "Disappearing Acts" will be housed.

 

​What You Get

"Disappearing Acts" will allow our supporters to have greater input into story topics, development, podcast guest suggestions, and the production of short videos. Depending on your chosen "perk," here's some of what you can get in return for supporting "Disappearing Acts":

  • Suggest topics of investigation for articles, podcasts and videos.
  • Access to video content and a subscription to "Disappearing Acts."
  • Participate in the research of an article or video within the "Disappearing Acts" series.
  • Participate in the production of one of the project's videos.
  • You will have input on the post-production facets of a video.

We expect this project to make an impact on readers and to signal much-needed changes to the professionalism of journalism and its adjacent outrage spin machine, social media. We specifically direct this to all editors who are paid while while expecting the journalists writing for them to go unpaid. Here is what we hope comes out of this fundraiser after the financial investment in our project:

  • That readers are aware that if a publication they are supporting is not paying its journalists, that they need to stop supporting what are exploitative labour practices;
  • That publications and editors stop exploiting professional journalists and offer fair rates of pay;
  • That non-professional writers are aware when they submit their work for free, that they might consider doing so to publications that pay their journalists;
  • That more people stop uniquely consuming free media. Mix up your reading/viewing with independent media that offers different perspectives and investigations;
  • That people consider taking out subscriptions to different online news sites. It is only through abandoning mainstream media that these outlets will get a clear and loud message that people are uninterested in the "hidden costs of owning a superyacht" or being subjected to never-ending cycles of Russiagate stories;
  • Improved mental health. We're not kidding. 
     

Risks & Challenges

Potential risks are sometimes posed to the safety of the sources who describe their situations, to those journalists reporting on the ground and the many contributors who lend information to the projects. Retaliation is not uncommon. When necessary real names will not be used and even precise location names not mentioned for the safety of those living in tiny rural areas. For the security of journalists and researchers, they will follow the standard protocol for understanding the dangers and estimating when to withdraw from a project or to anonymise informants' details.

Other Ways You Can Help

Given that the aim is to support full-time journalists who contribute to Savage Minds, this isn't a luxury fundraiser—we are a bare-bones operation. We understand that it's been a rough year plus for many so even if you can't donate today, please do spread the word about what we are doing here. The core message of this fundraiser is that people begin to understand the direct links between how journalism is funded and why certain stories are not being covered (eg. the disappearance of women and the word “woman”) in mainstream media while other news items are covered (eg. the news this week that the COVID-19 vaccines don’t affect sperm count). Great news for sperm, bad news for women. 

So if you are hurting economically as so many are in this era of a global pandemic, there are other ways to support "Disappearing Voices." First, sign up for Savage Minds free subscriptions. Most of what we publish is free. Second, please share our articles and podcast episodes on social media. Lastly, there are many other excellent independent publications out there that need funding and that are doing excellent work. Give them your support and shares as well!

The bottom line is that we need to shift those .35 cents a day we used to spend on a newspaper from a few decades ago into real-time currency which—even at 1990 rates—translates to just over €10 a month. We must join the dots between major media serving up half-truths, their corporate partners and the "sponsored stories" (infomercials) and the downgrading of journalism as a professional practice by blurring the line between reporting, personal empowerment and a mirror.

Let's push together to create a more ethical news series where writers are paid, news coverage is not fabricated and objectivity is brought back into journalism.

story:
We're Christian and Kristen, the creators of Vaginas and Periods 101: A Pop-Up Book! Vaginas and Periods 101: A Pop-Up Book is a fun and creative way to learn more about…vaginas and periods! The book uses pop-ups to explain anatomy and ovulation,, colorful graphics to normalize anatomy aesthetics and cervical mucous, and describes various menstrual product options. We know not only girls/women menstruate so we’ve been very intentional to not use pronouns in the book and to include non-binary characters.. As licensed mental health therapists and sex educators, we teach a lot of young people and we saw a need to normalize menstruation and could't believe this book didn't already exist! We want young people to feel comfortable in their bodies throughout puberty and into adulthood.

What We Need

The book itself is a nine page spread concertina fold pop-up, including two pop-up spreads which will be 8"x8" case bound filled with characters to help the reader learn. The first pop-up is a 3-D vulva spread to explain basic external anatomy. Next is an interactive wheel used to illustrate the menstrual cycle complete with a lift-the-flap mini book. The following pages are dedicated to introducing various menstrual products and how to use them. The book ends with normalizing cervical mucous and the appearance of vulvas. Bonus page includes sex ed resources for both adults and youth! On top of production and assembly, we are required by the printing company to do a minimum run of books. Help us bring this book to life with our goal of $10,000! 

Why us?

Well...Kristen Lilla is not only a licensed clinical social worker, but is Nebraska's only AASECT Certified Sex Therapist and AASECT Certified Sexuality Educator. In addition to numerous leadership roles, Kristen is an international speaker, has been published, and co-chaired the 2017 National Sex Education Conference (kristenlilla.com). Christian Hoeger is a licensed mental health practitioner in private practice. Christian has spoken at conferences nationwide and has also been published (voiceofhopecounseling.com). The two of us met at Girls Inc. of Omaha in 2013 where we counsel girls ages 5-18 and teach sex education. Years ago, we joked that having a pop-up book would make teaching more fun and accessible, and when we realized this book didn't already exist, we created a partnership, Sex Ed Talk LLC (sexedtalk.com), and the Vagina Pop-Up book was born! We love teaching sex ed at Girls Inc. in Omaha and would be thrilled if you inspired girls at other Girls Inc. affiliates to be strong, smart, and bold through the buy a book + give a book.

Our artist Sara M. Lyons is a product designer and and illustrator based out of Anaheim, CA. She's done murals and projects for companies such as Urban Decay and Ebay and has over 70,000 followers on Instagram. We discovered her work through local Omaha boutique Hello Holiday and we knew her style was perfect for the book. We are beyond excited she agreed to collaborate with us (saramlyons.com). 

Risks & Challenges

We have been working over the last year with artist Sara M. Lyons and pop-up engineers The Papersmyths. We have all the emotional support we need, we just need the financial backing to bring this project to life. Foreseeable risks and challenges include not raising the funds needed, and potential delays in printing and distribution.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share the link on social media! Follow us on Instagram and Twitter @vaginapopup and on FB @Vaginas and Periods 101: A Pop-Up Book!

As Seen In (and heard on)...

story:
Chapter 1 of When God Was a Boy

Full length interview with the author, C. T. Giles

The Story Behind the Story

The New Testament tells us about the Birth of Jesus, a sparse amount about His infancy, one single episode when He's 12 years old, and then the Gospel accounts don't resume the narrative until He's thirty. Have you ever wondered about His boyhood years? I have spent half a lifetime obsessed with this curiosity.

Last year, one image, a single scene, overtook my entire imagination. I saw Joseph walk into his workshop to the surprise of finding Jesus distraught, His eyes transfixed on the timber before Him. That reverie would not leave me alone for weeks. So, I wrote it out, sent it to some friends and family, and awaited their collective response. Their replies prompted that short story growing into a book.

Writing this novel was like an 18 month practice in prayerful meditation, attempting to experience through my heart and mind the places where He grew up and the people He encountered. During the process, I became very familiar with Joseph. He taught me a great deal about the Father's heart.

What We Need & What You Get

On January 6th, 2020 we concluded a *successful* Kickstarter campaign, achieving 137% of our initial goal. This has become a great boon to our launch of the novel. Presently, we are already funded to produce an exquisite hardback, a fully edited e-book, as well as a top-notch Audiobook!
Backers of the campaign from here on out can take delight in knowing that their contribution will secure their own selections as soon as the publications and productions have been completed. Additionally, backers who opt for the hardback receive a signed copy. What's more, you're continuing to help us get the word out. Feedback from beta-readers has been wildly enthusiastic. We expect great things from the work of this story once it's released out into the world. Your support gets us there all the sooner.

The Impact

Readers find themselves immersed in the joys as well as the perils of 1st century Israel. Imagining familiar characters in their authentic cultural context catalyzes the reader's understanding and appreciation for many of the more cryptic passages from the Gospel accounts. Even after dozens of engagements with the manuscript, we are still batting a thousand for its having a positive impact and enjoyable experience each and every time.

What the beta-readers are saying

"We read aloud When God Was a Boy as a family. When I say it has been a beautiful guide and companion to our family, imagining what it might have been like in 1st century Nazareth, watching Jesus come of age, I'm only scratching the surface. We have laughed and cried through this book, been brought into quiet and worshipful spaces in every chapter, and only wanted to read more at every turn. This was an instant classic in our home, that we will return to annually, no doubt about it!"

- Raynna Myers : mom of six, writer, blogger, photographer, Qi Gong Instructor

 

"I just finished chapter 3, choking back tears, not wanting to embarrass myself, as I have been transported from the cabin into a first century synagogue in Nazareth. I am graciously, respectfully, joyfully stunned! Center stage, the author has, all at once - against an authentic ancient near eastern Jewish backdrop - captured the shrewd brilliance of Jesus and his unceasing compassion; the heart of the God behind the Law; and the necessity of properly translating scripture against the metanarrative of the Sacred Text. Encircling the central drama of the chapter, the author has painted a picture of humanity, bringing to life, real people in a real place at a real time in history with real relationships - neighbors, a husband and a wife, parents and children..."

- Monica Warren: writer, speaker, triathlete, blogger @ Hijacked Jesus 

 

"Have you ever taken a left hook to the liver? It is the kind of shot that sticks with you, having the uncanny ability to shock you and then leave you paralyzed. From an emotional perspective, that was my experience with this book. I found myself consistently staying up way too late (at the dismay of my work the next day) just reading and re-reading chapters. I'm not sure I knew how little I had imagined beforehand - what it meant for the Messiah to come of age. Reading this book has brought the Bible, previously lost on my context, to new life by the imagination of the author.  I've laughed, yelled, and cried reading this book. It is well worth knowing this story for yourself."

-Marshall Shank: Director of Outreach, Proven Men Ministries 

 

"I know the author and find the depth of his thinking refreshing! While not specifically Catholic, <the story> reminds me a bit of my 'connect the dots' exegesis."

-Monsignor M. Dennis McCarron, St. Thomas More Catholic Church

Risks & Challenges

Having already surpassed our initial goal through Kickstarter, the risk factor has been greatly diminished. The editorial team has been commissioned and the work is underway. Remaining risks lie in the design and presentation as it is always a challenge to find the sweet spot between content and cover appearance. But we're not going to cut any corners. This work is sacred to us and we will continue to give it all diligence and aesthetic consideration.

Other Ways You Can Help

Would you share this campaign with your friends, family, colleagues, favorite pets, baristas at the coffee shop, domestic potentates and tyrants in far away lands? We'd hack satellites to communicate with potential E.T. lifeforms if that were an option. Truly, your social media shares go a long way in giving us a broader outreach beyond our own means. Chapter 1 has been visited by DOZENS of countries all thanks to the willingness of good people like yourselves in getting the word out. Countries from all over Europe, Asia and South America have left an IP address trace, plus Israel, Croatia, Namibia, India, Australia as examples of unexpected and astounding visitors. These are places that we would never have reached by ourselves.

Share the campaign, would you?

story:
A year ago, the otherworld fantasy romance Fine Print began serialized publication on Fimfiction. Now that story has reached its end. After receiving numerous requests from readers, I’ve made the appropriate arrangements to produce my fifth independently published book.

What We Need & What You Get

The purpose of this campaign is to fund a small print run and publication of Fine Print. The book will be a glossy 6”x 9” hardcover with approximately 460 full color pages. The book will include over 50 illustrations from artists all over the fandom, such as Acesential (who is also doing the cover!), Viwrapstur, DiscordGE, Rutkotka, Pony-way, Lunebat, Lines, Julunis, Xbi, and more!

It will also include a 10,000 word extended epilogue, never to be published anywhere else, which will show more of Spark Gap’s life with Rose after making his decision at the end of the book. It may have a small number of not-before-seen illustrations, but most of the images present in the book will be high resolution prints of those already shown on Fimfiction.

Printing a book has certain physical constraints, and I want the hardcover to match the quality of the story it will contain. The printer requires a minimum run-size of 50 books, so that is the number we’ll have to hit to be successful (and is where the campaign goal comes from). For those who wish to support the author, you can also opt to order a signed and numbered edition for a few bucks more.

Those who want copies of any of the previous books I’ve printed will also be able to select them as add-on perks, since the printer will be able to make a few more with this order if we reach our goal. Those are Last Pony on Earth, Through the Aurora, and Message in a Bottle. Simply select them as add-ons while placing the order. Orders of multiple books will have reduced shipping costs, but must be going to the same destination address.

Those who wish to donate a little extra to support the author can also make a chapter suggestion with their order. However, like the Last Pony on Earth project, Fine Print was made to stand on its own, and I can’t make random additions that would weaken the story. As such, these extra chapter suggestions would only be included in the print if both I and the original commissioner agreed that they would benefit the plot. If not, they’d be posted to Fimfiction only.

Risks & Challenges

We cannot print fewer than fifty books, which makes this the minimum size for the campaign to be successful. If we do not reach this goal, Fine Print cannot be made, so everyone will be refunded.

Also, it’s important to remember that COVID is resurging across the world. This may impact international shipping times, and delay printing unexpectedly. Nevertheless, we were able to get Through the Aurora made and shipped to all backers during the height of the pandemic last year, so I have no doubt we’ll be able to get these books out too.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute? That's fine! Obviously I'm not printing this story for the money--it's all about getting something awesome out in print. I don't expect anyone who isn't interested in hardcover books to order.

If you'd like to help but you don't want the book, feel free to share this campaign with anyone you think might be interested. Like anything in publication, this project gets easier the larger the volume of books we're printing. And if you'd just like to check out the story but for some reason you haven't yet, you can read it here for free.

story:
Short Summary of Adromanus

Hi, My name is David. 

I’d like to introduce you to a timely and insightful book I wrote over the past few years. Adromanus is a “living book” containing codes and DNA activations within its pages. The book  holds deep insights into the awakening process, helping to guide us into a new paradigm.

Adromanus, reveals my inner calling to embark on a shamanic journey to the four corners of the southwestern US. Throughout the pages of the book, I face many challenges from the death of a loved one to the death of my spiritual ego and identity. This is my attempt to share the unraveling of my lifetime of systemic cultural fear and how I find ways to allow and create relationships with the elemental cycles to help heal those wounded parts of me.

In the deep of winter, in a cabin in Dover, Vermont, I come to realize how childhood trauma  handicapped my life through an unconscious fight or flight response that I just couldn't seem to let go of. I was a wounded healer! What ends up coming through, as a byproduct of my calling, is my own humanness. The shell of my pre-programmed cultural construct gets stripped away, leaving what’s left of me grieving with the waters of Taos, New Mexico.

As I pick myself up and dry my tears, my body begins the healing process and I tentatively begin to let go. There is a greater calling beyond my own awakening and it is steeped in the mysterious and shamanic world of the southwest desert. With no identity to prop me up, and no home to return to, I rely solely on my intuition to guide me. 

My journey includes opening numerous energetic gateways that facilitate the birth of a new paradigm. I’m called to open these gateways using the sound of my voice and drum, as I have been trained to do. The 5D vibration I channel ultimately changes me forever. The feminine archetype of “Isis” reminds me that my mind has no place here as my true nature unfurls. 

After many months of journeying, it is time for me to go home. None of what I experienced means anything unless I find a way to embody and keep the vibration grounded and real. This is super challenging as I observe the planet I live on and find it difficult to keep my feet in both worlds. My friends can't understand what I've been through, mostly because I lack the language to convey my experience. Within a few months, I start working in a homeless shelter, and this  becomes the healing balm I am searching for. My mantra becomes, “I am a helper,” as I have no spiritual ego and no judgment to project. I know that every human is deserving of love.

I finally begin to understand the process of embodying the love vibration. I learn to continually take the leap into the uncomfortable unknown, and keep reminding myself to embrace the feeling states of gratitude and compassion whenever I stumble and fall. 

I wrote this book because I was destined to. I hope and pray that the words in these pages will give comfort and solace to those who wish to go beyond the world of limited beliefs in order to create a reality of abundance that serves a higher purpose for themselves and everyone they are in contact with.

 

Gratitude

I want to share and express my gratitude to all the humans and non-humans who have supported me throughout the process of bringing Adromanus to life. 

A special thank you and acknowledgment goes out to my hard-working team of souls below: 

Brooke Woodside, my dear friend and Editor. Brooke has been such a positive influence and loving supportive force throughout this whole process. Brooke’s diligent and seemingly endless work of hands-on editing gets a special, heartfelt “Thank you!” I am forever grateful.

Liz Solomon has become a dear friend along this journey. Her deep insights, unique perspective and editorial experience was an integral necessity throughout this process. Her seemingly effortless way of being in the world has lovingly steered the direction of my writings. 

Sam Brown, for allowing me to use his fantastic intuitive artwork for the cover. His additional illustrations in the book have truly brought my writings to life. 

Larry Kuhn, my big brother, for printing the first edition. What a blessing!

Thank you so much for your consideration and support of this meaningful endeavor.

With gratitude,

David Kuhn

Check out the sample!



Life is what they make it—even if it’s already dead.

Despite their common interests in the fictional and fantastical, Edgar and Lucretcia are two long-time friends who can’t seem to agree on much when it comes to the question: Is real life too dull?

It just so happens, they don’t have to come to an agreement—at least not on their own.
A typical afterschool gaming session with their buddies in the EIDOLON tabletop role-playing club, takes a turn for the grave in a roll of the dice. The stakes go from practically nothing to unimaginably high when the six friends are bafflingly imbued with their fictional characters’ magick and abilities. And if that weren’t enough to turn their minds’ inside-out and worlds’ upside-down, Yaldovrath, a lich from their Gateways: Swords & Sorcery campaign traverses the impossible gulf between their fantasy world and reality, and he’s got a major bone to pick. To make matters worse, he’s being abetted by allies in both worlds: a sinister death cult and an imprisoned eldritch monstrosity.

As Yaldovrath’s tide of undead soldiers rises in the heart of the shining capital metropolis of Ephialtes, EIDOLON and company have to get their act together if they want to survive, let alone figure out the mystery at the heart of these unfortunate events to put a stop to it—if that’s truly what they want to do.

 

No special editions, no fluff. Just a straight-up light novel.

  • 6x9 paperback novel
  • Illustrated with manga-style artwork à la Japanese light novels
  • Color illustrations and content in front and back matters, grayscale story illustrations
  • Roughly 200,000 words, (okay, so, it's a not-quite-'light' novel)
  • 90-95% complete as of campaign creation; expecting first print run in August 2021

 

Dark Fantasy, Reverse Isekai, TRPG & 2-D Culture Aesthetic

If you appreciate High Fantasy, Dark Fantasy, Grimdark, Horror, and/or Urban Fantasy, there’s a good chance this series is up your alley. On top of that, if you have an affinity for 2-D culture—anime, manga, light novels, isekais, and their relevant aesthetics—there’s an decent chance you’ll love it. Moreover, if you like all that and you’re someone who plays TRPGs, or even just enjoys them for their rich lore and worldbuilding, you'll be drooling over Hex | End.

And what if you don’t particularly care for any of those things, but you do enjoy fresh, solid fantasy fiction that takes time to explore difficult-to-articulate themes through characters who jump off the page? Look no further.

If you’re a “professional sensitivity reader”, go pluck your wedgie someplace else. Hex | End doesn’t go out of its way to offend anyone, but it will never walk on eggshells or cave to political correctness.

And Hex | End will never be sold to a certain mouse corporation. The author highly values maintaining creative integrity and control of the official canon. Fan works will definitely be welcomed, and maybe even canonized à la a certain "Expanded Universe", but this world will never be co-opted and radically altered/inverted to sell ten billion plushies of a certain green alien baby. 

More than ever, independent creators without ties to corrupt cultural institutions are important and need support. Seemingly every form of Western media now exists only to inculcate people with a certain religion-like political ideology, and that’s a shame. Going forward, you’ll increasingly see quality works coming almost exclusively from independent creators. What makes literature great is not its potential utility to spread propaganda, but because it’s a way to communicate timeless, universal themes that everyone could appreciate regardless of anything but their common humanity.

The worldbuilding for Hex | End has been exciting and challenging thus far. The multiverse of the story is massive in scope and the vision for its future is even bigger. As more installments are added in the future, (contingent on the success of this first installment), more and more content will be added in hopes this world will become a place where people will want to spend their time, whether it’s simply in one's imagination, or playing as a character of their own in an as-of-yet undeveloped TRPG, or enjoying other forms of multimedia Hex | End could potentially find itself in in the future.

One last note, (and thanks for bearing with this long exposition). This series doesn’t have a hard, fixed publishing-industry standard target age. Though it will likely appeal to a certain age range more than another, it’s not written with that pigeon-holing mentality. There are younger characters and older characters, so there’s something for everyone, but bear in mind there is an advised level of maturity printed on the book’s back cover for parents to reference, and that’s ages 16 and up.

There's a Hex | End Discord server, and you're welcome to join! You can even stay—provided you follow the rules and don't cause trouble. #general-chat is really topic-less, so feel free to just hang out and make friends there.

story:
We are a small but determined group of individuals who are passionate about the culture and heritage travel opportunities in Texas. Our company is owned by, and supports, seven non-profits that implement regionally-based heritage tourism efforts. Our first endeavor, Authentic Texas magazine, launched in 2016. This quarterly publication allows us to share stories about the authentic people, places and things that make the Lone Star State unique. As with many businesses, we are regrouping following the Covid-19 pandemic. Limitations during 2020 makes us eager to expand our offerings into the audiovisual and product arenas. 

Our initial goal is $25,000; however, we'd be thrilled to secure six times that amount!

Your help and financial support will 

  • enable us to fully commit to our Fall and Winter issues as our advertising base is still rebuilding and we are not yet confident the ad revenue volume will fully support publication costs;
  • underwrite the loss of subscriber revenue based on the decision to extend all subscriptions by two issues to offset last year’s interruption in production;
  • commission the digitizing of articles and material from our first eight issues; and
  • provide the means for us to confidently launch an “Authentic Texas” online marketplace.

 

For some, the greatest reward is being part of a bigger team helping us to continue producing content showcasing the authentic people, places and things about the Lone Star State. However, we've put together a variety of rewards - known as "perks"- that correlate with contribution amounts.

Some of the perks are designed for those interested in exploring, experiencing or learning more about Texas.

Other perks are for advertisers.

Perhaps you'd consider giving an advertising perk to help your favorite museum, a local attraction or a unique local business that could use some post-Pandemic marketing help!

General guidance on our perks follows:

  • The two-year print and digital subscriptions will begin September 1, 2022 (for our Fall '21 issue).
  • Advertising packages must be used by the end of 2022.
    • Print and digital ads are to be used in the Fall '21, Winter '21, Spring '22, Summer '22, Fall '22 and/or Winter '22 issues.
    • E-newsletter ads are to be used September '21 through December '22.
       

What difference does Authentic Texas make?

Authentic Texas

  • supports the work of seven nonprofit organizations that work with museums, historic sites, educators, preservationists, chambers of commerce, economic development programs, and governmental entities on behalf of heritage tourism. 
  • ​provides a voice for the untold and undertold stories of this great land and it introduces individuals who are passionate about a topic or a place to a larger audience.
  • is the only publication of its kind in Texas dedicated to highlighting the state's multi-faceted history, its various cultural influences and showcasing dynamic preservation efforts. Every story must relate to a place the general public can visit and must relate to the culture and heritage of Texas.
  • is readily available to travelers who are visiting Texas, moving to Texas or exploring Texas. For those who are visiting or are new to the state, this publication is an introduction to the those things that are uniquely Texan. For the born-and-raised or long-time Texan, Authentic Texas scratches the itch for knowing more about a subject or place.
     

​

The Winter 2020 video promo; this issue featured the colonization to and immigration to Texas.
 

Our team is made up of business leaders and tourism professionals who represent seven regional non-profit organizations; their mission is to help develop and promote heritage tourism within their region. They showcase the people, places and history within their region that make it unique and make it desirable to visit and enjoy whether you are on leisure travel, business trips or simply experiencing a “staycation” in your own back yard!  That is what we call “heritage tourism.” 

To fully comprehend this great State of Texas you must be able to experience the places, activities, artifacts, food, and festivities that authentically represent the stories and people of the past and present.  Our offerings make that possible by showcasing these special things across the state.  Every issue become a resource and a reference document and/or serves as the impetus to spur someone to action to finally make that trip they’ve been talking about forever.

Seeking sustainability, in 2016 our group of nonprofits created a business and launched a quarterly magazine highlighting the heritage and culture of Texas. Issues have been crafted around an assortment of themes and a wide variety of folks have graced the cover. Our volunteer team provided the direction, handled the day-to-day operations and managed social media efforts; we contracted with professionals for specific skills and abilities. 
 

The magazine is available 

  • for free at state historic sites, numerous visitor centers, museums, and every Texas Travel Information Center;
  • by subscription (print and digital); and
  • in retail outlets such as Barnes & Noble Bookstores and HEB and United grocery stores.

As ad revenue grew, so did the number of subscribers and distribution points. In 2019, our volunteer CEO made the leap of faith to become the first salaried employee and several functions that had been outsourced were brought in-house.

Then, the pandemic hit. 

We quickly strengthened our on-line presence by creating a totally new digital platform and improved our ability to continue offering stories and material to our subscribers as well as the general public.

However, since most of our advertisers are travel and tourism-related, our revenue dropped by more than half. And, in a bitter twist of fate, as a business owned equally by seven non-profits, we did not qualify for any state or federal economic relief.

In 2020 we were able to print only two of our four issues; this year we just recently printed a combined Spring/Summer issue and are working to get back to our regular quarterly print schedule with the Fall and Winter issues. 

Like many, we are rebuilding and moving forward -
and would greatly appreciate your help.
 

 

 

Whether or not you can make a financial contribution at the moment,
we'd still really appreciate your help in spreading the word about this campaign.
Share this page via social media, or mentioning Authentic Texas to your friends.

Thank you!
___________________________

The Spring 2021 Authentic Texas magazine promo video; this issue featured the heritage of aviation in Texas.

 

Our promo video for Fall 2020 Authentic Texas magazine; the issue highlighted the literary heritage of Texas and featured Hank the Cowdog as our "Authentic Person" and cover image.

story:
GRASSROOTS HERITAGE: THE MANY UNTOLD STORIES OF A TAIWAN CEMETERY

 

 

INTRODUCTION / 導言

Grassroots Heritage: The Many Untold Stories of A Taiwan Cemetery  is a publication about a cemetery in Taiwan. It explores the rich cultural value cemeteries have, which, due to superstitions, are completely ignored… and destroyed.

Few people realize the cemeteries in Taiwan are treasure troves of cultural heritage, artwork, lost or forgotten genealogy, some compelling mysteries, and yes… even treasure.

Preference for development means many heritage cemeteries are being bulldozed. It’s estimated within 10 years there will be no more cemeteries left in Taiwan.

This book looks at one cemetery in northern Taiwan as a litmus test for heritage preservation. Author James X. Morris has been collecting information and stories, and salvaging artifacts with a coalition of preservationists as the Xindian First Public Cemetery has fallen victim to bulldozers and city development. No archaeological survey was done before its destruction, and the only way the stories were documented was through the efforts of preservationists. The hope is to inspire a public recognition that cemeteries are heritage.

In partnership with two leading voices on Taiwan humanities—SMC Publishing in Taipei and the Asia-Pacific SpatioTemporal Institute at National Chengchi University in Taipei—Grassroots Heritage is a book about the many untold stories sitting in plain sight, ignored by most Taiwan history books. Part history book, part art catalogue, part investigative journalism, and part warning call, Grassroots Heritage collects and presents the untold stories of one cemetery to inspire a new understanding of the central storytelling role cemeteries around the world play in helping communities know their heritage.

GRASSROOTS HERITAGE: THE MANY UNTOLD STORIES OF A TAIWAN CEMETERY是個關於台灣的一座墓園的書。 它探討了墓園所具有的豐富文化價值，這些文化價值，由於迷信，被完全忽視......并且被摧毀。
很少人意識到台灣的墓園是個珍貴的寶庫，其蘊藏著文化遺產、藝術品、被丟失或被遺忘的家譜、一些扣人心弦的謎團，甚至......沒錯，甚至寶藏。
對發展的偏愛意味著許多公墓遺產正在被推土機鏟平。 根據估計，10年之內台灣將不再有墓園。
這本書著眼於台灣北部的一座墓園作為遺產保護的試金石。 作者James X. Morris一直在收集信息和故事，並與一群保護主義者們共同搶救文物，因為新店第一公墓已成為推土機和城市發展的犧牲品。 在新店第一公墓被破壞之前，該公墓並沒有被進行過任何考古調查，而有關該公墓的許多故事之所以能被記錄，全是靠保護主義者們的努力。 希望能激發公眾認識到墓園是文化遺產。
與台灣人文學科的兩個先鋒合作 - 台北的南天書局（SMC Publishing ）和台北國立政治大學的亞太時空資訊研究所（Asia-Pacific SpatioTemporal Institute——Grassroots Heritage 這本書是關於許多未被敘述且被大多數台灣歷史書籍所忽視的故事。 一部分是歷史書、一部分是藝術圖錄，一部分是調查性報道和一部分是警訊，Grassroots Heritage 收集並呈現一座墓園的許多故事，以激發人們對於墓園，這個橫跨世界各地的主要故事敘述者，產生一種新的理解，以此幫助社區了解他們的文化遺產。

 

CONTENTS / 内容

 

HISTORY / 歷史
Grassroots Heritage shares the history of northern Taiwan, zeroing in on Xindian District, and exploring the traditional practices associated with death, burial, and ancestor worship. What’s explored? Chinese religion, cosmology, and fengshui on the one hand. On the other, you’ll be presented with northern Taiwan’s historical, social, and economic developments… and find that all of this information and more is expressed through the structures, stones, and motifs found in Xindian First Public Cemetery. With pictures, of course!

Grassroots Heritage 敘述台灣北部的歷史，從新店區開始，並探索與死亡、埋葬和祭拜祖先相關的傳統習俗。 有什麽被探索？一方面是 中國宗教，宇宙學和風水，另一方面，您將看到台灣北部的歷史、社會和經濟發展......並發現所有這些信息，以及發現這些信息多是通過新店第一公墓的結構、石頭和圖案來表達。 當然，附上圖片！

 

CATALOGUE / 目錄
Grassroots Heritage features beautiful annotated color photography of Xindian First Public Cemetery. With cameras hanging 100 meters in the air or placed in the holes in the ground, tombs, tombstones, artwork, and motifs found in the cemetery are presented in beautiful detail. Photos of tombs and their components are described and their role in northern Taiwan’s heritage is explained. Here, you’ll learn more about the application of religion, cosmology, aesthetics, and practices.

Grassroots Heritage 為新店第一公墓提供精美的彩色攝影作品。 攝像機懸掛在空中100米或放置在地面的洞中，在墓園中發現的墳墓、墓碑、藝術品和圖案，都以精美細節呈現。 本書描述了墓葬及其組成部分的照片，並解釋了它們在台灣北部地區文化遺產中的角色。 在這裡，您將學習更多關於宗教，宇宙學，美學和實踐的應用。

 

JOURNALISM / 新聞報道
Not standing idly by, Grassroots Heritage explores the developments leading to cemetery destruction in Taiwan, and follows the preservationists’ efforts to educate the community and request a moratorium on destruction. Developments are explored from the overgrown cemetery to City Hall and the 2018 National Cultural Heritage Congress. More than documenting meetings and protests, the book penetrates the background and foreground of these developments. Why are culture departments weak against economic interests? Why are all local governments undertaking the same actions? How legal is the demolition of cemeteries? What went wrong, and what are lessons that can be learned?

Grassroots Heritage 並沒有袖手旁觀，它探討了導致台灣墓地破壞的發展，並遵循保護主義者教育社區並要求暫停銷毀的努力。 從雜草叢生的墓園，到市政廳，以及2018年國家文化資產大會，本書探索了各種發展。 這本書不僅僅是記錄會議和抗議活動，而是滲透了這些發展的背景和前景。 為什麼面對經濟利益，文化局較弱？ 為什麼所有地方政府都採取同樣的行動？ 拆除墓園究竟有多合法？ 什麽出了問題，有什麽教訓可以被吸取？

 

WARNING CALL / 警訊
Grassroots Heritage memorializes Xindian First Public Cemetery. As a historical analysis, it provides Xindian, Taiwan, and the world with an understanding of the transcendent heritage found in a local cemetery. The book hopefully inspires the reader to recognize the ignored heritage in their community, and serves as a warning to proactively safeguard such sites.

Grassroots Heritage 紀念新店第一公墓。 作為一種歷史分析，它為新店、台灣以及世界各地提供了對當地墓園中卓越的文化遺產的一種理解。 希望本書能激發讀者認識到社區中被忽視的文化遺產，并作爲積極地保護這類遺址的警訊。

 

 

 

WHY THE TITLE? / 標題的意涵


Grassroots Heritage is a double entendre. On the one hand, it’s about heritage that can be found literally where the grass roots grow. On the other hand, and more importantly, it reflects the fact that very few tangible artifacts of Taiwan’s common person’s day-to-day life can be found untouched. The island’s more popular heritage--its temples, events, and buildings--have been changed or modified over the centuries to suit the needs of the island’s government. Over the past 400 years Taiwan has been settled and administered by successive waves of migrants, conquerors, and colonists. The winners write history. The Dutch, Ming Dynasty loyalists, Qing Dynasty, Imperial Japan, and more recently the martial law of the Nationalist government were the writers, and each successive regime put its stamp nearly everywhere. Tomb assemblages and tombstones largely managed to escape the censors, and were used by the Taiwanese as means to express themselves. Some were even used as markers of political dissent.

If you want to find Taiwan grassroots heritage, it’s in the cemeteries.

Grassroots Heritage 是一個雙關語。一方面，它指的是能在草根生長之處發現的文化遺產。另一方面，更重要的是，它反映了這樣一個事實，即台灣民衆的日常生活中幾乎難以發現任何有形文物是原封未動的。這島嶼更受歡迎的遺產，即寺廟、活動和建築，已經經歷過幾個世紀的改變或修改，以滿足島上政府的需求。在過去的400年裡，台灣一直由移民、征服者和殖民者的浪潮定居和管理。勝者寫歷史。荷蘭、明朝的效忠者、清朝，日本的帝國，以及近代的國民政府的戒嚴都是作家，且每個歷届政權都在到處留下他們的印記。墓葬組合和墓碑在很大程度上逃脫了審查，並被台灣人用作表達自己的手段。有些甚至被用作政治異議的標誌。

如果你想找到台灣的草根遺產，它就在墓園裡。

 

 

PUBLISHING TIMEFRAME / 出版之時間框架


The fieldwork for Grassroots Heritage is already complete. The next steps are to organize the contents and prepare the final draft for publication with Southern Materials Company (南天書局), the most prolific international Taiwan studies publishing house located in Taipei.

Estimated delivery time will be in the winter of 2018/2019. English versions of the book will be made available from this campaign. My hope is to eventually have books printed in traditional Chinese characters at a later date (not part of this campaign).

Grassroots Heritage 的實地考察工作已經完成。 接下來的步驟是組織內容，並為南方書局（Southern Materials Company）準備最終草稿，這是位於台北的最多產的國際台灣研究出版社。

預計交貨時間為2018/2019冬季。 此活動提供的是英文版本的書。 我希望的是最終本書能有繁體中文的譯本（不是本次活動的一部分）。

 

 

YOUR PLEDGES GO A LONG WAY

BRINGING THIS PROJECT TO LIFE… and then some

This project is starting with an initial fundraising goal of US$5,000 (approximately NTD150,000).

該項目的初始籌款目標為5,000美元（約合150,000新台幣）。

 

ADDITIONAL GOALS / 其他目標

$6,000 (approximately NTD185,000)… EXTRA CHAPTER
If we can raise an additional US$1,000 (NTD30,000) above the goal before the campaign period ends, I will include an extra chapter of interviews in the book, including experts on the mortuary industry in Taiwan, members of the preservation advocacy coalition, local clan leaders, academics, and if we’re lucky (fingers crossed) some public officials.

$ 6,000（約合新台幣158,000）......額外章節
如果我們可以在募款活動結束前募集比原定目標還要多1000美元（新台幣30,000新台幣），我會在書中加入一個額外的訪談章節，包括台灣太平間產業專家、保護主義者聯盟的成員、 當地宗族領袖，學者，如果我們幸運（希望）還能采訪一些公職人員。

 

$10,000 (approximately NTD300,000)... DOCUMENTARY
Over the years, hours upon hours of videos and photos were collected in the cemetery and at the protests. If we can double the fundraising goal before the campaign period ends, we will be able to make a documentary film about the cemetery, its heritage, destruction, and preservation attempts.

10,000美元（約合新台幣300,000）......紀錄片
多年來，在墓園和抗議活動中收集了數小時的視頻和照片。 如果我們能夠在募款活動結束前將籌款目標翻倍，我們將能夠拍攝一個關於該墓園，其遺產、破壞和保存的紀錄片。

 

PLEDGE TIERS AND PERKS / 資助等級和額外津貼

Your help makes this book possible, and will cover the costs of writing, editing, layout, fact-checking, interviews, and translations.

There are several tiers you can pledge to based on your preference which come with awards as a way to say thank you. You can also choose to contribute without claiming any perks. Please see below (figures in US dollars):

您的資助將會使本書成為可能，資金將會用在編寫、編輯、佈局、事實檢查、訪談和翻譯的費用。 您可以根據您的偏好決定資助等級。 作為一種表示感謝的方式，有一系列個性化獎品作為對您支持的回禮。 請看下面（美元數字）：

 

$10 ... A certificate of support!
At this level you'll receive a certificate with a thank you note in the mail for your contribution to this project.

10美元.....一封支持證書！
在這個級別，您將收到一封證書，郵件中附有感謝信，感謝您對此項目的貢獻。

 

$25 … Same award as the previous level (certificate), plus…
Your name will be listed in the final product (please indicate if you wish to remain anonymous), and

25美元......與上一級相同，加上......
您的名字將列在最終產品中（如果您希望保持匿名，請註明），以及

 

$50 … Same awards as previous levels, plus...
You’ll receive a signed companion booklet of writings by the author on this subject, including unpublished conference papers and news articles

50美元......與上一級相同，加上......
您將收到一份由作者撰寫的關於該主題的已簽名小冊子，包括未發表的研討會論文和新聞文章

 

$100 … Same awards as previous levels, plus…
The reason for this campaign! Because you're helping so much, a signed copy of "Grassroots Heritage: The Many Untold Stories of A Taiwan Cemetery" is yours as a way to say thank you!

100美元......與上一級相同，加上......
這個募款活動的原因！ 因為您給予的幫助很多，所以您將收到一本已簽名的 Grassroots Heritage: The Many Untold Stories of A Taiwan Cemetery 副本作爲對您表達謝謝的一種方式！

 

$200 … Same awards as previous levels, plus…
A signed behind-the-scenes book covering the past three years’ fieldwork in the cemetery, the work of the preservationist coalition, and the development of this book. Extras include additional photos from the fieldsite and preservation efforts, an annotated timeline of behind-the-scenes events, reproductions of fieldnotes, and more descriptions of the research.

200美元......與上一級相同，加上......
一本已簽名的幕後場景書，涵蓋了過去三年墓園實地考察，保護主義者聯盟的工作以及本書的發展。 附加內容包括來自現場的額外照片和保存工作的照片、幕後事件的註釋時間表、田野筆記的複本以及更多的研究描述。

 

$400 … Same awards as previous levels, and…
Double the set. Two sets of all three books (Grassroots Heritage, the introduction booklet, and the behind-the-scenes book). Keep one for yourself and give the other as a gift!

400美元......與上一級相同，還有...... 雙倍配套。 兩套全部的三本書（Grassroots Heritage、小冊子和幕後書）。 不僅能為自己保留一套，另一套還可以作為禮物送給他人哦！

 

WHAT DOES YOUR FUNDING SUPPORT? / 您的資金資助著什麼？
Your generous contribution helps offset research and production expenses. In general, 

  • Primary costs - research, writing, editing
    (to offset the manuscript's production costs)
  • Secondary sources - copyright licensing, interviews, translations
    (to source additional photos and materials from collaborators and to compensate experts for their time)
  • Miscellaneous expenses

您的慷慨捐助有助於抵消研究和生產費用。 一般來說，

  • 主要成本 - 研究，寫作，編輯
    （以抵消稿件的製作成本）
  • 二手資料來源 - 版權許可，訪談，翻譯
    （從合作者那裡獲取額外的照片和材料，以及補償專家們付出的時間）
  • 雜項開支

 

 

ABOUT THE AUTHOR / 有關作者


James X. Morris is a Ph.D. candidate in Asia-Pacific Studies at National Chengchi University in Taipei, Taiwan. He has been studying cemeteries, tombs, and neighborhood shrines in Taiwan, islands of the Taiwan Strait, Hong Kong, and Macau for three years for his dissertation.

James is a contributing blogger/writer focusing mainly on Taiwan’s social issues for The Diplomat. He has written several pieces on Taiwan’s destruction of heritage and social issues for The Diplomat and The News Lens International.

In 2015 he launched his first book, Primaryland: A Trip Through the 2012 New Hampshire Primary, available for Amazon Kindle.

James X. Morris是一名台灣台北國立政治大學亞太研究所博士生。 三年以來，爲了撰寫論文，他在台灣、台灣海峽、香港和澳門的島嶼上研究墓園、墓葬和鄰里神社。

James是一位博主/撰稿人，為The Diplomat 撰寫主要關注台灣社會問題的文章。 他為The Diplomat和The News Lens International 撰寫了幾篇關於台灣文化遺產的破壞和社會問題的文章。

2015年，他推出了他的第一本書，Primaryland: A Trip Through the 2012 New Hampshire Primary，此書能在Amazon Kindle購買。

 

 

 

 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES / 風險和挑戰


The fieldwork is complete, most of the research has been done, and a publishing house has been found. You can pledge with confidence. Once the project is funded, a period of 2 or 3 months is needed to put everything together.

田野調查已經完成，大部分研究已經完成，並且已經找到了出版社。 你可以放心地資助。 項目獲得資助後，需要2到3個月的時間才能完成所有工作。

GRASSROOTS HERITAGE: THE MANY UNTOLD STORIES OF A TAIWAN CEMETERY  INTRODUCTION / 導言
Grassroots Heritage: The Many Untold Stories of A Taiwan Cemetery  is a publication about a cemetery in Taiwan. It explores the rich cultural value cemeteries have, which, due to superstitions, are completely ignored… and destroyed.Few people realize the cemeteries in Taiwan are treasure troves of cultural heritage, artwork, lost or forgotten genealogy, some compelling mysteries, and yes… even treasure.Preference for development means many heritage cemeteries are being bulldozed. It’s estimated within 10 years there will be no more cemeteries left in Taiwan.This book looks at one cemetery in northern Taiwan as a litmus test for heritage preservation. Author James X. Morris has been collecting information and stories, and salvaging artifacts with a coalition of preservationists as the Xindian First Public Cemetery has fallen victim to bulldozers and city development. No archaeological survey was done before its destruction, and the only way the stories were documented was through the efforts of preservationists. The hope is to inspire a public recognition that cemeteries are heritage.In partnership with two leading voices on Taiwan humanities—SMC Publishing in Taipei and the Asia-Pacific SpatioTemporal Institute at National Chengchi University in Taipei—Grassroots Heritage is a book about the many untold stories sitting in plain sight, ignored by most Taiwan history books. Part history book, part art catalogue, part investigative journalism, and part warning call, Grassroots Heritage collects and presents the untold stories of one cemetery to inspire a new understanding of the central storytelling role cemeteries around the world play in helping communities know their heritage.GRASSROOTS HERITAGE: THE MANY UNTOLD STORIES OF A TAIWAN CEMETERY是個關於台灣的一座墓園的書。 它探討了墓園所具有的豐富文化價值，這些文化價值，由於迷信，被完全忽視......并且被摧毀。很少人意識到台灣的墓園是個珍貴的寶庫，其蘊藏著文化遺產、藝術品、被丟失或被遺忘的家譜、一些扣人心弦的謎團，甚至......沒錯，甚至寶藏。對發展的偏愛意味著許多公墓遺產正在被推土機鏟平。 根據估計，10年之內台灣將不再有墓園。這本書著眼於台灣北部的一座墓園作為遺產保護的試金石。 作者James X. Morris一直在收集信息和故事，並與一群保護主義者們共同搶救文物，因為新店第一公墓已成為推土機和城市發展的犧牲品。 在新店第一公墓被破壞之前，該公墓並沒有被進行過任何考古調查，而有關該公墓的許多故事之所以能被記錄，全是靠保護主義者們的努力。 希望能激發公眾認識到墓園是文化遺產。與台灣人文學科的兩個先鋒合作 - 台北的南天書局（SMC Publishing ）和台北國立政治大學的亞太時空資訊研究所（Asia-Pacific SpatioTemporal Institute——Grassroots Heritage 這本書是關於許多未被敘述且被大多數台灣歷史書籍所忽視的故事。 一部分是歷史書、一部分是藝術圖錄，一部分是調查性報道和一部分是警訊，Grassroots Heritage 收集並呈現一座墓園的許多故事，以激發人們對於墓園，這個橫跨世界各地的主要故事敘述者，產生一種新的理解，以此幫助社區了解他們的文化遺產。 CONTENTS / 内容 HISTORY / 歷史Grassroots Heritage shares the history of northern Taiwan, zeroing in on Xindian District, and exploring the traditional practices associated with death, burial, and ancestor worship. What’s explored? Chinese religion, cosmology, and fengshui on the one hand. On the other, you’ll be presented with northern Taiwan’s historical, social, and economic developments… and find that all of this information and more is expressed through the structures, stones, and motifs found in Xindian First Public Cemetery. With pictures, of course!Grassroots Heritage 敘述台灣北部的歷史，從新店區開始，並探索與死亡、埋葬和祭拜祖先相關的傳統習俗。 有什麽被探索？一方面是 中國宗教，宇宙學和風水，另一方面，您將看到台灣北部的歷史、社會和經濟發展......並發現所有這些信息，以及發現這些信息多是通過新店第一公墓的結構、石頭和圖案來表達。 當然，附上圖片！ CATALOGUE / 目錄Grassroots Heritage features beautiful annotated color photography of Xindian First Public Cemetery. With cameras hanging 100 meters in the air or placed in the holes in the ground, tombs, tombstones, artwork, and motifs found in the cemetery are presented in beautiful detail. Photos of tombs and their components are described and their role in northern Taiwan’s heritage is explained. Here, you’ll learn more about the application of religion, cosmology, aesthetics, and practices.Grassroots Heritage 為新店第一公墓提供精美的彩色攝影作品。 攝像機懸掛在空中100米或放置在地面的洞中，在墓園中發現的墳墓、墓碑、藝術品和圖案，都以精美細節呈現。 本書描述了墓葬及其組成部分的照片，並解釋了它們在台灣北部地區文化遺產中的角色。 在這裡，您將學習更多關於宗教，宇宙學，美學和實踐的應用。 JOURNALISM / 新聞報道Not standing idly by, Grassroots Heritage explores the developments leading to cemetery destruction in Taiwan, and follows the preservationists’ efforts to educate the community and request a moratorium on destruction. Developments are explored from the overgrown cemetery to City Hall and the 2018 National Cultural Heritage Congress. More than documenting meetings and protests, the book penetrates the background and foreground of these developments. Why are culture departments weak against economic interests? Why are all local governments undertaking the same actions? How legal is the demolition of cemeteries? What went wrong, and what are lessons that can be learned?Grassroots Heritage 並沒有袖手旁觀，它探討了導致台灣墓地破壞的發展，並遵循保護主義者教育社區並要求暫停銷毀的努力。 從雜草叢生的墓園，到市政廳，以及2018年國家文化資產大會，本書探索了各種發展。 這本書不僅僅是記錄會議和抗議活動，而是滲透了這些發展的背景和前景。 為什麼面對經濟利益，文化局較弱？ 為什麼所有地方政府都採取同樣的行動？ 拆除墓園究竟有多合法？ 什麽出了問題，有什麽教訓可以被吸取？ WARNING CALL / 警訊Grassroots Heritage memorializes Xindian First Public Cemetery. As a historical analysis, it provides Xindian, Taiwan, and the world with an understanding of the transcendent heritage found in a local cemetery. Primary costs - research, writing, editing(to offset the manuscript's production costs)

您的慷慨捐助有助於抵消研究和生產費用。 一般來說，
