Morris是一名台灣台北國立政治大學亞太研究所博士生。 三年以來，爲了撰寫論文，他在台灣、台灣海峽、香港和澳門的島嶼上研究墓園、墓葬和鄰里神社。James是一位博主/撰稿人，為The Diplomat 撰寫主要關注台灣社會問題的文章。 他為The Diplomat和The News Lens International 撰寫了幾篇關於台灣文化遺產的破壞和社會問題的文章。2015年，他推出了他的第一本書，Primaryland: A Trip Through the 2012 New Hampshire Primary，此書能在Amazon Kindle購買。    RISKS AND CHALLENGES / 風險和挑戰The fieldwork is complete, most of the research has been done, and a publishing house has been found. story:
SECOND WEDNESDAY

Welcome to the InDemand continuation of the Indiegogo campaign for Second Wednesday! The InDemand status will continue while we're getting ready to print the book, so feel free support this campaign knowing that you can still get your copy of the novel.

  •  All physical level backers will also receive "Saturday Night (The Usual)," the first Michelle Benson solo short story as a digital file and a SECOND WEDNESDAY bookmark in addition to their books.
  • Because we met our $3,000 stretch goal, all physical level backers will also receive another short story, "McManus & McQueen," and an audio short story version of "Saturday Night (The Usual),"

Who killed Roger Hollander?

          For more than a year, the grizzliest murder in the history of the normally sleepy, mid-cities town of Hurst, Texas has gone unsolved. With the Roger Hollander case growing colder by the day and desperate for any kind of breakthrough, the victim’s mother turns to private investigators Donovan Bay and Michelle Benson. 

          They dig in immediately, but the more they dig, the worse the victim looks, the more potential suspects they find, and the deeper the mystery becomes!

SECOND WEDNESDAY is the debut novel from veteran writer J.C. Vaughn, the creator-writer of the graphic novels Vampire, PA and Zombie-Proof, the crime comic series McCandless & Company, and mystery/romance Antiques: The Comic Strip. He's the co-writer of three acclaimed one-shots and a mini-series from IDW Publishing based on the hit Fox TV show 24, and the comics series Stargate Atlantis and Stargate Universe, based on the MGM TV series, for American Mythology Productions. He's probably best known as Vice-President of Publishing for Gemstone Publishing, the home of The Overstreet Comic Book Price Guide, which is presently celebrating its 50th anniversary.

With compelling characters, fast food cravings, jazz, and plenty of Texas ambiance, SECOND WEDNESDAY introduces the private investigator team of Donovan Bay and Michelle Benson as they work the Hollander mystery. At the same time, a second, pop culture-infused case confronts them with missing high-end comic books worth half a million dollars!

TWO EDITIONS

  • Both editions of SECOND WEDNESDAY feature the incredible, smoldering cover by renowned Marvel Comics and Edgar Rice Burroughs artist JOE JUSKO and were designed by Marvel Bullpen veteran Dawn Guzzo!
  • The Standard Edition, which should reach readers a month before it hits bookstores, comes with an exclusive SECOND WEDNESDAY bookmark!
  • The Deluxe Edition features exclusive spot illustrations by BILLY TUCCI (Shi: Return of the Warrior, Sgt. Rock: The Lost Battalion), JOHN K. SNYDER III (Eight Million Ways To Die, Fashion In Action), MARY WILSHIRE (Red Sonja, Firestar), JOE JAMES (Dark Dominion, Knights on Broadway), ED CATTO (Captain Action, Bedtime Stories For Impressionable Children), ALEX SAVIUK (Web of Spider-Man, Amazing Spider-Man), MARK WHEATLEY (Breathtaker, Mars), and CHRIS EVENHUIS (Wynonna Earp), as well as the exclusive SECOND WEDNESDAY bookmark!
  • One lucky backer can also get Billy Tucci's original art of Donovan Bay and Michelle Benson, the first-ever illustration of the characters!

ABOUT THE ART

Check out the PopXP channel's interview about SECOND WEDNESDAY right at the deadline. 

 

YOUR IMPACT

Doing this novel is a dream come true. If you back this Indiegogo campaign, you're helping not make the deluxe edition possible and you're helping to speed up the timetable for the standard edition. Our last campaign, McCandless & Company: Crime Scenes, reached fans up to two months earlier than promised. With your help, we'll do it again! 

OTHER OFFERINGS

  • With THE CRIME PACK you get the SECOND WEDNESDAY Limited Edition plus copies of the recently released McCANDLESS & COMPANY: CRIME SCENES comic book and the McCANDLESS & COMPANY: INSECURITIES graphic novel.

  • With THE JCV PACK you get the SECOND WEDNESDAY Limited Edition novel, the VAMPIRE, PA graphic novel (Standard edition), the VAMPIRE, PA: BITE OUT OF CRIME one-shot (Asha Kishna cover), the McCANDLESS & COMPANY: CRIME SCENES one-shot (Amanda Conner cover), the McCANDLESS & COMPANY: INSECURITIES graphic novel, and the ZOMBIE-PROOF collected edition trade paperback!
  • And like the name would indicate, with THE JCV PACK - INDIEGOGO EXCLUSIVE you get the SECOND WEDNESDAY Limited Edition novel, the VAMPIRE, PA graphic novel (Standard edition), the VAMPIRE, PA: BITE OUT OF CRIME one-shot (Indiegogo Exclusive edition), the McCANDLESS & COMPANY: CRIME SCENES one-shot (Indiegogo Exclusive edition), the McCANDLESS & COMPANY: INSECURITIES graphic novel, and the ZOMBIE-PROOF collected edition trade paperback!

  • There are also some add-ons available.

Risks & Challenges

If you supported McCANDLESS & COMPANY: CRIME SCENES, you know that instead of meeting our goal to deliver the comics by the end of February 2021, we beat it by at least a month and in some cases by two months!

  • Our goal always is to be on time or better. However, we can't control acts of God, medical emergencies, COVID-inspired shutdowns, and the like.
  • What we can control is that the files will be ready for the printer before this project ends, only requiring an update if a backer or backers select the option(s) of having a character or characters named after them, in which case we'll go to press as soon as the credit cards clear on Kickstarter.
  • Presently that period, up to two weeks, is the only delay we can anticipate.

Other Ways You Can Help

It doesn't take much to see that many folks just aren't in a position to back a campaign right now. If you're one of them, that doesn't mean you can't help! You can always do the following:

  • Share our link on your social media!
  • Tell your friends about us!
  • Email friends you know would be into this sort of entertainment! 

THANKS!

story:
My name is Donte Woods-Spikes. In Columbus Ohio, I’m known for using different forms of storytelling to encourage empathy among communities. In 2016 I gave a TEDx talk titled Young Black Men, Not Left Out Again. In 2020, my documentary film As a Matter of Black was selected as an official Sundance Film Festival selection. As of 2021, I'm in the process of finishing my first book:  So.Long. - Unfinished Good-byes with the Children of COVID-19.

After my dream of working with children became a reality, COVID-19 brought my dream to a halt. While the nation was forced into quarantine, I began reflecting on every powerful lesson different children taught me. Children I had worked with as a teacher's aide shifted my disciplinary practices and forced me to address my own childhood traumas. They made me realize the lifetime impact my words and actions can have on children.

Every educator questions how much they impact children's lives. This book will invite them, parents, and child advocates into the raw world of children. This book is by far my most vulnerable and meaningful work to date. With your help, I'll be able to create a national dialogue revolving around the well-being of children. Thank you for all of your support.

This book will be published on Amazon as a print and e-book.  If we exceed our fundraising goals we can also have it produced as an audio book!  We are contracting with professional editors who can maintain my voice and dialect that most honestly reflects my experience with the children.  Our total costs will be near $2000 to produce the book.  The additional $1000 will help pay for the book release celebration that everyone is invited to attend at the Columbus Museum of Art on October 24 at 2:00pm!

Every contributor will receive a signed copy of the book.  You can also receive a pen, poster, t-shirt or book bag, as we all celebrate the stories of these amazing children.   For a special contribution, we will welcome you to the book release celebration as a special guest!

We are just beginning one of the most important nationwide conversations. Schools are intentionally incorporating trauma-informed care and initiatives dedicated towards emotional wellness for children. This book will encourage educators and child advocates to not only have conversations with themselves but also with their child within. 

My first fundraising attempt was for a laptop to begin recording and editing videos for documentary projects. As a result of support, I have created multiple documentaries, one received an award and one was an official Sundance Film Festival selection.  I'm excited to take my storytelling into this new format and expand the conversation. 

All support is great support! If you aren't able to donate to this campaign please consider sharing with all teachers and child advocates, as well parents who are interested in learning more about their children's worlds.

story:
Our story

We are the Buggans’ family – a little family of three who love driving our campervan around Ireland. 

Over the last few years, we’ve taken countless trips and learned so much about cooking with limited space, using the fridge to store beers for us and our friends, and how much more enjoyable brilliant tunes are when you’re outdoors with tasty grub.

So we’ve put together this Camping Soul Food cookbook with simple recipes you can do, either no-cook options or something you can cook on one gas ring or on a barbeque. Each recipe is paired with a playlist of Soul music.

In between, we’ve shared  camping and cooking hacks that we have found invaluable on our travels.

Every time we went on our travels, we dreamed about putting this book together. But inevitably, holiday mode took over and we were too busy enjoying time with our family and friends. We kept hand-written notes and saved bits and bobs on our phones each year with the promise that "this summer, we'll definitely put this together". And as fate would have it, it took the world to stop turning (and our family adventures to be put on hold) for us to find the time to work on this seriously. And with the support of amazing friends and professionals (shout out Amelia and Julia), we finally got the book we had imagined in our heads down on paper. 

We have been so fortunate to know and be introduced to amazing creative professionals who have the patience of many saints and an honour to work with. The book is complete and looks  better than we could have ever hoped for.

When we first started camping we would have brought way too stuff that just got in the way. After a couple of trips unloading boxes that were never opened we realised how little you actually need to enjoy the great outdoors. Our hope is that this book will lighten your load and get you into holiday mode a lot faster.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you share this story with family and friends who are into Camping, Music or Food that would mean a lot to us:

  • Send them the link to this campaign
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

Big Love

The Buggansesses.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Tamara and I am a mother and writer. There aren't any other things in my life that I am more passionate about. My writing career began in the Army where I served as a Photojournalist and Public Affairs officer (46Q) for 6 years, with one tour in Afghanistan. 

I was recently awarded a $2,000 scholarship to the Gateless Academy to help finish, edit, and traditionally market and publish my novel, Buttermilk. The remainder of the academy is $4,500. I am trying to gather the remaining cost of the 10-month program before the first part of the Academy starts in late September with a little extra to pay some bills so I can concentrate on writing over freelancing my life away. 

The program director contacted me personally to award me the scholarship and shared that my manuscript was one of the best she had received out of thousands they are sent every year. I am grateful for the opportunity and would hate to miss it because I do not have the rest of the money. 

 

BELOW IS FROM THE WEBSITE:

Gateless Writers Have:

  • Been repped by agents at Park and Fine, Writer's House, Inkwell, Defiore, Carol Mann, and more.
  • Signed book deals with Harpers, Simon and Schuster, Penguin Random House, St. Martin's Press and other houses.
  • Won and been shortlisted for prestigious international literary awards including Wigleaf, William Van Dyke, the William Faulkner Wisdom Award, Baltimore Review's Short Fiction prize, Pushcart Prizes, and more.
  • Been profiled in top media outlets, including the Boston Globe, the New York Times, Business Insider, O Magazine, Today, People and many others.

 

I am a disabled veteran and single mother and since COVID, I have not had the work available to me to save money to budget in this type of training. Your support will not only help me fulfill my dreams of becoming an author and publishing this book, but I will be able to prove to my daughter that everything is possible no matter where you are at in life if you just ask or put yourself out there. 

What I Need & What You Get

What I need is simple, funding to help me proceed with the Academy and a little extra to support me through the 10 months.

All those who donate will receive a signed published book with a handwritten letter from me thanking you for your support. 

The Impact

Your donation will allow me the dream of becoming an Author. It allows me a deadline and a process. I suffer from a personality disorder, anxiety, and depressive disorder due to events that took place in the military, which makes it hard for me to maintain steady work. I am constantly in therapy and have had no help with disability from the VA. However, being put into a program to help me finish this novel will give me the structure I need to follow through.

Short Summary
My name is Tamara and I am a mother and writer. There aren't any other things in my life that I am more passionate about. My writing career began in the Army where I served as a Photojournalist and Public Affairs officer (46Q) for 6 years, with one tour in Afghanistan. 
I was recently awarded a $2,000 scholarship to the Gateless Academy to help finish, edit, and traditionally market and publish my novel, Buttermilk. The remainder of the academy is $4,500. I am trying to gather the remaining cost of the 10-month program before the first part of the Academy starts in late September with a little extra to pay some bills so I can concentrate on writing over freelancing my life away. 
The program director contacted me personally to award me the scholarship and shared that my manuscript was one of the best she had received out of thousands they are sent every year. I am grateful for the opportunity and would hate to miss it because I do not have the rest of the money. 
 
BELOW IS FROM THE WEBSITE:
Gateless Writers Have:

Been repped by agents at Park and Fine, Writer's House, Inkwell, Defiore, Carol Mann, and more.
Signed book deals with Harpers, Simon and Schuster, Penguin Random House, St. Martin's Press and other houses.
Won and been shortlisted for prestigious international literary awards including Wigleaf, William Van Dyke, the William Faulkner Wisdom Award, Baltimore Review's Short Fiction prize, Pushcart Prizes, and more.
Been profiled in top media outlets, including the Boston Globe, the New York Times, Business Insider, O Magazine, Today, People and many others.

 
I am a disabled veteran and single mother and since COVID, I have not had the work available to me to save money to budget in this type of training. Your support will not only help me fulfill my dreams of becoming an author and publishing this book, but I will be able to prove to my daughter that everything is possible no matter where you are at in life if you just ask or put yourself out there. 

What I Need & What You Get
What I need is simple, funding to help me proceed with the Academy and a little extra to support me through the 10 months.
All those who donate will receive a signed published book with a handwritten letter from me thanking you for your support. 

The Impact
Your donation will allow me the dream of becoming an Author. It allows me a deadline and a process. I suffer from a personality disorder, anxiety, and depressive disorder due to events that took place in the military, which makes it hard for me to maintain steady work. I am constantly in therapy and have had no help with disability from the VA. However, being put into a program to help me finish this novel will give me the structure I need to follow through. 
It gives me hope, and I know that when this novel is published, It will be a #1 best seller. I have known it from the first word I typed. Due to my disabilities, there will be challenges. I need structure, accountability and guidance to complete this body of work, and that its what the Academy offers.
